translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: des ni don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid phra ba /
analyzed: des ni don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid phra ba /
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate being of one taste everywhere is subtle,

original: mchog tu phra ba /
analyzed: mchog tu phra ba /
translated: supremely subtle,

original: zab pa / mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: zab pa / mchog tu zab pa /
translated: profound, supremely profound,🔽and difficult to realize.

original: rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: difficult to realize,

original: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba /🔽mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: most difficult to realize,🔽and having fully awakened to perfect buddhahood,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang bsnyad cing gsal bar byas /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang bsnyad cing gsal bar byas /
translated: having fully awakened to perfect buddhahood, he has explained, made known,

original: rnam par phye /🔽gdags pa byas /
analyzed: rnam par phye / gdags pa byas /
translated: clarified,🔽designated,

original: rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu bstan to //
translated: and revealed it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?🔽Subhūti, that object of purification in the aggregates, I have taught to be the ultimate.

original: rab 'byor phung po rnams la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni ngas don dam pa yin par yongs su bstan cing rab 'byor skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zas rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor phung po rnams la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni ngas don dam pa yin par yongs su bstan cing rab 'byor skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zas rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang /
translated: Subhūti, in the sense bases, dependent origination, the sustenances, the truths,

original: khams rnams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / @52a * //
analyzed: khams rnams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / @52a * //
translated: the elements, the establishments of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / rab 'byor 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / rab 'byor 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and, Subhūti, the noble eightfold path,

original: ngas don dam pa yin par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngas don dam pa yin par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because I have taught that the referential object of purification is the ultimate.

original: phung po rnams la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang thams cad du ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang thams cad du ro gcig pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that referential object of purification in the aggregates is of one taste everywhere,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: and is not of different natures.

original: phung po rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: phung po rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the aggregates,

original: skye mched rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang thams cad du ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa de yang thams cad du ro gcig pa ste /
translated: the referential object of purification in the sense-spheres, up to and the noble eightfold path, is of one taste everywhere,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: and is not of different natures.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations

original: khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that that which is of one taste everywhere, whose defining characteristic is that it is not of different natures, is the ultimate.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa ni phung po gcig gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa rab tu rtogs nas /🔽yang de las gzhan pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / zas rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa ni phung po gcig gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa rab tu rtogs nas / yang de las gzhan pa'i phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / zas rnams dang / bden pa rnams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, a monk who practices yoga, having realized the suchness, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena of one aggregate,🔽does not seek the suchness, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena of the other aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, the sustenances, the truths, the establishments of mindfulness, the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so so dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa so so la de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yongs su tshol bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so so dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa so so la de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yongs su tshol bar mi byed kyi /
translated: the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the eightfold noble path individually, but

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis su med pa'i shes pa la brten pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba gnyis su med pa'i shes pa la brten pa de nyid kyis /
translated: based on the nondual cognition that follows suchness,

original: don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'dzin pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa kho nar byed de /
analyzed: don dam pa thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'dzin pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa kho nar byed de /
translated: and the defining characteristic of the ultimate as being of one taste everywhere, and he makes it understood that it is only a direct realization.

original: rab 'byor rnams grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnams grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations you should know that the defining characteristic of being of one taste everywhere is the ultimate.”

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ji ltar phung po dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zas dang / bden pa dang / khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi @52b rkang pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ji ltar phung po dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zas dang / bden pa dang / khams dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi @52b rkang pa dang /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, just as the aggregates, the bases, dependent origination, the foods, the truths, the constituents, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power,

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag 'di dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag 'di dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: the faculties, the powers, and the branches of awakening have different defining characteristics from each other, and just as the noble eightfold path has different defining characteristics from each other,

original: gal te chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni des na de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa yin zhing mtshan nyid rgyu las byung🔽ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni des na de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa yin zhing mtshan nyid rgyu las byung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the suchness of those phenomena, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, were to have a different characteristic, then suchness, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, would have a cause and would arise from a cause.

original: rgyu las byung ba nyid yin na ni 'dus byas yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba nyid yin na ni 'dus byas yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arose from a cause, it would be conditioned.

original: 'dus byas nyid yin na ni don dam pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid yin na ni don dam pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were conditioned, it would not be the ultimate.

original: don dam pa ma yin na ni don dam pa gzhan zhig yongs su btsal dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin na ni don dam pa gzhan zhig yongs su btsal dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not the ultimate, then another ultimate would have to be sought.

original: rab 'byor gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang / don dam pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa de'i don dam pa gzhan yongs su btsal bar bya mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang / don dam pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa de'i don dam pa gzhan yongs su btsal bar bya mi dgos kyi /
translated: Subhūti, because suchness, the ultimate, the selflessness of phenomena, does not arise from a cause, is not conditioned, is the ultimate, and another ultimate does not have to be sought,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽ma byung yang rung ste /🔽rtag gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung ste / rtag gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise,🔽the dharmatā of dharmas remains just as it is.

original: ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise,🔽the dharmatā of dharmas remains just as it is.

original: rtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to make it endure.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dbyings de ni rnam par gnas pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir ;
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dbyings de ni rnam par gnas pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir ;
translated: That element of dharmas remains just as it is.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, through this one of many explanations you should know that the ultimate is that which has the characteristic of being everywhere of one taste.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha' ni gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs du ma mtshan nyid tha dad pa la /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs du ma mtshan nyid tha dad pa la /
translated: space is the various kinds of forms, which have many different characteristics,

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: but it is without signs, without conceptualization, and unchanging.

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is the characteristic of being everywhere of one taste.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du don dam pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams la thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du don dam pa yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams la thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should see the ultimate in the same way, as the characteristic of all phenomena that have different characteristics being of one taste.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse:

original: don dam de ni tha dad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: don dam de ni tha dad pa ma yin te //
translated: The ultimate is not different,

original: kun tu ro gcig mtshan nyid sangs rgyas gsungs //
analyzed: kun tu ro gcig mtshan nyid sangs rgyas gsungs //
translated: the Buddha taught that it has one taste everywhere.

original: de la gang dag tha dad kun rtog pa //
analyzed: de la gang dag tha dad kun rtog pa //
translated: Those who conceive of it as different

original: de dag nga rgyal gnas pa rmongs pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: de dag nga rgyal gnas pa rmongs pa yin // zhes gsungs pa'o /
translated: are ignorant and remain in pride.

original: // / bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / bam po sum cu brgyad pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse:

original: de la sems @53a * //
analyzed: de la sems @53a * //
translated: The mind is like an illusion,🔽the Tathāgata has taught.

original: kyi mtshan nyid ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: kyi mtshan nyid ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: The characteristic of the mind should be seen as it is taught in the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention:

original: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pas zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pas zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Vast Intelligence asked the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: Blessed One, when it is said that bodhisattvas are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, to what extent are bodhisattvas skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par yang dag par 'dogs na yang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par yang dag par 'dogs na yang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /
translated: When the Thus-Gone One authentically designates bodhisattvas as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness, to what extent does he designate them as such?”🔽The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Vast Intelligence:

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Vast Intelligence, it is excellent, excellent that you have asked the Thus-Gone One about this matter.

original: blo gros yangs pa khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: “O Viśālamati, you have set out in this way for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings, out of sympathy for the world, and for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of a great multitude of beings, including gods and humans.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
translated: It is excellent that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about this very matter.

original: legs so // blo gros yangs pa de'i phyir nyon cig dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: legs so // blo gros yangs pa de'i phyir nyon cig dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: O Viśālamati, listen well and keep this in mind! I will explain to you the skill in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa khyod 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na sems can gang dang gang dag sems can gyi rigs gang dang gang du yang sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas sam /🔽yang na mngal nas skye ba'am /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa khyod 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na sems can gang dang gang dag sems can gyi rigs gang dang gang du yang sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas sam / yang na mngal nas skye ba'am /
translated: O Viśālamati, in this saṃsāra of the six destinies, whatever beings there are, in whatever class of beings, whether born from an egg,🔽or born from a womb,

original: yang na drod gsher las skye ba'am /
analyzed: yang na drod gsher las skye ba'am /
translated: or born from heat and moisture,

original: yang na rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su lus mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba der dang por 'di ltar len pa rnam pa gnyis po gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can len pa dang / mtshan ma dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i spros pa'i bag chags len pa la brten nas /🔽sa bon thams cad pa'i sems rnam par smin cing 'jug la /
analyzed: yang na rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su lus mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba der dang por 'di ltar len pa rnam pa gnyis po gnas dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can len pa dang / mtshan ma dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i spros pa'i bag chags len pa la brten nas / sa bon thams cad pa'i sems rnam par smin cing 'jug la /
translated: Or else, in the case of those who are born supernaturally, the body is first formed and appears there, based on the two kinds of grasping: the grasping of the physical sense faculties together with their bases, and the grasping of the latent tendencies of the proliferation of conceptual thought that is the conventional designation of signs and names.

original: rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas shing 'phel ba dang / yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that contains all the seeds develops, grows, increases, and expands.

original: @53b de la gzugs can gyi khams na ni len pa gnyi ga yod la /
analyzed: @53b de la gzugs can gyi khams na ni len pa gnyi ga yod la /
translated: In the form realm, both kinds of grasping exist.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams na ni len pa gnyis su med do //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams na ni len pa gnyis su med do //
translated: In the formless realm, there is no grasping of the two kinds.

original: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: O Viśālamati, that consciousness is also called the appropriating consciousness.

original: 'di ltar des lus 'di bzung zhing blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des lus 'di bzung zhing blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appropriates and grasps this body.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the foundation consciousness.

original: 'di ltar de lus 'di la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis kun tu sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de lus 'di la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis kun tu sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the foundation for the body and is the basis for the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the mind.

original: 'di ltar de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyis kyang kun tu bsags pa dang / nye bar bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyis kyang kun tu bsags pa dang / nye bar bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro // blo gros yangs pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: Because it is the basis for the accumulation of the six sense objects of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: “Ānanda, the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the appropriating consciousness and the six sense bases.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag 'byung ngo //🔽de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag 'byung ngo // de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas /
translated: They are the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: “Ānanda, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dag lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dag lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: The eye consciousnesses operate simultaneously,

original: dus mtshungs pa /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa /
translated: at the same time,

original: spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: with the same object,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: and a conceptual mental consciousness also arises.

original: blo gros yangs pa de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / reg bya rnams la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / reg bya rnams la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-rāja, in the same way, the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses arise in dependence on the body and tangible objects.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: The body consciousness operates simultaneously,

original: dus mtshungs pa /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa /
translated: at the same time,

original: spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: with the same object,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: and a conceptual mental consciousness also arises.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lhan cig 'byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lhan cig 'byung na ni /
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-rāja, if one eye consciousness arises,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: then a mental consciousness with the same object as the eye consciousness

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo //🔽gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam /🔽gsum mam bzhi lan cig gam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo // gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam / gsum mam bzhi lan cig gam /
translated: The conceptual mental consciousness arises only once.

original: lnga char lan cig 'byung na yang /🔽der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: lnga char lan cig 'byung na yang / der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: If two, three, four, or even all five collections of consciousness arise,🔽then the conceptual mental consciousness,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par @54a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par @54a * //
translated: which has the same object-field as the five collections of consciousness,

original: shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: also arises only once.

original: blo gros yangs pa 'di lta ste dper na chu klung chen po 'bab pa la /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa 'di lta ste dper na chu klung chen po 'bab pa la /
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-rāja, it is like this: for example, in a great river that flows,

original: gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: if the conditions for the arising of a single wave are present,

original: rlabs kyang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rlabs kyang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: then a single wave arises.🔽If the conditions for the arising of two waves are present,

original: gal te rlabs gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te rlabs gnyis sam /
translated: then two waves arise.

original: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the conditions for the arising of many waves are present,

original: rlabs kyang gnyis ma rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing /
analyzed: rlabs kyang gnyis ma rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing /
translated: then many waves arise.

original: chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun 'chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun 'chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: The river’s flow is not interrupted by its own current.

original: yongs su zad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su zad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not come to an end.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la yang /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la yang /
translated: In the case of a very clear mirror,

original: gal te gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: if the conditions for the arising of a single reflection are present,

original: gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: then a single reflection arises.🔽If the conditions for the arising of two reflections are present,

original: gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
translated: then two reflections arise.

original: gal te gzugs brnyan rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa gyur na /
translated: If the conditions for the arising of many reflections are present,

original: gzugs brnyan yang gnyis sam rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang gnyis sam rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing /
translated: then many reflections arise.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin na /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin na /
translated: The surface of the mirror does not change into the entity of the reflections.

original: yongs su sbyor bar yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyor bar yang mi mngon no //
translated: It does not appear to be engaged in any activity.

original: blo gros yangs pa de bzhin du chu klung lta bu dang / me long lta bu'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de bzhin du chu klung lta bu dang / me long lta bu'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: “Viśālamati, in the same way, the appropriating consciousness, which is like a river or a flowing stream, and which is the support and foundation,

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: If the condition for the arising of a single eye consciousness occurs, then a single eye consciousness arises.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char gyi bar dag lan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char lan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char gyi bar dag lan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char lan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: If the condition for the arising of all five collections of consciousness occurs, then all five collections of consciousness arise.

original: blo gros yangs pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi lugs shes pa la brten cing /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi lugs shes pa la brten cing /
translated: “Viśālamati, in this way, bodhisattvas, on the basis of understanding the way of Dharma,

original: chos kyi lugs shes pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: chos kyi lugs shes pa la gnas nas /
translated: and by relying on understanding the way of Dharma,

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin yang /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin yang /
translated: are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na /
translated: The Tathāgata designates them as bodhisattvas who are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de tsam gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'dogs so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'dogs so //
translated: But he does not designate them as having fully understood everything about mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so rang gi len pa mi mthong //
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so rang gi len pa mi mthong //
translated: O you of vast intellect, it is because the bodhisattva does not see internal appropriation,

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong la /🔽@54b de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa dang / kun gzhi yang mi mthong /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong la / @54b de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa dang / kun gzhi yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the consciousness that appropriates.🔽He does not see the foundation consciousness,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the foundation consciousness.

original: bstsags pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: bstsags pa yang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the accumulation,

original: sems kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: sems kyang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the mind.

original: mig kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: mig kyang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the eye,

original: gzugs kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the eye consciousness,

original: rna ba yang mi mthong /
analyzed: rna ba yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the ear.

original: sgra yang mi mthong /
analyzed: sgra yang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see sound,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the ear consciousness.

original: sna yang mi mthong /
analyzed: sna yang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the nose,

original: dri yang mi mthong /🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: dri yang mi mthong / sna'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see smell.🔽He does not see the nose consciousness,

original: lce yang mi mthong /
analyzed: lce yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the tongue.

original: ro yang mi mthong /
analyzed: ro yang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see taste,

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see the tongue consciousness.

original: lus kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: lus kyang mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the body,

original: reg bya yang mi mthong /
analyzed: reg bya yang mi mthong /
translated: nor does he see tactility.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong zhing /
translated: They do not see the body consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so rang gi yid kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so rang gi yid kyang mi mthong /
translated: “Deep Mind, because bodhisattvas do not see the inner mind of their own,

original: chos rnams kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: chos rnams kyang mi mthong /
translated: do not see phenomena,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mi mthong la /
translated: and do not see the mind consciousness,

original: de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin na ;
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin na ;
translated: and because they are as they really are,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin par 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste / de bzhin gshegs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin par 'dogs so //
translated: they are called bodhisattvas who are skilled in the ultimate.🔽The Thus-Gone One also designates bodhisattvas who are skilled in the ultimate as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin la /
translated: “Deep Mind, bodhisattvas are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness to that extent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na yang de tsam gyis 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na yang de tsam gyis 'dogs so //
translated: The Thus-Gone One designates the bodhisattva as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is profound and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
translated: All seeds flow in it like a river.

original: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //🔽byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes // byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
translated: Fearing the thought of self,

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽de la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // de la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: I have not taught this to the childish.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas kyis zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas kyis zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Regarding this, the characteristics of phenomena should be understood as they are presented in the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention.🔽The bodhisattva Guṇākara asked the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa /
translated: “Blessed One, a bodhisattva who is skilled in the characteristics of phenomena

original: @55a * // byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: @55a * // byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: “Bodhisattva,” you say—

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa lags /
translated: how much learning in the characteristics of phenomena is required to be called a bodhisattva?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs na yang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs na yang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When the Thus-Gone One designates someone as a bodhisattva who is learned in the characteristics of phenomena, what is the extent of that designation?”🔽The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Guṇākara, “Guṇākara, you are engaged in benefiting many beings, bringing happiness to many beings, and showing compassion for the world.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: You are working for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of all beings, including gods and humans.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
translated: It is good that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about the meaning of this.

original: legs so // yon tan 'byung gnas de'i phyir nyon cig dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: legs so // yon tan 'byung gnas de'i phyir nyon cig dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Guṇākara, listen well and I will explain to you the expertise in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: Guṇākara, there are three characteristics of phenomena:

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic, the other-dependent characteristic, and the thoroughly established characteristic.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas de la chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /🔽ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas de la chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na / ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: Guṇākara, what is the imagined characteristic of phenomena?

original: mid dang brdas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mid dang brdas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of the entity or particular of phenomena by name and symbol to the extent that they are conventionally designated.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has as its object the ultimate truth, because the ultimate truth is not an object of knowledge.

original: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid de /🔽'di lta ste /🔽'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid de / 'di lta ste / 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has as its object the conventional truth, because the conventional truth is false.🔽The Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has as its object both the ultimate and the conventional, because the ultimate and the conventional are mutually exclusive and therefore cannot be unified in a single knowledge.🔽The Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has as its object neither the ultimate nor the conventional, because the Buddha's knowledge is a knowledge that has an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that does not have an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object and does not have an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that neither has an object nor does not have an object.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object, does not have an object, both has and does not have an object, or neither has nor does not have an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object, does not have an object, both has and does not have an object, or neither has nor does not have an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object, does not have an object, both has and does not have an object, or neither has nor does not have an object.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa'o //🔽yon tan 'byung gnas chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa'o // yon tan 'byung gnas chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object, does not have an object, both has and does not have an object, or neither has nor does not have an object.🔽Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object, does not have an object, both has and does not have an object, or neither has nor does not have an object.

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtun pa'i rgyu dang / legs par tshul bzhin yid la @55b byas pa'i rgyus de rtogs shing /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtun pa'i rgyu dang / legs par tshul bzhin yid la @55b byas pa'i rgyus de rtogs shing /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha's knowledge is not a knowledge that has an object,

original: de rtogs pa goms par byas pa yang dag par grub pas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa goms par byas pa yang dag par grub pas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and by the realization of that, the perfection of the realization of the perfect accomplishment of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste /
translated: “O Guṇākara, it is like this:

original: dper na skyes bu gang zag rab rib can gyi mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa de lta bur ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gang zag rab rib can gyi mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa de lta bur ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: The imagined characteristic should be seen as being like the fault of blurred vision in the eyes of a person with blurred vision.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste /
translated: “O Guṇākara, it is like this:

original: dper na de nyid la rab rib kyi mtshan ma skra shad 'dzings pa'am /
analyzed: dper na de nyid la rab rib kyi mtshan ma skra shad 'dzings pa'am /
translated: The dependent characteristic should be seen as being like the signs of blurred vision, such as floating hairs,

original: sbrang ma'am / til gyi 'bru'am /🔽sngon po'i mtshan ma'am /🔽ser po'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sbrang ma'am / til gyi 'bru'am / sngon po'i mtshan ma'am / ser po'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: flies, sesame seeds,🔽blue signs,🔽yellow signs,

original: dmar po'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: dmar po'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: red signs,

original: dkar po'i mtshan ma snang bar gyur pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i mtshan ma snang bar gyur pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: or white signs that appear in that very [vision].

original: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste /
translated: “O Guṇākara, it is like this:

original: dper na skyes bu gang zag de nyid kyi mig yongs su dag cing mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa dang bral bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gang zag de nyid kyi mig yongs su dag cing mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa dang bral bar gyur pa na /
translated: For example, when the eye of a person is completely clear and free from the fault of visual aberration,

original: mig de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi spyod yul ma nor ba'i spyod yul de lta bur ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi spyod yul ma nor ba'i spyod yul de lta bur ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: the intrinsic object-field of that eye, which is the unmistaken object-field, should be seen as the characteristic of the perfected.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste dper na shel shin tu gsal ba ni gang gi tshe tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste dper na shel shin tu gsal ba ni gang gi tshe tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: The source of good qualities is like this: for example, when a very clear crystal comes into contact with blue dye,

original: nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: it appears like a sapphire or a great lapis lazuli,

original: nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen por log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen por log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: and due to the misconception of a sapphire or a great lapis lazuli, sentient beings are deluded.

original: gang gi tshe tshon dmar po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshon dmar po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When it comes into contact with red dye,

original: nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: It appears as if it were a ruby,

original: nor bu rin po che padma r'a gar log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che padma r'a gar log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: and beings are deluded by apprehending it as a ruby.

original: gang gi tshe tshon ljang gu dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshon ljang gu dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When it comes in contact with green dye,

original: nor bu rin po che markat lta bur snang bar 'gyur zing /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che markat lta bur snang bar 'gyur zing /
translated: it appears as if it were an emerald,

original: nor bur rin chen po markat du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: nor bur rin chen po markat du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: and beings are deluded by apprehending it as an emerald.

original: gang gi tshe tshon ser po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshon ser po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When it comes in contact with yellow dye,

original: gser lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gser lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: it appears as if it were gold,

original: gser du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //🔽yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste dpar na shel shin tu gsal ba tshon dang phrad pa de lta @56a * //
analyzed: gser du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do // yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste dpar na shel shin tu gsal ba tshon dang phrad pa de lta @56a * //
translated: and beings are deluded by apprehending it as gold.

original: bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
translated: “O Gudakesha, the dependent nature is like a crystal that, when it comes in contact with various dyes, appears as if it were a ruby,🔽an emerald,🔽gold, or silver,🔽and beings are deluded by apprehending it as such.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kyi bag chags blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kyi bag chags blta bar bya'o //
translated: The habitual tendency to apprehend the imagined reality as a characteristic should be understood as follows.

original: 'di lta ste dper na shel shin tu gsal ba la nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / markat dang / gser du log par 'dzin pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na shel shin tu gsal ba la nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / markat dang / gser du log par 'dzin pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
translated: Just as a very clear crystal is wrongly apprehended as a sapphire, a great sapphire, a ruby, a cat’s eye, or gold, so the dependent reality should be understood as the object of the habitual tendency to apprehend the imagined reality as a characteristic.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin par blta bar bya'o //🔽yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin par blta bar bya'o // yon tan 'byung gnas 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: The perfected reality should be understood as follows.

original: shel shin tu gsal ba nyid lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shel shin tu gsal ba nyid lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the very clear crystal itself is the source of those qualities, so the perfected reality should be understood as the source of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: The dependent reality should be understood as follows.🔽Just as the very clear crystal itself is the source of those qualities, so the dependent reality should be understood as the source of the qualities of the Buddha.🔽Just as the very clear crystal itself is the source of those qualities, so the dependent reality should be understood as the source of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: shel shin tu gsal ba de nyid nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / markat dang / gser gyi mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus yongs su ma grub cing /🔽ngo bo nyid med pa de ltar bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /🔽kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing /
analyzed: shel shin tu gsal ba de nyid nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / markat dang / gser gyi mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus yongs su ma grub cing / ngo bo nyid med pa de ltar bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing /
translated: Thus, the dependent characteristic is not established as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and it is essenceless.🔽The perfected characteristic should be seen as the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //🔽yon tan 'byung gnas de la ming dang 'brel ba'i mtshan ma la brten nas ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //🔽yon tan 'byung gnas de la ming dang 'brel ba'i mtshan ma la brten nas ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.🔽The perfected characteristic is the non-establishment of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic forever and ever, always and always, and as essencelessness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa la brten nas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa la brten nas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of the notional attachment to the imagined identity in the relative identity, the relative identity is understood.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa la brten nas ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa la brten nas ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of the absence of notional attachment to the imagined identity in the relative identity, the perfect identity is understood.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas de la byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas de la byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: “Guṇākara, when bodhisattvas understand the imagined identity in the relative identity just as it is,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: they understand identitylessness just as it is.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: “Guṇākara, when bodhisattvas understand the relative identity just as it is,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He perfectly knows the phenomena that have the characteristic of complete affliction just as they are.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas de la @56b byang chub sems dpas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes na /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas de la @56b byang chub sems dpas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes na /
translated: “Guṇākara, when bodhisattvas perfectly know the characteristic of the perfected just as it is,

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: they perfectly know the phenomena that have the characteristic of complete purification just as they are.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: “Guṇākara, when bodhisattvas perfectly know the phenomena that lack a characteristic in the dependent characteristic just as they are,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ngo //
translated: they abandon the phenomena that have the characteristic of complete affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na /
translated: When they abandon the phenomena that have the characteristic of complete affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: they attain the phenomena that have the characteristic of complete purification.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' de ltar na /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' de ltar na /
translated: Qualities, O King, are like that for the bodhisattvas.

original: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /
translated: Thus, they know the imputed reality, the dependent reality, and the fully present reality of phenomena just as they are.

original: mtshan nyid med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: They know the reality of the absence of characteristics, the reality of defilement, and the reality of purification just as they are.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes nas /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong zhing /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes nas / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong zhing /
translated: Having known the reality of the absence of characteristics just as it is,🔽they abandon the phenomena characterized by defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the phenomena characterized by defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'thob par 'gyur ba de tsam gyis na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'thob par 'gyur ba de tsam gyis na /
translated: they attain the phenomena characterized by purification.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs par mdzad pa na yang de tsam gyis 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs par mdzad pa na yang de tsam gyis 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: When the Tathāgata designates the bodhisattva as skilled in the characteristics of phenomena, he designates him just on the basis of that.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord uttered these verses:

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni rab shes na //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa mtshan nyid chos spong 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni rab shes na // kun nas nyon mongs pa mtshan nyid chos spong 'gyur //
translated: “Having understood the teaching without characteristics,🔽One abandons the teaching with the characteristic of defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs chos ni rab spangs na //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs chos ni rab spangs na //
translated: Having abandoned the teaching with defilement,

original: shin tu rnam dag mtshan nyid chos 'thob 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag mtshan nyid chos 'thob 'gyur //
translated: One attains the teaching with the characteristic of complete purity.

original: skye bo bag med nyes rtsom le lo can //
analyzed: skye bo bag med nyes rtsom le lo can //
translated: People who are heedless, faulty, and lazy,

original: 'du byed skyon la rtog par mi byed pa //
analyzed: 'du byed skyon la rtog par mi byed pa //
translated: Who do not contemplate the faults of conditioned things,

original: brtan med g-yo ba med pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: brtan med g-yo ba med pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: In the teachings that are unwavering and unmoving,

original: rab tu nyams pas snying brtser byas pa yin //
analyzed: rab tu nyams pas snying brtser byas pa yin //
translated: Are pitiable due to their great loss.

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i @57a * //
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i @57a * //
translated: The defining characteristics of the unreality of phenomena are explained in the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:🔽

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: The defining characteristics of the realitylessness of things should be understood as they are set forth in the Samdhinirmocana Sutra.

original: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Bodhisattva Paramarthasamdhinirmocana said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di na bdag gcig pu dben pa zhig na mchis pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di na bdag gcig pu dben pa zhig na mchis pa'i tshe /
translated: Lord, when I was alone in seclusion,

original: sems kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes lags te /
analyzed: sems kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes lags te /
translated: this kind of thought arose in my mind:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar phung po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar phung po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Lord has said in many ways the intrinsic identity of the aggregates,

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa yang bka' stsal /
translated: their identity in arising, their identity in passing away, their abandonment, and their full understanding.

original: phung po rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas rnams kyi yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi ji lta ba de bzhin du skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas rnams kyi yang bka' stsal /
translated: Just as with the aggregates, so with the sense spheres, with dependent origination, and with the sustenances.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar bden pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar bden pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Blessed One has spoken in many ways about the defining characteristics of the truths,

original: yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon du bgyi ba dang / bsgom pa yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon du bgyi ba dang / bsgom pa yang bka' stsal /
translated: about their complete understanding, their abandonment, their realization, and their cultivation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar khams rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar khams rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Blessed One has spoken in many ways about the defining characteristics of the constituents,

original: khams sna tshogs pa nyid dang / khams du ma pa nyid dang / spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa nyid dang / khams du ma pa nyid dang / spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa yang bka' stsal /
translated: about the diversity of the constituents, about the multiplicity of the constituents, about their abandonment, and about their complete understanding.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Blessed One has spoken in many ways about the defining characteristics of the applications of mindfulness,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyed pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid kyang bka' stsal ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyed pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid kyang bka' stsal ;
translated: about their counteragents, about the development of those that have not yet arisen, about the support of those that have arisen, about the cultivation of those that have arisen, about the increase and expansion of those that have arisen.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi yang bka' stsal /
translated: He has also taught the right efforts, the legs of magical power, the faculties, the powers, and the limbs of awakening in the same way that he has taught the applications of mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Blessed One has also taught the defining characteristics of the noble eightfold path in many ways.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / bsgom pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyed pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid @57b kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / bsgom pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyed pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid @57b kyang bka' stsal /
translated: He has also taught its counteragents, antidotes, cultivation, the arising of what has not yet arisen, the abiding of what has arisen, the non-arising of what has not yet arisen, the arising of what has not yet arisen, the abiding of what has arisen, the increase of what has arisen, and the expansion of what has arisen.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
translated: The Blessed One has also taught that all phenomena are devoid of an essence,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /🔽ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /🔽ma 'gags pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unborn,🔽that all phenomena are unceasing,🔽and that all phenomena are originally quiescent.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang bka' stsal lags na /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang bka' stsal lags na /
translated: You have also said, ‘They are primordially peaceful and naturally in a state of perfect nirvāṇa.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas ;
translated: Blessed One, what did you have in mind

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
translated: when you said that all phenomena are devoid of essence,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unceasing,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: that all phenomena are primordially peaceful,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bka' stsal snyam bgyid lags te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bka' stsal snyam bgyid lags te /
translated: and that all phenomena are naturally in a state of perfect nirvāṇa?🔽Blessed One, what did you have in mind

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
translated: when you said that all phenomena are devoid of essence,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unceasing,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: that all phenomena are primordially peaceful,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bka' stsal ba'i don de nyid /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bka' stsal ba'i don de nyid /
translated: and that all phenomena are naturally in a state of perfect nirvāṇa?

original: bcom ldan 'das la bdag yongs su zhu lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bdag yongs su zhu lags so //
translated: Blessed One, I would like to ask you about the meaning of this.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata, saying,

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: “Paramārthasamudgata,

original: khyod kyi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa dge ba tshul bzhin skyes pa legs so //
analyzed: khyod kyi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa dge ba tshul bzhin skyes pa legs so //
translated: your virtuous and proper thoughts are excellent.

original: legs so // don dam yang dag 'phags khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: legs so // don dam yang dag 'phags khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: Excellent, Paramārthasamudgata, it is excellent that you have generated the mind of supreme, perfect enlightenment for the benefit, the welfare, and the happiness of many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of, the benefit, and the happiness of gods and humans, and that you have entered this stage of the bodhisattva canon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni yang khyod legs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni yang khyod legs so //
