translated: It is excellent that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about the meaning of this.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de'i phyir khyod nyon cig dang / ngas ci las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de'i phyir khyod nyon cig dang / ngas ci las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: Therefore, Paramārthasamudgata, listen to the intent with which I taught that all phenomena are natureless,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: that all phenomena are unproduced,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: unextinguished,🔽and originally quiescent,🔽and that they are naturally passed beyond sorrow.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /🔽rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: “Primordially peaceful,🔽naturally passed beyond sorrow.”

original: don dam yang dag 'phags ngas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags ngas chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, I taught that all phenomena are devoid of an inherent nature, intending the three types of lack of inherent nature:

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye bo ngo bo med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bstan to //🔽don dam yang dag @58a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye bo ngo bo med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bstan to // don dam yang dag @58a * //
translated: the lack of an inherent nature in terms of characteristics, the lack of an inherent nature in terms of arising, and the ultimate lack of inherent nature.

original: 'phags de la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags de la chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, what is the lack of an inherent nature in terms of characteristics?

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the imaginary nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin pas ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin pas ;
translated: Because it is a nature that is posited through names and signs and not through its own specific characteristics.

original: de'i phyir de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the “imposition of identitylessness. ”🔽“ Ultimate identitylessness” means that all phenomena are ultimately identityless.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate identitylessness of all phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the relative identity of all phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis byung ba yin gyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin pas de'i phyir de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis byung ba yin gyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin pas de'i phyir de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because it arises through the power of other conditions and not by itself. Therefore, it is called the “imposition of identitylessness. ”

original: don dam yang dag 'phags chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “ Ultimate identitylessness” means that all phenomena are ultimately identityless.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos gang dag skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa de dag ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos gang dag skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa de dag ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yang yin no //
translated: Those phenomena that arise through dependent origination and are identityless by virtue of being devoid of intrinsic existence are also identityless by virtue of being devoid of ultimate existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa yang dag 'phags chos rnams la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni ngas don dam pa yin par yongs su bstan la /
analyzed: don dam pa yang dag 'phags chos rnams la rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni ngas don dam pa yin par yongs su bstan la /
translated: The object of observation that is pure in the qualities of the ultimate, the authentically exalted, I have taught to be the ultimate.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa ma yin pas /
translated: The dependent characteristic is not the object of observation that is pure,

original: de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: and therefore it is called “ultimate naturelessness.”

original: don dam yang dag 'phags gzhan yang chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags gzhan yang chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, moreover, the perfected characteristic of phenomena is also called “ultimate naturelessness.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam yang dag 'phags chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, that which is the objective selflessness of phenomena is called “their naturelessness.”

original: de ni don dam pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa yin la /
translated: That is the ultimate,

original: don dam pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas /
analyzed: don dam pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas /
translated: and the ultimate is distinguished by the naturelessness of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ultimate reality.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la 'di lta ste /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, it is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de lta bur ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de lta bur ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: The characteristic non-nature should be viewed as being like a flower in the sky.

original: don dam pa yang dag 'phags de la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa yang dag 'phags de la 'di lta ste /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, it is like this:

original: dper na sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba de lta bur ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba de lta bur ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The nature of production non-nature should be viewed as being like a magical creation.

original: don @58b dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de las kyang gcig blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don @58b dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de las kyang gcig blta bar bya'o //
translated: The ultimate non-nature should be viewed as being like one of those.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid tsam gyis rab tu phye ba dang / thams cad du song ba ji lta ba de lta bur ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de las chos bdag med par rab tu phye ba dang /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid tsam gyis rab tu phye ba dang / thams cad du song ba ji lta ba de lta bur ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de las chos bdag med par rab tu phye ba dang /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, it is like this: For example, space is distinguished by the mere absence of form, and it pervades all forms.

original: thams cad du song ba gcig blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba gcig blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should see that it is present in all.

original: don dam yang dag pa 'phags ngas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don dam yang dag pa 'phags ngas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, I taught that all phenomena are natureless intending the three types of naturelessness.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, intending the naturelessness of character,

original: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: I taught, “All phenomena are unproduced,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: undestroyed,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: primordially peaceful,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and naturally passed beyond sorrow.🔽”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa yin /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, that which does not exist by way of its own character is not produced.

original: ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'gags pa yin /
analyzed: ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'gags pa yin /
translated: That which is not produced is not destroyed.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni gzod ma nas zhi ba yin /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni gzod ma nas zhi ba yin /
translated: That which is not produced and not destroyed is primordially peaceful.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin /
translated: That which is primordially peaceful is naturally completely extinguished.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: That which is naturally completely extinguished has not the slightest thing to be completely extinguished.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, intending the lack of an inherent nature in terms of characteristics,

original: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: I taught, “All phenomena are unproduced,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: undestroyed,

original: gzod ma nas zhig / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhig / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: primordially peaceful, and naturally completely extinguished.”

original: don dam yang dag 'phags yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba las dgongs nas /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba las dgongs nas /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, intending the ultimate lack of an inherent nature, which is distinguished by the selflessness of phenomena,

original: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: I taught, “All phenomena are unproduced,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: undestroyed,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: primordially peaceful,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and naturally completely extinguished.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba ni rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su rnam par gnas pa kho na yin la /🔽de ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'dus ma byas pa nyon mongs pa @59a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba ni rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su rnam par gnas pa kho na yin la / de ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'dus ma byas pa nyon mongs pa @59a * //
translated: Thus, the ultimate naturelessness, which is revealed by the selflessness of phenomena, is just the enduring of eternal time and the enduring of everlasting time.

original: thams cad dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: thams cad dang bral ba yin te /
translated: It is the uncompounded reality of phenomena, free from all afflictions.

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su chos nyid de nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa /
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su chos nyid de nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa /
translated: It is the enduring of eternal time and the enduring of everlasting time by means of that reality itself.

original: 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus pa ma byas pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa yin la /🔽de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus pa ma byas pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa yin la / de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: That which is uncompounded is unproduced and unceasing because it is not compounded.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: It is primordially peaceful and naturally liberated because it is free from all afflictions.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba las dgongs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba las dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, intending the ultimate naturelessness, which is revealed by the selflessness of phenomena,

original: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ngas chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: I have taught that all phenomena are unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /🔽gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa / gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: unceased,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: primordially peaceful, and by nature in a state of nirvana.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags nga ni sems can gyi khams na sems can rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong zhing /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags nga ni sems can gyi khams na sems can rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong zhing /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, in the realm of sentient beings, I see that sentient beings, due to the imaginary nature, see things as essentially different,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong ba de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum mi 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad par mthong ba de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum mi 'dogs kyi /
translated: and due to the dependent nature and the consummate nature, they see things as essentially different. Therefore, I do not posit the three types of natureslessness with respect to them.

original: sems can rnams gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: sems can rnams gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: However, sentient beings, due to the dependent nature and the consummate nature,

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags nas /🔽gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags nas / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: superimpose the imaginary nature upon them.🔽They then impute the characteristics of the imaginary nature

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du rjes su tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du rjes su tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: with respect to the dependent nature and the consummate nature.

original: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar rjes su tha snyad btags pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'am /🔽tha snyad btags pa bag la nyal gyis gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar rjes su tha snyad btags pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'am / tha snyad btags pa bag la nyal gyis gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la /
translated: As one continues to engage in such conceptualization, the mind that is imbued with the imprints of such conceptualization becomes associated with such conceptualization.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen to //🔽ji lta ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de lta de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen to // ji lta ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de lta de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la /
translated: Or, due to the latent impressions of such conceptualization, one becomes fixated on the dependent nature and the consummate nature as having the characteristics of the imputed nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu de dang rkyen des phyi ma la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu skyed de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu de dang rkyen des phyi ma la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu skyed de /
translated: As one continues to become fixated in this way, due to the causes and conditions of such fixation on the dependent nature as having the characteristics of the imputed nature, one will in the future generate the dependent nature.

original: gzhi des na nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhi des na nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: Due to this basis, one will also become afflicted by the afflictions of the mental afflictions.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are also afflicted by the afflictions of karma and the afflictions of birth.

original: yun ring por @59b yang na sems can dmyal ba rnams sam /🔽yang na dud 'gro rnams sam /
analyzed: yun ring por @59b yang na sems can dmyal ba rnams sam / yang na dud 'gro rnams sam /
translated: For a long time they will wander in the hells,🔽among animals,

original: yang na yi dvags rnams sam /🔽yang na lha rnams sam /
analyzed: yang na yi dvags rnams sam / yang na lha rnams sam /
translated: among hungry ghosts,🔽among gods,

original: yang na lha ma yin rnams sam /
analyzed: yang na lha ma yin rnams sam /
translated: among demigods,

original: yang na mi rnams kyi nang du kun tu rgyug cing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na mi rnams kyi nang du kun tu rgyug cing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: and among humans.

original: 'khor ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //🔽don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dang po nyid nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro // don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dang po nyid nas /
translated: They will not transcend cyclic existence.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: “Para­mārthasamud­gata, to those sentient beings who have not planted the roots of virtue,

original: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa /
translated: who have not purified the obstructions,

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa /
translated: whose continuums have not ripened,

original: mos pa mi mang ba /
analyzed: mos pa mi mang ba /
translated: who have not generated great interest,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub pa de dag la ni da skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston te //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub pa de dag la ni da skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston te //
translated: and who have not accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, the Tathāgata teaches the doctrine beginning with the non-entityness of nature.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid du 'du shes shing /
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid du 'du shes shing /
translated: Having heard the Dharma, they understand that the formations that arise in dependence on conditions are impermanent.

original: mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can nyid du shes nas /
analyzed: mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos can nyid du shes nas /
translated: They understand that they are unstable, unreliable, and subject to change.

original: 'du byed thams cad la yid dang bar byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la yid dang bar byed do //
translated: They become disillusioned with all formations.

original: skyo bar byed do //🔽yid dang bar byas /
analyzed: skyo bar byed do // yid dang bar byas /
translated: They become disenchanted.

original: skyo bar byas nas sdig pa las phyir ldog ste /
analyzed: skyo bar byas nas sdig pa las phyir ldog ste /
translated: Having become disillusioned and disenchanted, they turn away from evil.

original: de dag sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed cing dge ba la brten par byed do //
analyzed: de dag sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed cing dge ba la brten par byed do //
translated: They do not do what is evil and they rely on what is wholesome.

original: dge ba la brten pa'i rgyus dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed do //🔽sgrib pa yongs su ma byang ba rnams kyang yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: dge ba la brten pa'i rgyus dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed do // sgrib pa yongs su ma byang ba rnams kyang yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: Because they rely on what is wholesome, they produce wholesome roots that have not been produced.🔽They purify the obscurations that have not been purified.

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa yang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa yang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They ripen the mindstream that has not ripened.

original: gzhi des mos pa mang zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des mos pa mang zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: On that basis, they will have many aspirations and will perfectly accomplish the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de dag de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: de dag de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas /
translated: Although they have thus generated roots of virtue

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub mod kyi /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub mod kyi /
translated: up to the point of perfectly accomplishing the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas /
translated: they do not know the lack of entityness with respect to nature and the lack of entityness with respect to ultimate reality with regard to the lack of entityness of arising in the way that they actually are.

original: 'du byed thams cad la yang dag par skyo bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la yang dag par skyo bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, they do not become truly disenchanted with all conditioned things.

original: yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become truly free from attachment.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They do not become truly liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become completely liberated from the affliction of the afflictions.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become completely liberated from the affliction of karma.

original: skye ba'i kun nas @60a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas @60a * //
translated: The origin of suffering is the cause of suffering.🔽

original: nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: They will not be completely liberated from the afflictions of formation,🔽the afflictions of karma, and the afflictions of birth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de dag la 'di lta ste /🔽mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang de dag la 'di lta ste / mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata teaches them the Dharma

original: 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang /
translated: in order to make them completely turn away from the afflictions of formation,🔽the afflictions of karma, and the afflictions of birth,

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: in order to make them completely turn away from the afflictions of karma,🔽and in order to make them completely turn away from the afflictions of birth.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon bar zhen pa med pas /
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon bar zhen pa med pas /
translated: Having heard this teaching, they are not attached to the imagined reality that is imputed to the dependent reality.

original: skye bo ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa nyid du mos par byed /🔽rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: skye bo ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa nyid du mos par byed / rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: They aspire to the absence of intrinsic reality and to the ultimate reality.🔽They discern it.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed cing /
translated: They realize it as it is.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽tha snyad btags pas yongs su ma bsgos pa'i shes pa tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba med cing /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / tha snyad btags pas yongs su ma bsgos pa'i shes pa tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba med cing /
translated: They are as follows.🔽The dependent reality is the consciousness that is not colored by the imputations of conventional expressions, that is not related to the imputations of conventional expressions, and that is the consciousness in which the latent propensities for the imputations of conventional expressions are absent.

original: tha snyad btags pa bag la nyal ba med pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de tshe 'di la shes pa'i stobs skyed pa dang / phyi ma la rgyu yang dag par chad pas 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: tha snyad btags pa bag la nyal ba med pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de tshe 'di la shes pa'i stobs skyed pa dang / phyi ma la rgyu yang dag par chad pas 'gog par byed de /
translated: In this life, they cause the power of consciousness to increase and in the next life, they cause the cessation of the continuum of the cause.

original: gzhi des 'du byed thams cad la yang dag par skyo ba dang / yang dag par 'dod chags thams cad dang bral ba dang / yang dag par rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: gzhi des 'du byed thams cad la yang dag par skyo ba dang / yang dag par 'dod chags thams cad dang bral ba dang / yang dag par rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing ;
translated: On the basis of that, they will become truly disenchanted with all conditioned things, truly free from all attachment, and truly liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be completely liberated from the afflictive obscurations, the karmic obscurations, and the obscurations of the birth process.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / bsgrub pa 'di nyid kyis grub pa dang / bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / bsgrub pa 'di nyid kyis grub pa dang / bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Para­mārthasamudgata, those sentient beings who are of the śrāvaka type will also attain the state of nirvāṇa, which is the highest bliss and accomplishment, through this very path and through this very practice.

original: sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / bsgrub pa 'di nyid @60b kyis grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / bsgrub pa 'di nyid @60b kyis grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: Those sentient beings who are of the lineage of the Solitary Realizer Vehicle and those who are of the lineage of the Tathāgata Vehicle will also attain the unsurpassed bliss of nirvāṇa through this very path and through this very practice.

original: 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa yin la /
translated: This is the single pure path of the śrāvakas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par dag pa yang gcig ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang gcig ste /
translated: And the purity is also single.

original: gnyis pa gang yang med pas /
analyzed: gnyis pa gang yang med pas /
translated: There is no second.

original: ngas de las dgongs nas theg pa gcig tu bstan te /
analyzed: ngas de las dgongs nas theg pa gcig tu bstan te /
translated: With that in mind, I have taught the single vehicle.

original: sems can gyi khams na sems can rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba rnams dang / dbang po 'bring rnams dang / dbang po rnon po rnams kyi rigs sna tshogs dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams na sems can rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba rnams dang / dbang po 'bring rnams dang / dbang po rnon po rnams kyi rigs sna tshogs dag kyang med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there are no various lineages of sentient beings in the realm of sentient beings, such as those of dull faculties, those of middling faculties, and those of sharp faculties.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags nyan thos kyi rigs kyi gang zag zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags nyan thos kyi rigs kyi gang zag zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang /
translated: The ultimate, the person of the sravaka lineage who is the one traveling to peace, cannot be made to attain buddhahood even if all buddhas were to exert themselves.🔽

original: byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byar mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byar mi nus so //
translated: The ultimate, true, noble listeners who are individuals of the listener type, who are bound for the solitary enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha, and who are bound for the enlightenment of a buddha, are not able to attain the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of buddhahood, even if all the buddhas were to strive to make them attain it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni snying rje shin tu chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rigs dman pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni snying rje shin tu chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rigs dman pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because they are naturally inferior, since they have very little compassion and are very afraid of suffering.

original: de ji lta ji ltar snying rje shin tu chung ba de bzhin du sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar snying rje shin tu chung ba de bzhin du sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more they have very little compassion, the more they are averse to working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa de bzhin du 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa de bzhin du 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more they are afraid of suffering, the more they are averse to all the activities that create the causes of enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ngas ma bstan te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ngas ma bstan te /
translated: I do not teach that those who are averse to working for the welfare of sentient beings and averse to all the activities of spiritual training are irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de'i phyir zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the one path to peace.

original: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba de gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan te /
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba de gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan te /
translated: I have taught that those who are śrāvakas who turn to awakening are bodhisattvas in terms of a special application.

original: 'di ltar de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas /
translated: Because, having been liberated from the obstacle of the afflictions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskul na shes bya'i sgrib pa las sems rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskul na shes bya'i sgrib pa las sems rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: when urged by the tathāgatas, they liberate their minds from the obstacle to knowing.

original: de ni dang por bdag gi don la sbyor ba'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol te /
analyzed: de ni dang por bdag gi don la sbyor ba'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol te /
translated: First, in terms of application for their own welfare, they are liberated from the obstacle of the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata designates them as the śrāvaka type.🔽Para­mārtha­samud­ya­ta, it is like this:

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar nga'i @61a * //🔽chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa shin tu gya nom pa /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar nga'i @61a * // chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa shin tu gya nom pa /
translated: In my well-spoken, very refined,

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
translated: well-taught Dharma and Vinaya, which teaches with a very pure intention,

original: chos legs par bstan pa la ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa yang snang ste /
analyzed: chos legs par bstan pa la ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa yang snang ste /
translated: the stages of the inclinations of sentient beings appear in the well-taught Dharma.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid las dgongs nas drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid las dgongs nas drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Para­mārtha­samud­ya­ta, the Tathāgata, intending just those three kinds of naturelessness, teaches the doctrine of naturelessness in this way in the sūtras of interpretable meaning:

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: “All things are natureless;

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /🔽ma 'gags pa /🔽gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa / ma 'gags pa / gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: all things are unproduced,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes chos ston to //
translated: unextinguished, primordially peaceful, and naturally extinguished.”

original: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa /
translated: With regard to that, those sentient beings who have produced great roots of virtue

original: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su dag pa /
translated: They are completely purified of obscurations.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa /
translated: Their mindstreams are completely ripened.

original: mos pa mang ba /
analyzed: mos pa mang ba /
translated: They have abundant interest.🔽They have accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par grub pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par grub pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
translated: When they hear that teaching,

original: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /
translated: they will understand my teachings that are intended to have an ulterior purpose just as they are.

original: chos de la yang mos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos de la yang mos par 'gyur la /
translated: They will have interest in that teaching.🔽They will understand the meaning with wisdom just as it is.

original: don de yang shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur zhing de rtogs pa goms pas kyang myur ba myur ba kho nar shin tu mthar thug pa de nyid rjes su 'thob par 'gyur te /🔽nga la yang aa la la bcom ldan 'das de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: don de yang shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur zhing de rtogs pa goms pas kyang myur ba myur ba kho nar shin tu mthar thug pa de nyid rjes su 'thob par 'gyur te / nga la yang aa la la bcom ldan 'das de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: They will quickly and swiftly attain the ultimate through becoming accustomed to that understanding.🔽They will also attain faith in me, thinking, ‘Ah! The Bhagavān is a perfect buddha.

original: des ni chos thams cad legs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni chos thams cad legs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has perfectly and completely awakened to all phenomena.’

original: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa /
translated: Those sentient beings who have not generated roots of virtue, who have not purified obscurations, who have not ripened their continuums, who do not have great interest,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par ma grub pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par ma grub pa /
translated: who have not accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can /
translated: who are straightforward,

original: rtog pa sel mi nus pa /
analyzed: rtog pa sel mi nus pa /
translated: who are unable to eliminate conceptuality,

original: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par mi gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na ngas dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes mod kyi /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par mi gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na ngas dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes mod kyi /
translated: and who do not abide in the view that their own view is supreme, when they hear that dharma, they do not know the perfect, just as it is, intended explanation.

original: 'on kyang chos de la mos par byed cing dad pa yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos de la mos par byed cing dad pa yang 'thob ste /
translated: Nevertheless, they have interest in that dharma and attain faith.

original: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa /
translated: These sūtras were spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: zab pa / zab par snang ba stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: zab pa / zab par snang ba stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
translated: They are profound, appear profound, and are endowed with emptiness.

original: mthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: mthong bar dka' ba /
translated: They are difficult to see.

original: rtogs par dka' @61b ba /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' @61b ba /
translated: They are difficult to realize.

original: brtag mi nus pa /
analyzed: brtag mi nus pa /
translated: They are not able to be investigated.

original: rtog ge pa'i spyod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtog ge pa'i spyod pa ma yin pa /
translated: They are not the domain of logicians.

original: zhib mo brtags pa mkhas pa /
analyzed: zhib mo brtags pa mkhas pa /
translated: “It is the domain of the wise,

original: mdzangs pas rig pa yin no zhes mos par byed do //
analyzed: mdzangs pas rig pa yin no zhes mos par byed do //
translated: the learned, and the intelligent.”

original: mdo sde de dag gi don bstan pa dag la bdag mi shes so snyam nas 'dug ste /
analyzed: mdo sde de dag gi don bstan pa dag la bdag mi shes so snyam nas 'dug ste /
translated: “I do not understand the meaning of those sūtras,” he thinks,

original: 'di skad ces sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni zab /
analyzed: 'di skad ces sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni zab /
translated: “The enlightenment of the Buddha is profound.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyang zab ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyang zab ste /
translated: The nature of phenomena is also profound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mkhyen gyi /
translated: The Tathāgata himself knows it.

original: bdag cag gis ni je mi shes so //
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni je mi shes so //
translated: We do not know it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni sems can rnams la mos pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni sems can rnams la mos pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The teachings of the Tathāgata are for those who have various kinds of faith.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mkhyen pa dang / gzigs pa mtha' yas pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mkhyen pa dang / gzigs pa mtha' yas pa yin /
translated: The Tathāgata has infinite knowledge and insight.

original: bdag cag gis shes pa dang mthong ba ni ba lang gi rjes tsam mo snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag cag gis shes pa dang mthong ba ni ba lang gi rjes tsam mo snyam nas /
translated: Our knowledge and insight are like the hoofprint of a cow.”

original: de dag mdo sde de rnams la gus par byas te /🔽yi ger 'dri ba yang byed /
analyzed: de dag mdo sde de rnams la gus par byas te / yi ger 'dri ba yang byed /
translated: “They respect those sūtras,🔽they write them out,

original: yi ger bris nas 'chang bar yang byed /
analyzed: yi ger bris nas 'chang bar yang byed /
translated: they keep them after they have written them out,

original: klog par yang byed /
analyzed: klog par yang byed /
translated: they read them,

original: yang dag par 'gyed par yang byed /
analyzed: yang dag par 'gyed par yang byed /
translated: They also engage in correct analysis.

original: mchod par yang byed /🔽lung nod par yang byed /🔽'don par yang byed /
analyzed: mchod par yang byed / lung nod par yang byed / 'don par yang byed /
translated: They also make offerings.🔽They also receive oral transmissions.🔽They also recite.

original: kha ton du yang byed mod kyi /
analyzed: kha ton du yang byed mod kyi /
translated: They also chant.

original: 'di ltar nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo 'di ma rtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i rnam par sbyor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo 'di ma rtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i rnam par sbyor bar mi nus so //
translated: However, because they do not understand my profound teaching of the purport, they are unable to engage in the practice.

original: de dag gzhi des na bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gzhi des na bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: Through that basis, they also increase the accumulation of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: They also increase the accumulation of wisdom.

original: gang du yang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang smin par byed do //
analyzed: gang du yang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang smin par byed do //
translated: They also bring to maturity those mindstreams that are not yet mature.

original: ji ste sems can de dag las sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ste sems can de dag las sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par grub pa ma yin la /
translated: If, from among those sentient beings, there are sentient beings who have not accomplished the great accumulation of merit and wisdom,

original: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can ni ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can ni ma yin mod kyi /
translated: and who are not straightforward and honest,

original: 'on kyang rtog pa sel nus pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa sel nus pa /
translated: nevertheless, they are able to eliminate conceptualization.

original: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
translated: when they hear this teaching,🔽do not understand the profound intention of the Tathāgata’s

original: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te /
translated: explanations.

original: chos de la mos kyang chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: chos de la mos kyang chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Although they believe in this teaching, they cling to the literal meaning of the teaching, thinking, “All these phenomena are only without any nature.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa kho na'o //
translated: All these phenomena are only unarisen.

original: ma 'gags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa kho na'o //
translated: They are only unceasing.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba kho na'o //
translated: They are only peace from the beginning.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'o zhes chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'o zhes chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed de /
translated: They are only by nature in a state of nirvāṇa.”

original: de dag gzhi des @62a * //🔽na chos thams cad la med par lta ba dang mtshan nyid med par lta ba 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gzhi des @62a * // na chos thams cad la med par lta ba dang mtshan nyid med par lta ba 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that basis,🔽they come to have the view of nonexistence and the view of the absence of characteristics.

original: med par lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med par lta ba thob nas kyang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad kyis skur ba 'debs te /
analyzed: med par lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med par lta ba thob nas kyang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad kyis skur ba 'debs te /
translated: Having come to have the view of nonexistence and the view of the absence of characteristics, they deny everything with all their characteristics.

original: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la yang skur ba 'debs /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la yang skur ba 'debs /
translated: They also deny the imagined identity of things.

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la yang skur ba 'debs so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la yang skur ba 'debs so //
translated: They also deny the relative and perfect identities of things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes par 'gyur na /
translated: Subhūti, if the relative and perfect identities of things exist, then the imagined identity of things can be known.

original: de la gang dag gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med par mthong ba de dag gis ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la yang skur ba btab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gang dag gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med par mthong ba de dag gis ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la yang skur ba btab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: But those who see the relative and perfect identities of things as identityless deny the imagined identity of things.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur ba 'debs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la yang skur ba 'debs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to deny all three identities.

original: de dag ni nga'i chos chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni nga'i chos chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa yin te /
translated: They are those who perceive my Dharma as Dharma, and who perceive what is not the meaning as the meaning.

original: nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa de dag chos la yang chos su 'dzin don ma yin pa la don du 'dzin to //
analyzed: nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa de dag chos la yang chos su 'dzin don ma yin pa la don du 'dzin to //
translated: Those who perceive my Dharma as Dharma, and who perceive what is not the meaning as the meaning, grasp at Dharma as Dharma, and grasp at what is not the meaning as the meaning.

original: de dag chos la mos pas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag chos la mos pas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel mod kyi /
translated: They do increase through wholesome states because of their devotion to the Dharma.

original: 'on kyang don dam pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab las yongs su nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don dam pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab las yongs su nyams pa yin te /
translated: However, because of their attachment to what is not the ultimate, they decline in wisdom.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams na /
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams na /
translated: When they decline in wisdom,

original: dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang / shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang / shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: they decline from the wholesome states that are very extensive and very immeasurable.

original: gzhan dag de dag las chos la chos su dang / don ma yin pa la don du thos nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag de dag las chos la chos su dang / don ma yin pa la don du thos nas /
translated: Others, having heard from them that Dharma is Dharma and that what is not the meaning is the meaning,

original: gang dag lta ba la dga' bar byed pa de dag ni chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pas /
analyzed: gang dag lta ba la dga' bar byed pa de dag ni chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pas /
translated: Those who delight in views will have the idea that the Dharma is the Dharma and the idea that what is not the meaning is the meaning.

original: chos la chos su shes pa dang / don ma yin pa don du mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos la chos su shes pa dang / don ma yin pa don du mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: They will know the Dharma as the Dharma and will be attached to what is not the meaning as the meaning.

original: de dag kyang gzhi des na de bzhin du dge ba'i chos las yongs su nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhi des na de bzhin du dge ba'i chos las yongs su nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: And because of that basis, they will fall away from the good qualities of the Dharma.

original: gang dag lta ba'i rjes su dga' bar mi byed pa de dag las chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos @62b shing /🔽chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gags pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa thos nas skrag cing dngang la /
analyzed: gang dag lta ba'i rjes su dga' bar mi byed pa de dag las chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos @62b shing / chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gags pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa thos nas skrag cing dngang la /
translated: Those who do not delight in views will hear that dharmas are without own-being,🔽and they will hear that dharmas are unborn, unceasing, primordial peace, and naturally in a state of nirvana.

original: kun tu dngang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kun tu dngang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will be frightened, terrified, and filled with dread.

original: 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas bco ldan 'das kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas bco ldan 'das kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
translated: They will say, ‘This is not the word of the Buddha, the Lord.

original: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
translated: They will say, ‘This is the teaching of Māra.’

original: de ltar rig nas mdo sde de dag la skur ba 'debs par byed /
analyzed: de ltar rig nas mdo sde de dag la skur ba 'debs par byed /
translated: Knowing this, they will disparage those sūtras.

original: spong bar byed /🔽mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
analyzed: spong bar byed / mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
translated: They will reject them.🔽They will speak unfavorably about them.

original: ngan du rjod par byed de /
analyzed: ngan du rjod par byed de /
translated: They will speak badly about them.

original: gzhi des na phongs pa chen po thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhi des na phongs pa chen po thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: On that basis, they will obtain great misfortune.

original: las kyi sgrib pa chen pos kyang reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa chen pos kyang reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also be touched by great karmic obscurations.

original: gzhi des kyang gang dag skye bo phal po che la las kyi sgrib pa chen po 'thob pas slu bar byed pa /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang gang dag skye bo phal po che la las kyi sgrib pa chen po 'thob pas slu bar byed pa /
translated: On that basis, they will deceive many people, causing them to obtain great karmic obscurations.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad med par lta zhing don ma yin pa don du ston par byed pa de dag ni las kyi sgrib pa rgya chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad med par lta zhing don ma yin pa don du ston par byed pa de dag ni las kyi sgrib pa rgya chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o //
translated: I say that they will have great karmic obscurations because they will view all characteristics as nonexistent and teach what is not the meaning to be the meaning.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
translated: “Para­mārtha­samud­gata, those sentient beings who have not planted the roots of virtue,🔽who have not purified the obscurations,

original: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag / rgyud yongs su ma smin /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag / rgyud yongs su ma smin /
translated: whose continuums have not ripened,

original: mos pa mi mang /
analyzed: mos pa mi mang /
translated: who have no interest,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub cing drang po ma yin la drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin yang /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub cing drang po ma yin la drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin yang /
translated: They have not properly accumulated merit and wisdom, are not honest, and are not of an honest nature.

original: rtog pa sel nus la /🔽rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
analyzed: rtog pa sel nus la / rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
translated: They are able to dispel concepts,🔽but they remain fixated on their own views as supreme.

original: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang /
analyzed: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang /
translated: When they hear my teachings that are explanations of my intent,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes shing /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes shing /
translated: they will not know them correctly as they are.

original: chos de la mos par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos de la mos par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: They will not have conviction in those teachings.

original: de dag chos la chos ma yin par 'du shes shing /
analyzed: de dag chos la chos ma yin par 'du shes shing /
translated: They will perceive the Dharma as non-Dharma,

original: don la don ma yin par 'du shes la /
analyzed: don la don ma yin par 'du shes la /
translated: and they will perceive the meaning as non-meaning.

original: chos la yang chos ma yin pa dang / don la yang don ma yin par mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: chos la yang chos ma yin pa dang / don la yang don ma yin par mngon par zhen nas /
translated: They will cling to the Dharma as non-Dharma and to the meaning as non-meaning.

original: 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
translated: They will say, ‘This is not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
translated: This was spoken by Māra.’

original: de ltar rig nas mdo sde de dag la skur ba 'debs par byed /
analyzed: de ltar rig nas mdo sde de dag la skur ba 'debs par byed /
translated: Knowing this, they will disparage those sūtras.

original: spong bar byed /
analyzed: spong bar byed /
translated: They will reject them.

original: mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
analyzed: mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
translated: They speak ill of them.

original: ngan du rjod par byed cing lhad kyang 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: ngan du rjod par byed cing lhad kyang 'jug par byed de /
translated: They speak badly of them and they introduce corruption.

original: rnam grangs du mar mdo sde de dag spang ba dang / chud gzan pa dang / rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir zhugs shing /🔽de la mos pa'i gang zag rnams la yang dgrar 'du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar mdo sde de dag spang ba dang / chud gzan pa dang / rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir zhugs shing / de la mos pa'i gang zag rnams la yang dgrar 'du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In many ways they work to abandon, destroy, and annihilate those sūtras.

original: de dag ni @63a * //
analyzed: de dag ni @63a * //
translated: They think of those who believe in them as enemies.

original: dang po nyid nas kyang las kyi sgrib pa bsgribs pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas kyang las kyi sgrib pa bsgribs pa yin la /
translated: From the very beginning they are obscured by the obscurations of karma.

original: gzhi des kyang las kyi sgrib pa de lta bus sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang las kyi sgrib pa de lta bus sgrib par byed de /
translated: And on that basis, they are obscured by such obscurations of karma.

original: las kyi sgrib pa de'i dang po ni gdags par sla'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag 'di snyed kyi bar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gdags par dka'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa de'i dang po ni gdags par sla'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag 'di snyed kyi bar gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gdags par dka'o //
translated: It is easy to say that the beginning of those obscurations of karma is so many quintillions of eons ago, but it is difficult to say that it is so many quintillions of eons from now.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de ltar na nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de ltar na nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa /
translated: Para­mārtha­samud­gata, in that way my Dharma and Vinaya is well spoken.

original: shin tu gya nom pa /
analyzed: shin tu gya nom pa /
translated: It is very refined.

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
translated: It teaches with a very pure intention.

original: chos legs par bstan pa la /
analyzed: chos legs par bstan pa la /
translated: In the good teaching of the Dharma,

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa de lta bu dag kyang snang ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa de lta bu dag kyang snang ngo //
translated: the various dispositions of sentient beings are seen.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Lord uttered these verses:🔽“The intrinsic realitylessness of phenomena, the non-production of phenomena,🔽the non-cessation of phenomena, the primordial peace of phenomena,

original: chos rnams ngo bo nyid med chos rnams ma skyes dang / chos rnams ma 'gags chos rnams gzod nas zhi ba dang // chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin mya ngan 'das par ni //
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo nyid med chos rnams ma skyes dang / chos rnams ma 'gags chos rnams gzod nas zhi ba dang // chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin mya ngan 'das par ni //
translated: and the natural nirvāṇa of all phenomena—

original: dgongs pa med par mkhas pa su zhig smra bar byed //🔽mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med skye ba ngo bo med //
analyzed: dgongs pa med par mkhas pa su zhig smra bar byed // mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med skye ba ngo bo med //
translated: what wise person would assert these without a special intention?🔽“I have explained the intrinsic realitylessness of characteristics,

original: don dam ngo bo nyid med do zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: don dam ngo bo nyid med do zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: the intrinsic realitylessness of production,🔽and the ultimate intrinsic realitylessness.

original: 'di la mkhas pa gang zhig dgongs pa shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'di la mkhas pa gang zhig dgongs pa shes pa ni //
translated: What wise person, knowing the special intention

original: rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i lam du de mi 'gro //
analyzed: rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i lam du de mi 'gro //
translated: would not go down the path of utter nihilism?

original: kun gyi rnam dag lam ni gcig pu 'di yin te //
analyzed: kun gyi rnam dag lam ni gcig pu 'di yin te //
translated: “This is the one pure path of all,

original: rnam par dag pa'ang gcig ste gnyis pa gang yang med //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'ang gcig ste gnyis pa gang yang med //
translated: pure and one, with no second at all.

original: de phyir theg pa gcig pa 'di ni 'dogs byed kyang //
analyzed: de phyir theg pa gcig pa 'di ni 'dogs byed kyang //
translated: Therefore, this One Vehicle is also the designation.

original: sems can rigs ni rnam pa sna tshogs med ma yin //🔽sems can khams 'di na ni gang dag bdag gcig pu //
analyzed: sems can rigs ni rnam pa sna tshogs med ma yin // sems can khams 'di na ni gang dag bdag gcig pu //
translated: It is not that there are no sentient beings of various types.🔽In this realm of sentient beings, there are countless sentient beings

original: mya ngan 'da' bar byed pa'i sems can dpag tu med //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar byed pa'i sems can dpag tu med //
translated: Who seek to attain nirvana for themselves alone.

original: gang dag mya ngan 'das kyang sems can mi gtong ba'i //
analyzed: gang dag mya ngan 'das kyang sems can mi gtong ba'i //
translated: Those who, even after attaining nirvana, do not abandon sentient beings,

original: bstan pa snying rje ldan pa de dag shin tu dkon //
analyzed: bstan pa snying rje ldan pa de dag shin tu dkon //
translated: Those who possess the compassionate teaching, are extremely rare.

original: gang grol de dag rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
analyzed: gang grol de dag rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i dbyings //
translated: The undefiled realm of those who are liberated

original: phra zhing bsam gyis mi khyab mnyam zhing bye brag med //
analyzed: phra zhing bsam gyis mi khyab mnyam zhing bye brag med //
translated: Is subtle, inconceivable, equal, and without distinction.

original: thams cad don grub sdug bsngal nyon mongs spangs pa ste //
analyzed: thams cad don grub sdug bsngal nyon mongs spangs pa ste //
translated: It is the attainment of all goals, the abandonment of suffering and afflictions,

original: gnyis su brjod pa ma yin bde zhing brtan pa yin //🔽de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: gnyis su brjod pa ma yin bde zhing brtan pa yin // de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: And is not expressed as dual, being blissful and stable.

original: byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then at that time, the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata made a request to the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa /
translated: Blessed One, the teachings of the buddhas, the blessed ones, are so profound,

original: @63b phra ba /🔽mchog tu phra ba /
analyzed: @63b phra ba / mchog tu phra ba /
translated: so subtle,

original: zab pa / mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: zab pa / mchog tu zab pa /
translated: so profound and subtle,

original: rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: so difficult to realize,

original: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags so //
analyzed: mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba lags so //
translated: so extremely difficult to realize—they are truly amazing and marvelous.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te /
translated: Blessed One, I understand the meaning of what you have said in the following way:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
translated: The imagined characteristic, which is the domain of conceptual thought,

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la /🔽gzugs kyi phung po zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la / gzugs kyi phung po zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: is based on the signs of formations.🔽The name and symbol of the aggregate of form are established as the characteristic of its essence🔽or as the characteristic of its particulars.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa dang gzugs kyi phung po skye'o zhe'am /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa dang gzugs kyi phung po skye'o zhe'am /
translated: The aggregate of form arises,

original: 'gag go zhe'am /🔽gzugs kyi phung po spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'gag go zhe'am /🔽gzugs kyi phung po spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa zhes ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: ceases,🔽is abandoned, or is fully understood.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
translated: “The mark of compositional activity that is the basis of the specific characteristics is the imagined characteristic.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad lags so //🔽rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad lags so // rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
translated: On the basis of that, Blessed One, you designate the non-entityness of the nature of phenomena.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags so //
translated: “The mark of compositional activity that is the basis of the imagined characteristic, which is the domain of conceptualization, is the dependent characteristic.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo de ma mchis pa nyid dang / de las cig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo de ma mchis pa nyid dang / de las cig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
translated: On the basis of that, Blessed One, you designate the non-entityness of nature and the other, the ultimate non-entityness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te /
translated: “Blessed One, I understand the meaning of what you have said as follows:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
translated: The mark of compositional activity that is the basis of the imagined characteristic, which is the domain of conceptualization,

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der yongs su ma grub cing ngo bo nyid de kho nas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid chos la bdag ma mchis pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der yongs su ma grub cing ngo bo nyid de kho nas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid chos la bdag ma mchis pa /
translated: The very sign of compositional activity is not established as that imagined characteristic. It is just by that very nature that it is natureless, the selflessness of phenomena,

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang lags pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang lags pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
translated: suchness, the pure object, which is the perfected characteristic.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: In dependence on that, the Bhagavān

original: de las cig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las gcig 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
analyzed: de las cig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las gcig 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
translated: designated the other as ultimate naturelessness.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the form aggregate,

original: phung po lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi lags so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi lags so //
translated: the same should be applied to the remaining aggregates.

original: phung po rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gi skye mched re re la yang de bzhin du lags @64a * //
analyzed: phung po rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gi skye mched re re la yang de bzhin du lags @64a * //

original: so // srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi srid pa'i yan lag re re la yang de bzhin lags so //
analyzed: so // srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi srid pa'i yan lag re re la yang de bzhin lags so //

original: zas bzhi po dag gi zas re re la yang de bzhin lags so //
analyzed: zas bzhi po dag gi zas re re la yang de bzhin lags so //
translated: The same is true for each of the four nutriments.

original: khams drug po dang / khams bco brgyad po dag gi khams re re la yang de bzhin lags so //
analyzed: khams drug po dang / khams bco brgyad po dag gi khams re re la yang de bzhin lags so //
translated: The same is true for each of the six elements and the eighteen elements.
