analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad la sogs so //
translated: The Blessed One, on the basis of that, designates the non-entityness of phenomena in terms of their characteristic.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas //

analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags te /

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / de las gcig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / de las gcig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
translated: The Blessed One, on the basis of that, designates the non-entityness of phenomena in terms of their production and also designates the non-entityness of phenomena in terms of their ultimate.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don 'di ltar bdag gis 'tshal te /

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa la ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi lags so //

translated: The non-nature of the

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams kyi yan lag re re la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi lags so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams kyi yan lag re re la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi lags so //
translated: The same should be applied to each of the branches of the path.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal lags te /
translated: Blessed One, this is how I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
translated: The imagined characteristic is the basis for the sphere of conceptualization.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhe'am /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhe'am /
translated: The characteristic of formations is either called “correct concentration”

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po zhe'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po zhe'am /
translated: or “the antidotes to the factors that are incompatible with concentration,”

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa zhe'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa zhe'am /
translated: or “the cultivation of concentration,”

original: ma skyes pa skye ba zhe'am /
analyzed: ma skyes pa skye ba zhe'am /
translated: or “the arising of what has not yet arisen,”

original: skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa nyid ces ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: skyes pa gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa nyid ces ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: or “the stability, non-forgetting, renewed arising, growth, and increase of what has arisen,” whether in terms of its essential characteristic🔽or in terms of its specific characteristics.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa gang lags pa de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
translated: The designation of names and symbols in this way is the imagined characteristic.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad lags so //🔽rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad lags so // rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
translated: The Blessed One has designated the non-entityness of phenomena in terms of that.🔽The basis of the imagined characteristic, which is the domain of conceptual thought,

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma gang lags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid lags te /
translated: is the dependent characteristic.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / de las cig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / de las cig shos don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid kyang 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
translated: The Blessed One has designated the non-entityness of arising and the ultimate non-entityness in terms of that.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i don bdag gis 'di ltar 'tshal te /
translated: Blessed One, I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said in this way:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas /
translated: The basis of the imagined characteristic, which is the domain of conceptual thought,🔽is the dependent characteristic.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der yongs su ma grub cing /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der yongs su ma grub cing /
translated: That very appearance of compositional activity is not established as that imagined characteristic.

original: ngo bo nyid de kho nas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid chos la bdag ma mchis pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de kho nas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid chos la bdag ma mchis pa /
translated: The nature of non-nature is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang lags pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa gang lags pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid lags te /
translated: The object of observation of the purity of thatness is the characteristic of the consummate.

original: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das de las cig shos chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
analyzed: de la brten nas bcom ldan 'das de las cig shos chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dogs par mdzad lags so //
translated: In dependence on that, Blessed One, the other, the ultimate non-nature of phenomena, is imputed.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na /🔽bca' @65a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na / bca' @65a * //
translated: Blessed One, for example,🔽all medicines

original: sga'i phye ma'i sman sbyar ba dang / bcud kyis len sbyar ba thams cad du bstsal bar bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: sga'i phye ma'i sman sbyar ba dang / bcud kyis len sbyar ba thams cad du bstsal bar bgyi ba lags so //
translated: are added to the flour of parched barley and to the ingredients of a medicinal elixir.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, the ultimate non-nature of phenomena is taught in terms of the non-nature of phenomena.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: and non-cessation, and primordial peace, and natural nirvana,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du bstsal bar bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di yang drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du bstsal bar bgyi ba lags so //
translated: this teaching of the ultimate purport of the Lord should be applied to all the sutras of the expedient meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na ri mo bri ba'i gzhi ni sngon po'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na ri mo bri ba'i gzhi ni sngon po'am /
translated: Lord, it is like this: for example, a surface for drawing or painting is of one taste in all drawings and paintings, whether blue,

original: ser po'am / dkar po'am /🔽dmar po'am / ri mor bgyi ba thams cad la ro gcig pa lags shing /
analyzed: ser po'am / dkar po'am / dmar po'am / ri mor bgyi ba thams cad la ro gcig pa lags shing /
translated: yellow, white,

original: ri mo bris pa de yang shin tu gsal bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: ri mo bris pa de yang shin tu gsal bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: red, or maroon, and it makes the drawings and paintings very clear.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the lack of own-being of all dharmas up to the natural nirvāṇa,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni drang pa'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang / drang ba'i don de dag shin tu gsal bar bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni drang pa'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro gcig pa dang / drang ba'i don de dag shin tu gsal bar bgyid pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, this teaching of definitive meaning is of one taste with all the sūtras of provisional meaning, and it makes those provisional meanings very clear.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na chab mar ni snod du bsgral ba dang / sha g-yos pa dang / bag chos kyi rnam pa sna tshogs la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na chab mar ni snod du bsgral ba dang / sha g-yos pa dang / bag chos kyi rnam pa sna tshogs la /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this: when ghee is added to various kinds of food, such as cooked meat and pastries,

original: chab mar bstsal na shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur ba lags so //🔽de bzhin du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas /
analyzed: chab mar bstsal na shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur ba lags so // de bzhin du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas /
translated: it makes them very delicious.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du bstsal na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad du bstsal na /
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, when this teaching of definitive meaning is added to all the sūtras of provisional meaning, beginning with the lack of entityness of phenomena and ending with natural complete nirvana,🔽it makes them very delicious.

original: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba chen por 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba chen por 'gyur lags so //
translated: It makes them very delicious.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na nam mkha' ni thams cad la ro gcig pa dang / bstsal ba thams cad la sgrib par mi 'gyur lags so //🔽de bzhin du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper bgyi na nam mkha' ni thams cad la ro gcig pa dang / bstsal ba thams cad la sgrib par mi 'gyur lags so // de bzhin du chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this: space is of one taste with regard to everything, and it is not obstructed by anything that is removed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro @65b gcig pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po las bstsal ba thams cad la bsgrib par mi 'gyur ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di ni drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde thams cad la ro @65b gcig pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po las bstsal ba thams cad la bsgrib par mi 'gyur ba lags so //
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, this teaching of definitive meaning that you have given, beginning with the lack of inherent identity of phenomena and continuing up to their natural complete nirvana, is of one taste with regard to all the sutras of provisional meaning, and it is not obstructed by anything that is removed from the Hearers’ Vehicle, the Solitary Buddhas’ Vehicle, or the Great Vehicle.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata, “Excellent!

original: don dam yang dag 'phags legs so legs so //
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags legs so legs so //
translated: Excellent, Paramārthasamudgata!

original: don dam yang dag 'phags khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs te bshad pa shes te /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs te bshad pa shes te /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, you have understood the intention of the Tathāgata.

original: don de la 'di lta ste bca' sga dang / ri mo bri ba'i gzhi dang / mar gyis gdab pa dang / nam mkha'i dpe legs par byas pa de ni /
analyzed: don de la 'di lta ste bca' sga dang / ri mo bri ba'i gzhi dang / mar gyis gdab pa dang / nam mkha'i dpe legs par byas pa de ni /
translated: This meaning is well illustrated by the examples of the clay, the drawing, the base for drawing, the oil, and the sky.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags de de bzhin te /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags de de bzhin te /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, it is just as you have said.🔽It is not otherwise, so hold it just as it is.

original: gzhan du ma yin gyi de ni de bzhin du zung shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin gyi de ni de bzhin du zung shig / de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dang por yul w'a r'a na s'i drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags su nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dang por yul w'a r'a na s'i drang srong smra ba ri dvags kyi nags su nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
translated: “Bhagavān, in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana in Vārāṇasī, for those who had entered the vehicle of the hearers,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par bstan pas chos kyi 'khor lo ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par bstan pas chos kyi 'khor lo ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba /
translated: the Bhagavān turned the marvelous and wonderful wheel of dharma

original: sngon lhar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: sngon lhar gyur pa'am /
translated: that had never been turned in the world by anyone, whether god or human.

original: mir gyur pa sus kyang chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du ma bskor ba cig rab tu bskor te /
analyzed: mir gyur pa sus kyang chos dang mthun par 'jig rten du ma bskor ba cig rab tu bskor te /
translated: He turned the wheel of Dharma in the world in a way that no one else, whether human or nonhuman, had ever turned before.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang bla na mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang bla na mchis pa /
translated: “Blessed One, the first turning of the wheel of Dharma was surpassable,

original: skabs mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs mchis pa /
translated: had a point of refutation,

original: drang ba'i don rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags la /
analyzed: drang ba'i don rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags la /
translated: and was a basis for dispute.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: “Blessed One, you then turned the wheel of Dharma a second time, beginning with the lack of intrinsic existence of phenomena,

original: skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with non-arising, non-ceasing, primordial peace, and the natural state of nirvana.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
translated: This was for those who had entered the Great Vehicle.

original: stong pa nyid kyi smos pa'i rnam pas ches ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi smos pa'i rnam pas ches ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis pa bskor te /
translated: This second turning of the wheel of Dharma was even more marvelous and wondrous, with its teachings on emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang bla na mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang bla na mchis pa /
translated: “Blessed One, the second turning of the wheel of Dharma was also surpassable,

original: skabs mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs mchis pa /
translated: There is an occasion.

original: drang ba'i don rtsod pa gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags kyi /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis @66a * //
analyzed: drang ba'i don rtsod pa gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa lags kyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis @66a * //
translated: This is a basis for dispute, a provisional meaning.

original: pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Blessed One, beginning with the lack of entityness of phenomena,

original: skye ba ma mchis pa nyid dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa nyid dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa nyid dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa nyid dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with non-production, non-cessation, primordial peace, and natural nirvāṇa,

original: theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la /
translated: for those who have entered all vehicles,

original: legs par rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo gsum pa bskor te /
analyzed: legs par rnam par phye ba dang ldan pa ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo gsum pa bskor te /
translated: you turned the wheel of Dharma a third time, which possesses excellent differentiation, and is marvelous and amazing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'di ni bla na ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba 'di ni bla na ma mchis pa /
translated: This wheel of Dharma turned by the Blessed One is unsurpassed,

original: skabs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: skabs ma mchis pa /
translated: it has no occasion,

original: des pa'i don lags te /
analyzed: des pa'i don lags te /
translated: it is definitive in meaning,

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa ma lags so ;
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa ma lags so ;
translated: and it is not a basis for dispute.

original: / bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams //
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid las brtsams //
translated: The Blessed One has taught the definitive meaning, beginning with the lack of intrinsic reality of phenomena,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi bar las brtsams nas //
translated: up to their natural complete nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di rigs kyi bu'am //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di rigs kyi bu'am //
translated: Blessed One, what amount of merit will a son or daughter of good family generate who, having heard this teaching of the definitive meaning,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis thos nas mos par bgyid pa dang / yi ger 'drir stsol ba dang / yi ger bris nas kyang 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / mchod pa dang / yang dag par 'ged pa dang / lung nod pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis thos nas mos par bgyid pa dang / yi ger 'drir stsol ba dang / yi ger bris nas kyang 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / mchod pa dang / yang dag par 'ged pa dang / lung nod pa dang /
translated: has faith in it, makes it into a written text, and having made it into a written text, preserves it, reads it, worships it, spreads it, recites it from memory,

original: kha ton bgyid pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar bgyid pa de bsod nams ji tsam zhig bskyed par 'gyur lags //
analyzed: kha ton bgyid pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar bgyid pa de bsod nams ji tsam zhig bskyed par 'gyur lags //
translated: reflects on it, and applies it through the aspect of meditation?

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having been asked this, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata, Paramārthasamudgata,

original: don dam yang dag 'phags rigs kyi bu'am //🔽rigs kyi bu mo de ni bsod nams dpag tu med ;
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags rigs kyi bu'am // rigs kyi bu mo de ni bsod nams dpag tu med ;
translated: “Noble sir, that son of a good family or🔽daughter of a good family generates immeasurable,

original: / grangs med pa bskyed de /
analyzed: / grangs med pa bskyed de /
translated: incalculable merit.

original: de'i bde bya bar sla ba ma yin mod kyi //
analyzed: de'i bde bya bar sla ba ma yin mod kyi //
translated: Although it is not easy to describe its happiness,

original: 'on kyang mdor bsdus te khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mdor bsdus te khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: nevertheless, I will explain it to you in brief.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, it is like this:

original: sen mo'i rtse mo la gnas pa'i sa'i rdul gang dag yin pa de dag ni sa la gnas pa'i sa'i rdul rnams dang bsgrun na /
analyzed: sen mo'i rtse mo la gnas pa'i sa'i rdul gang dag yin pa de dag ni sa la gnas pa'i sa'i rdul rnams dang bsgrun na /
translated: If the amount of dust on the tip of this fingernail were compared to the earth,

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas //
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas //
translated: it would not even be a hundredth of it,

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: not a thousandth, not a hundred-thousandth of it, not a count, not a fraction, not a number, not an example, not a simile.

original: ba lang gi rjes kyi chu ni rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu dang bsgrun na /
analyzed: ba lang gi rjes kyi chu ni rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu dang bsgrun na /
translated: If the water in the hoofprint of an ox were compared to the water in the four great oceans,

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /🔽@66b rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas /🔽@66b rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: it would not even be a hundredth of it,🔽not a thousandth, not a hundred-thousandth of it, not a count, not a fraction, not a number, not an example, not a simile.

original: de bzhin du don dam yang dag 'phags ngas drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mos pa nas //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam yang dag 'phags ngas drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mos pa nas //
translated: Likewise, I, Paramārthasamudgata, have explained the sūtras of provisional meaning to be those that are based on the word,🔽

original: bsgom pa'i rnam par sbyor bar byed pa'i bar gyi bsod nams gang bshad pa de ni /🔽nges pa'i don bstan pa la mos pa las yang dag par grub pa nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam par sbyor bar byed pa'i bar gyi bsod nams gang bshad pa de ni / nges pa'i don bstan pa la mos pa las yang dag par grub pa nas /
translated: Likewise, Paramārthasamudgata, the merit that I have explained as arising from the sūtras of interpretable meaning, from the aspiration toward them,🔽up to the application in the aspects of meditation,🔽when compared to the merit that arises from the aspiration toward the teaching of the definitive meaning,

original: bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor ba las yang dag par grub pa'i bar gyi bsod nams 'di dang bsgrun na /🔽brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor ba las yang dag par grub pa'i bar gyi bsod nams 'di dang bsgrun na / brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas //
translated: up to the application in the aspects of meditation,🔽does not approach even a hundredth part of it, and so on up to

original: rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: it does not bear comparison.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the Bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags //
translated: “Lord, what is the name of this teaching of the explanation of the thought?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi //
translated: How should I remember it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Good, good, Paramārthasamudgata!

original: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ni don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags 'di ni don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the ultimate truth, O Sublime Ones.🔽You should know this teaching as the teaching of the ultimate truth.

original: 'di ni don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig / don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig / don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this teaching of the ultimate truth was explained,

original: srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: six hundred thousand living beings gave rise to the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go //
analyzed: nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go //
translated: Three hundred thousand śrāvakas purified the eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena, free from dust and uncontaminated.

original: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: One hundred fifty thousand śrāvakas liberated their minds from defilements without further grasping.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes gsungs so / // / bam po sum cu dgu pa /
translated: Seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained forbearance with regard to the non-arising of phenomena.

original: chos gdags pa rnam par dgod pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par dgod pa las brtsams nas /
translated: From the chapter on the presentation of the designation of phenomena,

original: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi rab tu dbye ba ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ji skad byung ba bzhin rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gyi rab tu dbye ba ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las ji skad byung ba bzhin rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the paths of serenity and insight that are included in the yoga should be understood according to the Sandhinirmocana Sutra.

original: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva Maitreya asked the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i ci la gnas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i ci la gnas /
translated: “Lord, what is the bodhisattva’s basis?

original: ci la brten te /
analyzed: ci la brten te /
translated: What does he rely on

original: theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bgyid lags //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bgyid lags //
translated: to cultivate serenity and insight in the Great Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @67a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @67a * //
translated: The Lord replied:

original: pa ; byams pa chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la gnas shing brten nas so //
analyzed: pa ; byams pa chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la gnas shing brten nas so //
translated: “Maitreya, he relies on and bases himself on the non-abandonment of the aspiration for unexcelled perfect enlightenment and on the establishment of the designation of dharmas.🔽The Lord said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: “Maitreya, the bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of serenity and insight should first properly learn and reflect on the topics of the scriptures that are to be understood conceptually, such as the skandhas, dhātus, and āyatanas.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgongs pa yongs su grub pa zhes gang dag bstan pa de la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgongs pa yongs su grub pa zhes gang dag bstan pa de la /
translated: The image with conceptual thought, the image without conceptual thought, the limit of existence, and the perfect realization of the intention.

original: bcom ldan 'das du zhig zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das du zhig zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, how many of these are the objects of śamatha?

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: gcig ste / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcig ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: There is one, namely

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: the image without conceptual thought.

original: du zhig lhag mthong gi dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: du zhig lhag mthong gi dmigs pa lags /
translated: How many are the objects of vipaśyanā?

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: gcig kho na ste /
translated: There is one, namely

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: the image with conceptual thought.

original: du zhig de gnyi ga'i dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: du zhig de gnyi ga'i dmigs pa lags /
translated: How many are the objects of both?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two, namely

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the limit of existence and the perfect realization of the intention.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po de dag la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po de dag la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas, relying on and abiding in those four things that are the objects of śamatha and vipaśyanā,

original: ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyi ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags //
analyzed: ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyi ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags //
translated: How should they be skilled in vipaśyanā?”

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byams pa ngas chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byams pa ngas chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: “Maitreya, I have established the presentation of the designation of phenomena as follows:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang ; gling gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang ; gling gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: the class of sūtras, the class of melodious praises, the class of prophecies, the class of verses, the class of sayings, the class of narratives, the class of parables, the class of former events,

original: skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde gang dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad pa de dag byang chub sems dpas legs par thos //
analyzed: skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde gang dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad pa de dag byang chub sems dpas legs par thos //
translated: the class of extensive discourses, the class of miraculous events, and the class of instructions. Bodhisattvas should listen well to those that are taught to bodhisattvas.

original: legs par bzung //
analyzed: legs par bzung //
translated: They should grasp them well.

original: kha ton byang bar byas //
analyzed: kha ton byang bar byas //
translated: They should master them by recitation.

original: yid kyis legs par brtags //
analyzed: yid kyis legs par brtags //
translated: They should examine them well with their minds.

original: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas nas de gcig pu dben par 'dug ste nang du yang dag bzhag nas /
analyzed: mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byas nas de gcig pu dben par 'dug ste nang du yang dag bzhag nas /
translated: Having understood it well through seeing, he sits alone in seclusion and internally properly stabilizes his mind.

original: ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dang nyid @67b yid la byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dang nyid @67b yid la byed cing /
translated: He attends to just those phenomena that he has well contemplated.

original: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do //
analyzed: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to the mind by means of the mind that attends to them, by continuously attending to the mind internally.

original: de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du gnas pa de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du gnas pa de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: When he has entered that and frequently dwells in that, the physical pliancy and mental pliancy that arise are called “calming.”

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva seeks calming.

original: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems can shin tu sbyangs pa de thob nas //
analyzed: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems can shin tu sbyangs pa de thob nas //
translated: Having attained that physical pliancy and mental pliancy,

original: de nyid la gnas te bsams pa'i rnam pa spangs nas //
analyzed: de nyid la gnas te bsams pa'i rnam pa spangs nas //
translated: he remains in that and abandons the aspects of contemplation.

original: ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed //
translated: He examines and analyzes those very phenomena that he has contemplated, in the form of representations that are the domain of his meditative concentration.

original: mos par byed do //🔽de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la shes bya'i don de rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa dang / bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang ;
analyzed: mos par byed do // de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la shes bya'i don de rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa dang / bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang ;
translated: He has conviction about them.🔽In this way, the discernment, thorough analysis, judgment, reflection,

original: bye brag 'byed pa dang / lta ba dang / rtog pa gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag 'byed pa dang / lta ba dang / rtog pa gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste /
translated: acceptance, and desire for those objects of knowledge in the form of representations that are the domain of his meditative concentration is called “insight.”

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva is skilled in insight.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ji srid du sems la dmigs pa'i sems nang du yid la bgyid pa na ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ji srid du sems la dmigs pa'i sems nang du yid la bgyid pa na ;
translated: Blessed One, for as long as the bodhisattva is mentally attending to the mind that is focused on the mind,

original: ji srid du lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob ba de'i bar du /
analyzed: ji srid du lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob ba de'i bar du /
translated: for that long he has not attained physical and mental pliancy.

original: yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhes bgyi //
analyzed: yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhes bgyi //
translated: What is that mental attention called?

original: byams pa zhi gnas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa zhi gnas ni ma yin te /
translated: Maitreya, it is not śamatha.

original: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is associated with the aspiration that is conducive to śamatha.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ji srid du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ji srid du /
translated: Blessed One, for as long as the bodhisattva

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob kyi bar du /🔽ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nang du /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa thob kyi bar du / ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nang du /
translated: has not attained physical and mental pliancy,🔽how does he bring to mind those phenomena that he has properly contemplated

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan nang du yid la byed pa'i yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhig bgyi ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan nang du yid la byed pa'i yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhig bgyi ;
translated: as images that are the domain of samādhi? What is that mental attention called?

original: byams pa lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
translated: Maitreya, it is not vipaśyanā.

original: lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is associated with the aspiration that is conducive to vipaśyanā.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi lam dang / lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi lam dang / lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi'am /
translated: Blessed One, should the path of śamatha and the path of vipaśyanā be called different?

original: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi //
translated: Or should they be called non-different?
The Blessed One said,🔽“Maitreya, they are not different.

original: stsal pa / byams pa tha dad pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: stsal pa / byams pa tha dad pa yang ma yin //
translated: The Lord said: “Maitreya, it is not different,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is not not different.”

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not different?

original: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it takes as its object the mind that is the object of insight.

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not not different?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a conceptual image with conceptual thought.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par lta bar bgyid pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gang lags pa de ci lags //🔽de sems de dang tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par lta bar bgyid pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gang lags pa de ci lags // de sems de dang tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Lord, what is that image that is the domain of the concentration of discernment?🔽Is it different from that mind?

original: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi //
translated: Or is it not different?”

original: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: The Lord said: “Maitreya, it is not different.

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not different?

original: gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that image is merely a representation.

original: byams pa rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: byams pa rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: Maitreya, I have explained that consciousness is distinguished by the mere representation of an object.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan te /
translated: Blessed One, the object of concentration is a reflection.

original: gal te sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na /
analyzed: gal te sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na /
translated: If it is not different from the mind,

original: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la ji ltar rtog par bgyid lags //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la ji ltar rtog par bgyid lags //
translated: how does the mind itself conceive of the mind itself?

original: bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: byams pa de la gang yang chos gang la yang rtog par mi byed mod kyi //
analyzed: byams pa de la gang yang chos gang la yang rtog par mi byed mod kyi //
translated: Maitreya, in that case, it is not that anything at all conceives of anything at all.

original: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa dang ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa dang ltar snang ngo //
translated: However, the mind that arises in that way and the reflection that appears are not different.

original: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na gzugs la brten nas me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs nyid mthong yang //
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na gzugs la brten nas me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs nyid mthong yang //
translated: Maitreya, it is like this: for example, based on a form, in a very clear mirror-surface, the form itself is seen,

original: gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te de la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te de la /
translated: but one thinks, “I see a reflection.”

original: gzugs de la gzugs brnyan snang ba de don tha dad par snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs de la gzugs brnyan snang ba de don tha dad par snang ngo //
translated: In that case, the reflection of the form appears as a different object.

original: de bzhin du de ltar skyes pa'i sems de dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'ang de las don gzhan yin pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar skyes pa'i sems de dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'ang de las don gzhan yin pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: Likewise, the mind that has arisen in that way and the image that is the domain of samādhi appear as if they were different objects from it.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i sems kyi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i sems kyi //
translated: Bhagavān, the images of form, etc., of the minds of sentient beings

original: gzugs brnyan rang bzhin du gnas pa gang lags pa de yang /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rang bzhin du gnas pa gang lags pa de yang /
translated: that abide as the nature

original: sems de dang tha dad pa ma lags pa zhes bgyi'am //
analyzed: sems de dang tha dad pa ma lags pa zhes bgyi'am //
translated: are they said to be not different from that mind?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Maitreya, they are said to be not different.

original: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams la ni /
analyzed: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams la ni /
translated: However, for childish beings with mistaken minds,

original: gzugs brnyan de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam de nyid yang dag @68b pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam de nyid yang dag @68b pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so //
translated: because they do not know that those images are just mere cognition, they think in a mistaken way.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na gcig tu lhag mthong sgom pa lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na gcig tu lhag mthong sgom pa lags //
translated: Bhagavān, to what extent do bodhisattvas cultivate vipaśyanā exclusively?

original: bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas //
translated: When, through continuous attention,

original: sems kyi mtshan ma nyid yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan ma nyid yid la byed pa'o //
translated: he attends to the very sign of the mind.

original: ci tsam gyis na gcig tu zhi gnas sgom pa lags //🔽bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: ci tsam gyis na gcig tu zhi gnas sgom pa lags // bka' stsal pa //
translated: To what extent does he cultivate śamatha exclusively?

original: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems nyid yid la byed pa'o //🔽ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems nyid yid la byed pa'o // ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One replied, When, through continuous attention, he attends to the mind itself without interruption.

original: mnyam par zung du 'jug pa lags //🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mnyam par zung du 'jug pa lags // bka' stsal pa /
translated: To what extent do śamatha and vipaśyanā become mixed and balanced?

original: gang gi tshe sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa'o /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa'o /
translated: The Blessed One replied, When he attends to the very one-pointedness of mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags //
translated: Blessed One, what is the sign of the mind?

original: byams pa lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
translated: Maitreya, it is the conceptual image that is the object of samādhi, the object of vipaśyanā.

original: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags /
analyzed: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags /
translated: What is the uninterrupted mind?

original: byams pa zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: Maitreya, it is the mind that focuses on the image, which is the object of serenity.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang lags //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang lags //
translated: What is one-pointedness of mind?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de la 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de la 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: It is the mind that is focused single-mindedly on the image that is the object of concentration, and which has the understanding that “this is mere representation. ”

original: de rtogs nas kyang de bzhin nyid du yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs nas kyang de bzhin nyid du yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: And it is the attention that is focused on that understanding as reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis //
translated: Blessed One, how many kinds of insight are there?

original: byams pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Maitreya, there are three kinds:

original: mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa las byung byung ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa las byung byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from signs, that which arises from thorough searching, and that which arises from discernment.

original: mtshan ma las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight that arises from signs?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'ba' zhig yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan 'ba' zhig yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is insight that focuses on the mere image that is the object of concentration, which is accompanied by discursive thought.

original: yongs su tshol ba las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight that arises from thorough searching?

original: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par ma rtogs pa'i chos de dag nyid shin tu legs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /🔽yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par ma rtogs pa'i chos de dag nyid shin tu legs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is insight that is applied to the realization of those very phenomena that have not been well realized by wisdom.

original: so sor rtog pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight that arises from discernment?

original: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong @69a * //🔽gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong @69a * // gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is insight that is applied to the attainment of the happiness of liberation through the liberation of those very phenomena that have been well realized by wisdom.

original: zhi gnas la rnam pa du mchis //
analyzed: zhi gnas la rnam pa du mchis //
translated: What are the different kinds of serenity?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: bar chad med pa'i sems de'i rjes su 'brang bas de yang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems de'i rjes su 'brang bas de yang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: “It is also said to be of three kinds, because it follows the uninterrupted mind.

original: byams pa yang zhi gnas ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: byams pa yang zhi gnas ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Maitreya, serenity is of eight kinds:

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'o //
translated: The first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four types:

original: byams pa tshad med pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa tshad med pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms tshad med pa'o //
translated: immeasurable loving-kindness, immeasurable compassion, immeasurable joy, and immeasurable equanimity.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni chos la gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni chos la gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi //
translated: Blessed One, śamatha and vipaśyanā are called abiding in the Dharma,

original: chos la mi gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
analyzed: chos la mi gnas pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
translated: and they are also called not abiding in the Dharma.

original: chos la gnas pa ni gang lags //
analyzed: chos la gnas pa ni gang lags //
translated: What is abiding in the Dharma?

original: chos la mi gnas pa ni gang lags //
analyzed: chos la mi gnas pa ni gang lags //
translated: What is not abiding in the Dharma?

original: byams pa ji ltar gzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni chos la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa ji ltar gzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brang bas don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni chos la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Maitreya, śamatha and vipaśyanā that are focused on the meaning, following the characteristics of the Dharma that are apprehended and contemplated, are abiding in the Dharma.

original: gzung ba dang bsams pa'i chos la mi ltos par gzhan gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la brten nas don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa 'di lta ste /🔽rnam par bsngos pa'am //🔽rnam par rnags pa'am //
analyzed: gzung ba dang bsams pa'i chos la mi ltos par gzhan gyi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la brten nas don la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa 'di lta ste / rnam par bsngos pa'am // rnam par rnags pa'am //
translated: It is the serenity and insight that pertain to the meaning of the teachings, and it is as follows:

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams sam //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams sam //
translated: It is the serenity and insight that pertain to the meaning of the teachings, and it is as follows:

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'am //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'am / sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'am //
translated: It is the serenity and insight that pertain to the meaning of the teachings, and it is as follows:

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'am //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽de lta bu dang mthun pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni chos la mi gnas pa yin par rig par bya'o //

original: byams pa de la nga ni chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas //🔽byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rnon por 'dogs so //
analyzed: byams pa de la nga ni chos la gnas pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas //🔽byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rnon por 'dogs so //
translated: It is the serenity and insight that pertain to the meaning of the teachings, and it is as follows:🔽It is

original: chos la mi gnas pa la brten nas //
analyzed: chos la mi gnas pa la brten nas //
translated: Based on not abiding in the Dharma,

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul por 'dogs so //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul por 'dogs so //
translated: one is designated as a faith-follower of dull faculties.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, śamatha and vipaśyanā are said to be focused on unmixed phenomena,

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
translated: and they are also said to be focused on mixed phenomena.

original: ma 'dres @69b pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags //
analyzed: ma 'dres @69b pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags //
translated: What is focused on unmixed phenomena?

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags //
translated: What is focused on mixed phenomena?

original: byams pa gal te byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar gzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos rnams las mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos so so la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin no //
analyzed: byams pa gal te byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar gzung ba dang / bsams pa'i chos rnams las mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos so so la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin no //
translated: Maitreya, if bodhisattvas cultivate śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on each of the Dharmas such as the sūtra collection, based on the Dharmas as they have been apprehended and contemplated, that is śamatha and vipaśyanā focused on unmixed phenomena.

original: gal te mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos de dag nyid gcig tu bzlum pa dang / gcig tu bsdu ba dang / gcig tu btul ba dang / phung po gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: gal te mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos de dag nyid gcig tu bzlum pa dang / gcig tu bsdu ba dang / gcig tu btul ba dang / phung po gcig tu byas te /
translated: to condense them into one, to tame them into one, and to make them into one heap,

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba /🔽de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni de bzhin nyid la gzhol ba / de bzhin nyid la 'bab pa /
translated: you would think, ‘All these teachings are directed toward suchness,🔽they descend into suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid la bab pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la bab pa /
translated: they are focused on suchness,

original: byang chub la gzhol ba //🔽byang chub la 'bab pa /
analyzed: byang chub la gzhol ba // byang chub la 'bab pa /
translated: they are directed toward awakening,🔽they descend into awakening,

original: byang chub la bab pa /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba /
analyzed: byang chub la bab pa / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba /
translated: they are focused on awakening,🔽they are directed toward nirvāṇa,

original: bya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa /🔽mya ngan 'das pa la bab pa ;
analyzed: bya ngan las 'das pa la 'bab pa / mya ngan 'das pa la bab pa ;
translated: they descend into nirvāṇa,🔽they are focused on nirvāṇa,

original: gnas gyur pa la gzhol ba /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa la gzhol ba /
translated: they are directed toward transformation,

original: gnas gyur pa la 'bab pa /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa la 'bab pa /
translated: they descend into transformation,

original: gnas gyur pa la 'bab pa dag ste /🔽chos 'di dag thams cad ni dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa la 'bab pa dag ste / chos 'di dag thams cad ni dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa /
translated: they are focused on transformation.🔽All these teachings are expressed by means of immeasurable and

original: grangs med pa dag mngon par brjod pas mngon par brjod pa yin no snyam du yid la byed pa de ni /
analyzed: grangs med pa dag mngon par brjod pas mngon par brjod pa yin no snyam du yid la byed pa de ni /
translated: innumerable virtuous expressions.’

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yin no //
translated: It is serenity and insight that focus on mixed phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni 'dres pa chung ngu'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni 'dres pa chung ngu'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi //
translated: Blessed One, serenity and insight are called “focusing on mixed phenomena to a small degree.”

original: 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: They are also called “focusing on mixed phenomena to a great degree.”

original: 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
analyzed: 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes kyang bgyi na /
translated: They are also called “focusing on mixed phenomena to an immeasurable degree.”

original: 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is focusing on mixed phenomena to a small degree?

original: 'dres pa chen por 'gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: 'dres pa chen por 'gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is focusing on mixed phenomena to a great degree?

original: 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags //
analyzed: 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags //
translated: What is focusing on mixed phenomena to an immeasurable degree?

original: byams pa mdo'i sde nas /
analyzed: byams pa mdo'i sde nas /
translated: Maitreya, in the sutra collection,

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la bab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag so sor gcig tu bzlums te /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la bab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag so sor gcig tu bzlums te /
translated: the sutras, the extensive discourses, the discourses on the great way, the discourses on observed phenomena, the discourses that are a repetition, the discourses that are an analysis, the discourses that identify the cause, the stories of past lives, the extensive teachings, the marvelous events, and the instructions are each combined into one.

original: yid la byed pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ni 'dres pa chung ngu'i chos la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ni 'dres pa chung ngu'i chos la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The śamatha and vipaśyanā that take as their object the small unification should be understood.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa de dag nyid ji snyed gzung @70a * //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa de dag nyid ji snyed gzung @70a * //
translated: The mental attention that combines into one all those sūtras and so on,

original: ba dang / bsams pa so sor gcig tu bzlums te /
analyzed: ba dang / bsams pa so sor gcig tu bzlums te /
translated: which have been taken up and reflected upon,

original: yid la byed pa ni 'dres pa rgya chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni 'dres pa rgya chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the mental attention that takes as its object the Dharma that is the great unification.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa tshad med pa rnams dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa rnams dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa tshad med pa rnams gcig tu bzlums te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa tshad med pa rnams dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge tshad med pa rnams dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa tshad med pa rnams gcig tu bzlums te /
translated: The mental attention that combines into one all the immeasurable Dharma teachings of the tathāgatas, the immeasurable Dharma words and letters, and the immeasurable wisdoms and confidence that are higher and higher,

original: yid la byed pa ni 'dres pa tshad med pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni 'dres pa tshad med pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the mental attention that takes as its object the Dharma that is the immeasurable unification.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na /
translated: Blessed One, by what means

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob bar 'gyur lags /
translated: One will attain śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on the phenomena of the mixed.🔽

original: byams pa de ni rgyu lngas thob par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa de ni rgyu lngas thob par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: “Maitreya, it should be understood that the attainment of śamatha and vipaśyanā that focuses on the phenomena of the composite is due to five causes.

original: 'di lta ste yid la byed pa'i tshe skad cig skad cig la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / 'du shes sna tshogs rnams par spangs te ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste yid la byed pa'i tshe skad cig skad cig la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / 'du shes sna tshogs rnams par spangs te ;
translated: They are as follows: When mental attention occurs, it destroys all the supports for the negative tendencies.🔽It abandons the various types of discrimination and attains delight in the joy of the Dharma.🔽It correctly knows the immeasurable and uninterrupted aspects of the light of the Dharma that shines in the ten directions.

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba 'thob pa dang / chos kyi snang ba phyogs bcur tshad med cing rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yang dag par shes pa dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa dang ldan pa rnams par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam par ma brtags pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba 'thob pa dang / chos kyi snang ba phyogs bcur tshad med cing rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yang dag par shes pa dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa dang ldan pa rnams par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam par ma brtags pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba dang /
translated: It is the arising of the signs of the pure stage that are endowed with the accomplishment of the purpose and that are not imagined.

original: chos kyi sku thob pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su 'grub par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gong ma bas ches gong ma bzang po bas ches bzang po yang dag par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su 'grub par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gong ma bas ches gong ma bzang po bas ches bzang po yang dag par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: In order to attain the Dharma Body, to perfect it, and to accomplish it, he takes up the causes that are higher and higher, and more and more excellent.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de gang la rtogs shing //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de gang la rtogs shing //
translated: Blessed One, that śamatha and vipaśyanā which have mixed dharmas as their object—what is it that realizes them?

original: gang la 'thob par 'tshal bar bgyi lags //
analyzed: gang la 'thob par 'tshal bar bgyi lags //
translated: What is it that attains them?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: byams pas dang po rab tu dga' ba la ni rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: byams pas dang po rab tu dga' ba la ni rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Maitreya, it is realized on the Joyous, the first stage.

original: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa la ni thob par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa la ni thob par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known that it is attained on the third stage, the Luminous.

original: byams pa de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas kyang de la rjes su bslab cing yid la bya ba mi gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas kyang de la rjes su bslab cing yid la bya ba mi gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, however, even a beginner bodhisattva should train in it and not give up mental attention to it.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba lags //
translated: Blessed One, how does śamatha and vipaśyanā become a samādhi that is analytical and has both conception and discernment?

original: ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis @70b shing dpyod pa tsam du 'gyur ba lags //
analyzed: ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis @70b shing dpyod pa tsam du 'gyur ba lags //
translated: How does it become one that is without conception but does have discernment?

original: ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis pa dang / dpyod pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags //
analyzed: ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis pa dang / dpyod pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags //
translated: How does it become one that is without either conception or discernment?

original: byams pa ji ltar gzung zhing brtags pa dang dpyad pa'i chos rnams la de dag gi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong pa'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byams pa ji ltar gzung zhing brtags pa dang dpyad pa'i chos rnams la de dag gi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong pa'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Maitreya, śamatha and vipaśyanā that are investigations that analyze the salient aspects of the phenomena that are being apprehended, examined, and analyzed, and that experience their coarse and obvious characteristics,

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: are samādhis that have both conception and discernment.

original: de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong pa'i rjes su dpyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong pa'i rjes su dpyod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: They are not investigations that analyze the experience of the coarse and obvious characteristics of those phenomena.

original: 'on kyang de snang ba 'ol spyi'i dran pa tsam phra mo myong pa'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang de snang ba 'ol spyi'i dran pa tsam phra mo myong pa'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni //
translated: However, that is śamatha and vipaśyanā that is a subsequent investigation of a subtle experience that is a mere general recollection of appearances.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //🔽de dag gi mtshan ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du lhun gyis grub par chos myong ba yid la byed pas //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no // de dag gi mtshan ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du lhun gyis grub par chos myong ba yid la byed pas //
translated: That is samādhi that is only analysis without conception.🔽The śamatha and vipaśyanā that is the mental engagement of experiencing all phenomena in all ways spontaneously is

original: rnam par spyod pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: rnam par spyod pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: samādhi that is neither conception nor analysis.

original: byams pa yang chos yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni //
analyzed: byams pa yang chos yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni //
translated: The śamatha and vipaśyanā that arises from the investigation of phenomena is

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //🔽so sor rtog pa las byung ba'i gang yin pa de ni //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no // so sor rtog pa las byung ba'i gang yin pa de ni //
translated: samādhi that is both conception and analysis.🔽The śamatha and vipaśyanā that arises from discernment is

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: samādhi that is only analysis without conception.

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The concentration that is neither discursive nor investigative has as its object a mixed phenomenon.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags //🔽rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags // rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang lags //
translated: Maitreya, what is the reason for calm abiding?🔽What is the reason for special insight?

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags //
translated: What is the reason for equanimity?

original: byams pa sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //🔽byams pa sems bying ngam /
analyzed: byams pa sems rgod pa'am rgod du dogs pa na kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o // byams pa sems bying ngam /
