translated: Maitreya, when the mind is agitated or is in danger of agitation, the attention that focuses on the mind and on those phenomena that are conducive to disenchantment is called the reason for calm abiding.

original: bying du dogs pa na mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //🔽byams pa zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: bying du dogs pa na mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //🔽byams pa zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: Maitreya, when the mind is lax or is in danger of becoming lax, the attention that focuses on the mind and on those phenomena that are conducive to a sense of delight is called the reason for special insight.🔽Maitreya, when the mind is balanced and is in a natural state, the attention that focuses on the mind and on those phenomena that are conducive to equanimity is called the reason for equanimity.

original: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am //
analyzed: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am //
translated: Or else, it is the path of unification,

original: zung du 'brel pa'i lam yang rung ste /🔽de gnyi @71a * //
analyzed: zung du 'brel pa'i lam yang rung ste / de gnyi @71a * //
translated: which is the union of serenity and insight.

original: ga'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa la /
analyzed: ga'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa la /
translated: The two of them are defiled by the secondary defilements of laziness and excitedness-remorse.

original: sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na /
analyzed: sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na /
translated: When the mind engages its object naturally,

original: yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: the spontaneous mental attention is called the sign of equanimity.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if the cultivation of serenity and insight is the thorough cognition of the Dharma and the thorough cognition of the meaning,

original: ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar chos so so yang dag par rig pa lags /
translated: how is there the thorough cognition of the Dharma?

original: ji ltar don so so yang dag par rig pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar don so so yang dag par rig pa lags /
translated: How is there the thorough cognition of the meaning?

original: byams pa rnam pa lngas chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa lngas chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, there is the thorough cognition of the Dharma in five ways:

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pas so //
analyzed: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pas so //
translated: by way of name, phrase, syllable, individual, and collection.

original: ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gang zhe na /
translated: What is a name?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la /
translated: It is the cause of all the phenomena of defilement and purity.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi ming du bya bar btags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi ming du bya bar btags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the designation of the names of the own-beings and the varieties of the dharmas of defilement and of purification.

original: tshig gang zhe na /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gang zhe na / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: What is a word?

original: gnas dang / rten dang / ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs la brten pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang / rten dang / ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs la brten pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the collection of those very names, the basis and support for the conventional expression of the meaning of defilement and purification.

original: yi ge gang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge gang zhe na /
translated: What is a syllable?

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yig 'bru gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yig 'bru gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the letter which is the basis of those two.

original: de dag so so las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag so so las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analytical knowledge of the Teaching?

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so sor yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so sor yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the analytical knowledge which has for its object the unmixed teachings.

original: bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analytical knowledge of the meaning?

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the analytical knowledge which has for its object the mixed teachings.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All of these are combined into one and called the correct knowledge of the teaching.

original: de ltar na chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the correct knowledge of the teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva has ten aspects of the correct knowledge of the import.

original: ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa'i don dang / gzung ba'i don dang / gnas kyi don dang / longs spyod kyi don dang / phyin ci log gi don dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang /
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa'i don dang / gzung ba'i don dang / gnas kyi don dang / longs spyod kyi don dang / phyin ci log gi don dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang /
translated: The import of existence as it is, the import of apprehension, the import of the apprehended, the import of the basis, the import of enjoyment, the import of error, the import of non-error,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gyis so //
translated: the import of defilement, and the import of purification.

original: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa pa dang rnam @71b par byang ba'i chos rnams la rnam par rab tu dbye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa pa dang rnam @71b par byang ba'i chos rnams la rnam par rab tu dbye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Maitreya, the import of existence as it is is the ultimate of all the divisions of the dharmas of defilement and purification.

original: ji snyed yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is existence as it is.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: phung po rnams kyi grangs ni lngas so //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi grangs ni lngas so //
translated: The aggregates are enumerated as five.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi grangs ni drug gis so //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyi grangs ni drug gis so //
translated: The internal sense bases are enumerated as six.

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi yang grangs drug kho nas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi yang grangs drug kho nas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The external sense bases are also enumerated as six.

original: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of those same dharmas that are afflicted and purified is just as it is,

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: and that is sevenfold.

original: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of arising is the absence of a beginning and end of the conditioning forces.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of characteristics is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of dharmas in all dharmas.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa tsam nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa tsam nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of representation is the mere representation of the conditioning forces.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of abiding is the truth of suffering that I have taught.

original: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of wrong practice is the truth of the origin that I have taught.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of purification is the truth of cessation that I have taught.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas lam gyi bden ba bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas lam gyi bden ba bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of right practice is the truth of the path that I have taught.

original: byams pa de la 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni sems can thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: byams pa de la 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / log par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni sems can thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of arising, the suchness of abiding, and the suchness of wrong practice are the same for all sentient beings.

original: byams pa de la mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni chos thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: byams pa de la mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni chos thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of characteristics and the suchness of representations are the same for all phenomena.

original: byams pa de la rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de'i byang chub thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //🔽byams pa de la yang dag par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni thos pa thams cad 'dres pa'i chos @72a * //
analyzed: byams pa de la rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de'i byang chub thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo // byams pa de la yang dag par bsgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni thos pa thams cad 'dres pa'i chos @72a * //
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of purification is the same for all the awakenings—the awakening of the śrāvakas, the awakening of the pratyekabuddhas, and the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i shes rab mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i shes rab mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of accomplishment is the same for all the wisdoms that are included in the śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on the phenomena that are included in all the teachings.

original: byams pa de la 'dzin pa'i don ni skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / byams pa de gzung pa'i don ni phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag yin no //
analyzed: byams pa de la 'dzin pa'i don ni skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / byams pa de gzung pa'i don ni phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag yin no //
translated: Maitreya, the object of grasping is the six external sense bases.

original: byams pa yang 'dzin pa'i don gang yin pa de ni gzung ba'i don kyang yin no //
analyzed: byams pa yang 'dzin pa'i don gang yin pa de ni gzung ba'i don kyang yin no //
translated: Maitreya, the object of grasping is also the object of apprehension.

original: byams pa de la gnas kyi don ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la gnas kyi don ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa ste /
translated: Maitreya, the object of location is the world systems.

original: gang la gnas na sems can gyi khams snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas na sems can gyi khams snang ba'o //
translated: Where do they abide? In the realm of sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: grong tshig dang / grong tshig brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / rgya mtsho la thug pa'i sa dang / de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / de brgya dang / de stong dang /
analyzed: grong tshig dang / grong tshig brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / rgya mtsho la thug pa'i sa dang / de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / 'dzam bu'i gling dang / de brgya dang / de stong dang /
translated: a village, a hundred villages, a thousand villages, a hundred thousand villages, the land up to the ocean, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, Jambudvīpa, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a four-continent world system, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a small chiliocosm, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a medium dichiliocosm, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a great trichiliocosm, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a hundred million, a billion, a hundred billion, a hundred trillion, a hundred quadrillion, a hundred quintillion, a hundred sextillion, a hundred septillion, a hundred octillion, a hundred nonillion, a hundred undecillion, a hundred duodecillion, a hundred tredecillion, a hundred quattuordecillion, a hundred quindecillion, a hundred sexdecillion, a hundred septendecillion, a hundred octodecillion, a hundred novedecillion, a hundred vigintillion, a hundred trigintillion, a hundred quadragintillion, a hundred quinquagintillion, a hundred sexagintillion, a hundred septuagintillion, a hundred octogintillion, a hundred nonagintillion, a hundred centillion, a hundred decilion, a hundred undecillion, a hundred duodecillion, a hundred tredecillion, a hundred quattuordecillion, a hundred quindecillion, a hundred sexdecillion, a hundred septendecillion, a hundred octodecillion, a hundred novedecillion, a hundred vigintillion, a hundred trigintillion, a hundred quadragintillion, a hundred quinquagintillion, a hundred sexagintillion, a hundred

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa phrag 'bum gyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag go //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa phrag 'bum gyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag go //
translated: great trichiliocosm world systems.

original: byams pa de la longs spyod kyi don ni yongs su spyad pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: byams pa de la longs spyod kyi don ni yongs su spyad pa'i phyir ;
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of enjoyment is for the sake of using

original: ngas sems can rnams kyi yongs su gzung ba dang yo byad bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: ngas sems can rnams kyi yongs su gzung ba dang yo byad bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: the things that I have taught sentient beings to hold and use.🔽Maitreya, the meaning of error is in regard to those very things that are

original: byams pa de la phyin ci log gi don ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don de dag nyid la /
analyzed: byams pa de la phyin ci log gi don ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don de dag nyid la /
translated: held and so forth.🔽It is the error of the perception of permanence in what is impermanent,

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / @72b lta ba phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba dang / mi gtsang pa la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes phyin ci log dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / @72b lta ba phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba dang / mi gtsang pa la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes phyin ci log dang /
translated: the error of mind, the error of view, the error of the perception of happiness in what is suffering, the error of the perception of purity in what is impure, and the error of the perception of a self in what is selfless.

original: sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the error of mind and the error of view.

original: byams pa de la phyin ci ma log pa'i don ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la phyin ci ma log pa'i don ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of non-error is the opposite of that.

original: de'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that it is the antidote to that.

original: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of affliction is threefold:

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the affliction of the afflictions of the three realms, the affliction of karma, and the affliction of birth.

original: byams pa de la rnam par byang ba'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: byams pa de la rnam par byang ba'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of purification is the factors of enlightenment that are for the sake of being free from those very three afflictions.

original: byams pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, one should know that all meanings are included in these ten aspects.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lngas don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lngas don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, bodhisattvas have five aspects of discernment of meaning.

original: don rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five aspects of meaning?

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa'o //
translated: and the full understanding of that.

original: byams pa de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni shes bya thams cad yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni shes bya thams cad yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Maitreya, the thing to be fully understood should be regarded as all objects of knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:🔽the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the inner sense bases,

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the outer sense bases,

original: de lta bu la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa dag go //
translated: and so forth.

original: byams pa de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa ji snyed kyis shes bya de ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa ji snyed kyis shes bya de ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning to be fully understood is the meaning of the objects of knowledge, which should be understood as they are through however many aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / skyon dang / yon tan dang / rkyen dang / dus dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang ; 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nad la sogs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dang /🔽de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / bsdu ba dang / dbye ba dang / mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa dang / rnam par dbye @73a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / skyon dang / yon tan dang / rkyen dang / dus dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang ; 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nad la sogs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / bsdu ba dang / dbye ba dang / mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa dang / rnam par dbye @73a * //
translated: the conventional and the ultimate, faults and good qualities, conditions, time, the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating, illness and so on, suffering, origination and so on,🔽suchness, the perfect end, the reality-limit, inclusion, classification, answering categorically, analyzing, answering through a counter-question, setting aside, keeping silent, and proclaiming.

original: ba dang / dris te lan gdab ba dang / gzhag pa dang / gsang ba dang / bsgrags pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i don yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang / dris te lan gdab ba dang / gzhag pa dang / gsang ba dang / bsgrags pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i don yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that this is the meaning of complete knowledge.

original: byams pa de la yongs su shes pa de ni /
analyzed: byams pa de la yongs su shes pa de ni /
translated: Maitreya, complete knowledge is

original: de gnyi ga 'dzin par byed pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga 'dzin par byed pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa dag ste /
translated: the factors of enlightenment that grasp both of those.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang / de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams dang / de la sogs pa'o //
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, and so on.

original: byams pa de la yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽'dod chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spong ba dang / dge sbyong nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / ngas nyan thos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa de la yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa ni 'di lta ste / 'dod chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spong ba dang / dge sbyong nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / ngas nyan thos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: Maitreya, the attainment of the fruit of thorough knowledge is as follows:🔽the taming of desire, hatred, and ignorance, the complete abandonment of desire, hatred, and ignorance, the fruits of the ascetic life, and the qualities of the śrāvakas and tathāgatas that I have taught, whether mundane or supramundane, whether shared or not shared.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa gang dag bstan pa de dag mngon du bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa gang dag bstan pa de dag mngon du bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of those.

original: byams pa de la rab tu rig par byed pa ni mngon sum du bya ba'i chos de dag nyid la rnam par grol bar shes pa dang / gzhan dag la yang rgya cher ston pa dang / yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la rab tu rig par byed pa ni mngon sum du bya ba'i chos de dag nyid la rnam par grol bar shes pa dang / gzhan dag la yang rgya cher ston pa dang / yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Maitreya, the one who is fully aware of the object is the one who knows liberation with regard to those very phenomena that are to be realized, who teaches them extensively to others, and who reveals them.

original: byams pa don lnga po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa don lnga po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all objects are included in these five objects.

original: byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bzhis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bzhis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, the bodhisattvas’ discernment of objects is fourfold.

original: don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four objects?

original: sems kyi len pa'i don dang / myong ba'i don dang / rnam par rig pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don gyis te /
analyzed: sems kyi len pa'i don dang / myong ba'i don dang / rnam par rig pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i don gyis te /
translated: The object of the mind’s appropriation, the object of experience, the object of representation, and the object of affliction and purification.

original: byams pa don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all objects are included in these four objects.

original: byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, a bodhisattva’s discernment of meaning is threefold.

original: don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of meaning?

original: tshig 'bru'i don dang / don gyi don dang / khams kyi don gyis so //
analyzed: tshig 'bru'i don dang / don gyi don dang / khams kyi don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of words, the meaning of the object, and the meaning of the constituent element.

original: byams pa de la tshig 'bru'i don ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa de la tshig 'bru'i don ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of words should be regarded as the collection of names and so on.

original: byams pa de la don gyi don ni rnam pa @73b bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la don gyi don ni rnam pa @73b bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of the object should be understood as tenfold:

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of reality, the characteristic of thorough knowledge, the characteristic of abandonment, the characteristic of realization, the characteristic of cultivation, the characteristic of the object of engagement, the characteristic of the object of disengagement, the characteristic of the object of both, the characteristic of the object of neither, and the characteristic of the object of the ultimate.

original: gnas dang gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang /
translated: the characteristics of the relationship between the basis and what is based upon it, the characteristics of the factors that obstruct complete understanding, etc., the characteristics of the factors that are conducive to complete understanding, etc., the disadvantages of not understanding, etc.,

original: phan yon gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phan yon gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the benefits of complete understanding, etc.

original: byams pa de la khams kyi don ni khams lnga ste /
analyzed: byams pa de la khams kyi don ni khams lnga ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of realm is the five realms:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams te /
translated: the realm of the world, the realm of sentient beings, the realm of phenomena, the realm of those to be trained, and the realm of the means of training.

original: byams pa don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all topics are included in these three topics.

original: bcom ldan 'das thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa de dag la tha dad du bgyi ba ci mchis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa de dag la tha dad du bgyi ba ci mchis lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is the difference between the thorough understanding of the meaning that comes from the wisdom arisen from listening, the thorough understanding of the meaning that comes from the wisdom arisen from reflection, and the thorough understanding of the meaning that comes from the wisdom arisen from cultivation, the cultivation of śamatha and vipaśyanā?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpas thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa med pa /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpas thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa med pa /
translated: “Maitreya, through the wisdom arisen from listening, bodhisattvas thoroughly understand the meaning that is based on the words, that is literal, and that is not intended.

original: mngon du ma gyur pa /
analyzed: mngon du ma gyur pa /
translated: It is not manifest,

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: and it is a thorough understanding of the meaning that is conducive to liberation but does not bring about liberation.

original: byams pa bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa kho na yin la /🔽sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa /
analyzed: byams pa bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa kho na yin la / sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa /
translated: The wisdom that arises from the meditation on love is only based on the words of the sutras.🔽It is not literal.

original: dgongs pa can mngon du ma gyur pa /
analyzed: dgongs pa can mngon du ma gyur pa /
translated: It is indirect, not explicit.

original: rnam par thar pa dang chos rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang chos rjes su mthun pa /
translated: It is in accord with liberation.

original: rnam par thar bar byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar bar byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: It is the analytical knowledge of the meaning that is not the liberator.🔽Maitreya, the wisdom that arises from the meditation of the bodhisattva is based on the words of the sutras and not based on the words of the sutras.🔽It is literal and indirect.

original: @74a * // byams pa byang chub sems dpas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa dang / tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa can dang / shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyis mngon du gyur pa rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: @74a * // byams pa byang chub sems dpas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa dang / tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa can dang / shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyis mngon du gyur pa rnam par thar pa dang /
translated: It is explicit through the image that is the domain of concentration that is in accord with the thing that is to be known.

original: chos shin tu rjes su mthun pa dang / rnam par thar par byed pa'i don kyang so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: chos shin tu rjes su mthun pa dang / rnam par thar par byed pa'i don kyang so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: He also causes the understanding of the meaning of the extremely harmonious Dharma and the meaning of liberation.

original: byams pa de dag gi tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byams pa de dag gi tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: Maitreya, this is the difference between them, as the Blessed One has said.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa ni gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is the knowledge of bodhisattvas who cultivate serenity and insight, and what is their vision, in terms of the correct understanding of phenomena and the correct understanding of meaning?

original: mthong ba ni gang lags /
analyzed: mthong ba ni gang lags /
translated: What is knowledge? What is vision?

original: byams pa nga ni shes pa dang mthong ba rnam grangs du mas ston par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: byams pa nga ni shes pa dang mthong ba rnam grangs du mas ston par byed mod kyi /
translated: Maitreya, I teach knowledge and vision in many ways.

original: 'on kyang mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o //
translated: However, I will explain them concisely.

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin no //
translated: The wisdom of serenity and insight that takes mixed phenomena as its object is knowledge.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: The wisdom of śamatha and vipaśyanā that focuses on unmixed phenomena is seeing.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel par bgyid lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pas yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel par bgyid lags /
translated: Blessed One, by what mental activity do bodhisattvas who cultivate śamatha and vipaśyanā eliminate what signs in what way?”

original: byams pa de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas chos kyi mtshan ma dang / don gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed de /🔽ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: byams pa de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas chos kyi mtshan ma dang / don gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed de / ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs shing /
translated: “Maitreya, by keeping suchness in mind, they eliminate the signs of phenomena and the signs of meanings.🔽They eliminate by not observing the intrinsic identity of names and

original: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to //
translated: by not seeing the signs of their bases.

original: ming la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang / yi ge dang / don thams cad la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang / yi ge dang / don thams cad la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with names, you should understand that this also applies to phrases, letters, and all meanings.🔽“Maitreya, with regard to the elements, they eliminate by not observing the intrinsic identity of the elements

original: byams pa khams kyi bar la khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: byams pa khams kyi bar la khams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang mi dmigs shing /
translated: and

original: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang yan dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to //🔽bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma yang yan dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel to // bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: And since he does not see the signs of the location of that, he eliminates them.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang lags pa de yang rnam par sel @74b bar bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang lags pa de yang rnam par sel @74b bar bgyid lags sam /
translated: Blessed One, is it also the case that the signs of the thorough understanding of the meaning of suchness are eliminated?

original: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa la ni mtshan ma med de /🔽mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa la ni mtshan ma med de / mi dmigs na /
translated: Maitreya, there are no signs in the thorough understanding of the meaning of suchness.🔽If they are not apprehended,

original: de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te /
translated: what is there to eliminate?

original: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni /
analyzed: byams pa de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni /
translated: Maitreya, the thorough understanding of the meaning of suchness

original: chos dang / don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis non gyi /
analyzed: chos dang / don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis non gyi /
translated: overcomes all the signs of phenomena and their meanings.

original: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o //
translated: But I do not say that it can be overcome by anything.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis chab rnyog ma can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang / me long yongs su ma dag pa'i dpe dang / mtshe'u 'khrugs pa'i dpes ji ltar rang gi bzhin gyi mtshan ma brtag par mi nus la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis chab rnyog ma can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang / me long yongs su ma dag pa'i dpe dang / mtshe'u 'khrugs pa'i dpes ji ltar rang gi bzhin gyi mtshan ma brtag par mi nus la /
translated: Blessed One, the Blessed One has said that just as one cannot see one’s own face in a dirty bowl, or in a dirty mirror, or in a disturbed pond,

original: de las bzlog pas ni nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: but one can see it in their opposites,

original: ma bsgoms pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par mi nus kyi /
translated: so too, one cannot know reality as it is with an untrained mind,🔽but one can know it with a trained mind.

original: bsgoms pas ni nus so zhes gang bka' stsal ba de la sems kyi so sor brtags pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bsgoms pas ni nus so zhes gang bka' stsal ba de la sems kyi so sor brtags pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is the discernment of the mind?

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang la dgongs te bka' stsal ba lags /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gang la dgongs te bka' stsal ba lags /
translated: With what intention did you say this?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byams pa sems kyis so sor brtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: byams pa sems kyis so sor brtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: “Maitreya, it is because of three kinds of discernment of the mind.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung pa'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa'o //🔽rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid las dgongs te /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung pa'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa'o // rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid las dgongs te /
translated: The investigation by the mind born of hearing, the investigation by the mind born of reflection, and the investigation by the mind born of meditation.

original: yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching is intended for the suchness of representation.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par sel ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma du zhig ni rnam par bsal bka' ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par sel ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma du zhig ni rnam par bsal bka' ba lags /
translated: Blessed One, when a bodhisattva has thus attained the analytical knowledge of the teaching and its meaning, and has entered the elimination of signs, how many signs are eliminated?

original: gang gis ni de dag rnam par sel lags /
analyzed: gang gis ni de dag rnam par sel lags /
translated: By what means are they eliminated?

original: byams pa bcu ste /
analyzed: byams pa bcu ste /
translated: Maitreya, there are ten.

original: de dag ni stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: de dag ni stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: They are eliminated by emptiness.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: chos kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
analyzed: chos kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
translated: When one is engaged in the analytical knowledge of the teaching and its meaning,

original: tshig dang yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: The various signs of words and letters are eliminated by the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so sor yang dag par rig par byed pa na /🔽skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug @75a * //
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so sor yang dag par rig par byed pa na / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug @75a * //
translated: When one causes the meaning of the suchness of the basis to be understood,

original: pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par sel la /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par sel la /
translated: the signs of the continuity of arising, destruction, abiding, and transformation are eliminated by the emptiness of characteristics.

original: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par sel to //
analyzed: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par sel to //
translated: And that is also eliminated by the emptiness of no beginning and no end.

original: 'dzin pa'i don so sor yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don so sor yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: When one causes the meaning of the object of grasping to be understood, the signs of the view of the transitory collection and the signs of the thought “I am” are eliminated by the emptiness of the internal and the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: The sign of the enjoyment of the object of retention, which is the object of the analytical knowledge of the object, is eliminated by the emptiness of the external.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du skyes pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang / yo byad dang ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du skyes pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang / yo byad dang ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
translated: When the analytical knowledge of language arises in connection with the service of men and women who are endowed with the requisites for enjoyment,

original: nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the sign of internal pleasure and the sign of external beauty

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: are eliminated by the emptiness of the internal and external and by the emptiness of emptiness.

original: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
analyzed: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
translated: When the analytical knowledge of eloquence arises in connection with the object of retention, which is the object of the analytical knowledge of retention,

original: tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: the sign of the immeasurables is eliminated by the emptiness of the great.🔽When the analytical knowledge of the object arises in connection with the object of retention, which is the object of the analytical knowledge of the object,

original: gzugs med pa la brten te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la brten te /
translated: the sign of the formless is eliminated by the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: gang gi zhi ba la rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: gang gi zhi ba la rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: The sign of the liberation of the pacification of that is eliminated by the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
translated: When one causes the correct understanding of the meaning of the suchness of characteristics,🔽the sign of the non-existence of the person, the sign of the selflessness of phenomena, the sign of mere representation, and the sign of the ultimate,

original: gang zag ba dag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gang zag ba dag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: are eliminated by the emptiness of what transcends limits, the emptiness of non-existent things,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existent things, and the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa na /
translated: When one causes the correct understanding of the meaning of the suchness of purification,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: The sign of the unconditioned and the sign of the unchanging are eliminated by the emptiness of the unconditioned and the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de dag yid la byed pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de dag yid la byed pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The sign of emptiness that is the attention to those emptinesses, which are the antidotes to those signs,

original: stong pa @75b nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: stong pa @75b nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: is eliminated by the emptiness of emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na /🔽mtshan ma gang rnam par sel bar bgyid cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na / mtshan ma gang rnam par sel bar bgyid cing /
translated: Blessed One, when eliminating the ten types of signs,🔽what signs are eliminated?

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba gang las rnam par grol bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba gang las rnam par grol bar 'gyur lags /
translated: And from what bondage of signs will one be liberated?

original: byams pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing /
analyzed: byams pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing /
translated: Maitreya, one eliminates the signs that are the images that are the objects of concentration.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: And one is liberated from the signs that are the bondage of affliction.

original: de yang rnam par sel to //
analyzed: de yang rnam par sel to //
translated: And that is also eliminated.

original: byams pa stong pa nyid de dag ni dngos su na mtshan ma de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa stong pa nyid de dag ni dngos su na mtshan ma de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that these emptinesses are, in fact, the antidotes to those signs.

original: re re yang mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen por mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re re yang mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen por mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that each one is not an antidote to all signs.

original: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Maitreya, it is like this:

original: ma rig pa ni rga shi'i bar gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub par mi byed pa ma yin mod kyi //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rga shi'i bar gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub par mi byed pa ma yin mod kyi //
translated: Ignorance is not not a producer of the afflictions up to and including old age and death.

original: nye ba dang / shin tu nye ba'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos su na 'du byed 'grub par byed pa yin par bstan pa bzhin du 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba dang / shin tu nye ba'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos su na 'du byed 'grub par byed pa yin par bstan pa bzhin du 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: However, because it is a proximate and very proximate condition, it is taught that it is a direct producer of formations. The same principle should be seen here.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang rtogs na stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma mchis pas rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa gang lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang rtogs na stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma mchis pas rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa gang lags //
translated: Blessed One, what is the summary of the characteristics of emptiness that bodhisattvas realize in the Great Vehicle, so that they do not fall into the extreme of nihilism due to the conceit of thinking they have realized the characteristics of emptiness?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la legs so legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la legs so legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Lord said to the Bodhisattva Maitreya, “Excellent, excellent, Maitreya!

original: byams pa khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams stong pa nyid las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri ba legs so legs so //
analyzed: byams pa khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams stong pa nyid las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri ba legs so legs so //
translated: It is excellent that you have asked the Tathāgata about this matter in order to prevent the bodhisattvas from falling away from emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid las rab tu nyams pa ni theg pa chen po mtha' dag las kyang rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid las rab tu nyams pa ni theg pa chen po mtha' dag las kyang rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Maitreya, a bodhisattva who falls away from emptiness also falls away from the whole Great Vehicle.

original: byams pa de'i phyir nyon cig dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa de'i phyir nyon cig dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Maitreya, listen to the summary of the characteristics of emptiness that I will teach you.

original: byams pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid @76a * //
analyzed: byams pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid @76a * //
translated: Maitreya, the characteristic of the dependent is the characteristic of the perfected, which is completely free from the imagined characteristic of defilement and purification in all its aspects.

original: dang ; de de la mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang ; de de la mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And the non-apprehension of that is called the summary of the characteristic of emptiness in the Great Vehicle.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis ting nge 'dzin du zhig bsdus lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis ting nge 'dzin du zhig bsdus lags /
translated: Blessed One, by what is śamatha and vipaśyanā included in samādhi?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: byams pa ngas nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam pa du ma bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa ngas nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam pa du ma bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all the many kinds of samādhis of the śrāvakas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas that I have taught are included in these.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rgyu gang las byung ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rgyu gang las byung ba lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is the cause of serenity and insight?

original: byams pa tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byams pa tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Maitreya, they arise from the cause of pure morality and from the cause of the pure view that arises from learning and reflection.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'bras bu gang lags par brjod par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'bras bu gang lags par brjod par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, what should be said about their result?

original: byams pa sems rnam par dag pa ni 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: byams pa sems rnam par dag pa ni 'bras bu yin /
translated: Maitreya, a pure mind is their result.

original: shes rab rnam par dag pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par dag pa ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Pure wisdom is their result.

original: byams pa yang nyan thos rnams kyi'am /
analyzed: byams pa yang nyan thos rnams kyi'am /
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all the wholesome mundane and supramundane qualities of the śrāvakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'am /
translated: the bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dge ba'i chos 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the tathāgatas are the result of serenity and insight.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi las ci lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi las ci lags //
translated: Blessed One, what is the function of serenity and insight?

original: byams pa 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las rnam par thar bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las rnam par thar bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Maitreya, it is the liberation from two kinds of bondage: the bondage of signs and the bondage of negative tendencies.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gags rnam pa lnga gsungs pa gang dag lags pa de dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis gags rnam pa lnga gsungs pa gang dag lags pa de dag las /
translated: Blessed One, among the five hindrances that the Blessed One has taught,

original: du ni zhi gnas kyi gags dag lags /
analyzed: du ni zhi gnas kyi gags dag lags /
translated: how many are hindrances to serenity?

original: du ni lhag mthong gi gags dag lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag mthong gi gags dag lags /
translated: How many are hindrances to insight?

original: du ni gnyi ga'i gags dag lags /
analyzed: du ni gnyi ga'i gags dag lags /
translated: How many are hindrances to both?

original: byams pa lus dang longs spyod la lta ba ni zhi gnas kyi gags yin no //
analyzed: byams pa lus dang longs spyod la lta ba ni zhi gnas kyi gags yin no //
translated: Maitreya, the view of the body and possessions as real is a hindrance to serenity.

original: 'phags pa'i gtam 'dod pa bzhin ma thob pa ni lhag mthong gi gags yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gtam 'dod pa bzhin ma thob pa ni lhag mthong gi gags yin no //
translated: Not obtaining the teachings of the noble ones as one wishes is a hindrance to insight.

original: 'dres par gnas pa dang / cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni de gnyi ga'i gags yin te /🔽de la yang gcig gis ni sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dres par gnas pa dang / cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni de gnyi ga'i gags yin te / de la yang gcig gis ni sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: Dwelling in a crowd and being satisfied with just a little are hindrances to both.🔽In this regard, one does not apply oneself because of the first.

original: @76b cig shos kyis ni sbyor ba mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @76b cig shos kyis ni sbyor ba mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the second, one does not reach the culmination of application.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa lnga po gang dag lags pa de dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa lnga po gang dag lags pa de dag las /
translated: Blessed One, from among the five hindrances,

original: du ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa dag lags /🔽du ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa dag lags /
analyzed: du ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa dag lags / du ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa dag lags /
translated: how many are hindrances to serenity?🔽How many are hindrances to insight?

original: du ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa dag lags /
analyzed: du ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa dag lags /
translated: How many are hindrances to both?

original: byams pa rgod pa dang ; 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa rgod pa dang ; 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Maitreya, agitation and worry are hindrances to serenity.

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / the chom ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / the chom ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Drowsiness, lethargy, and doubt are hindrances to insight.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems ni de gnyi ga'i sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems ni de gnyi ga'i sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Desire for sensual pleasures and malice are hindrances to both.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su dag pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, to what extent is the path of serenity purified?

original: byams pa gang gi tshe rmugs pa dang / gnyid legs par rab tu choms par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa gang gi tshe rmugs pa dang / gnyid legs par rab tu choms par gyur ba'o //
translated: Maitreya, when lethargy and sleep are well subdued.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na lhag mthong gi lam yangs su dag pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na lhag mthong gi lam yangs su dag pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, to what extent is the path of insight purified?

original: byams pa gang gi tshe rgod pa dang 'gyod pa legs par rab tu choms par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa gang gi tshe rgod pa dang 'gyod pa legs par rab tu choms par gyur pa'o //
translated: Maitreya, when agitation and worry are well subdued.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la zhugs pas rnam pa du dag gis sems rnam par g-yeng ba yongs su 'tshal bar bgyi lags /🔽bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la zhugs pas rnam pa du dag gis sems rnam par g-yeng ba yongs su 'tshal bar bgyi lags / bka' stsal ba /
translated: Blessed One, by how many aspects should a bodhisattva who has entered śamatha and vipaśyanā know the distractions of the mind?

original: byams pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: byams pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Maitreya, there are five aspects:

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: the distraction of mental activity, the distraction of external mind, the distraction of internal mind, the distraction of signs, and the distraction of negative tendencies.

original: byams pa gal te byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa btang ste /
analyzed: byams pa gal te byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa btang ste /
translated: Maitreya, if a bodhisattva abandons mental activity associated with the Great Vehicle

original: nyan thos dang ; rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed par rab tu lhung na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang ; rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed par rab tu lhung na /
translated: and falls into mental activity associated with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
translated: that is the distraction of mental activity.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag dang / 'du 'dzi dang / mchan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnams la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na de'i phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag dang / 'du 'dzi dang / mchan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnams la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na de'i phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
translated: If the mind is distracted to the five external sense pleasures, to busyness, to signs, to thoughts, to afflictions, to secondary afflictions, or to external objects, then it is external mental distraction.

original: gal te rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis bying ba'am /🔽snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'am /🔽snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye @77a * //
analyzed: gal te rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis bying ba'am / snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'am / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye @77a * //
translated: If the mind is afflicted by any of the secondary afflictions of lethargy, sleep,🔽the taste of meditative concentration,

original: ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur na /
analyzed: ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur na /
translated: or the secondary afflictions of meditative concentration,

original: de ni nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
translated: then it is internal mental distraction.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed na /
translated: If one attends to the signs of the object of meditation of internal meditative concentration in dependence on external signs,

original: de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
translated: then it is the distraction of signs.

original: gal te nang gi yid la byed pa la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba la gnas ngan len gyi tshogs kyis nga'o snyam du rlom sems su byed na /
analyzed: gal te nang gi yid la byed pa la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba la gnas ngan len gyi tshogs kyis nga'o snyam du rlom sems su byed na /
translated: If he imagines that the feeling which arises in dependence on internal mental activity is the self, because it is the collection of the propensities for the bad realms,

original: de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin no // bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: then that is the distraction of the propensities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar la gang gi gnyen po lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar la gang gi gnyen po lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is the antidote to serenity and insight?

original: byams pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa dang po la ni ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: byams pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa dang po la ni ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Maitreya, the antidote to the defilement of bad realms, karma, and birth on the first stage, and so on up to the stage of the Tathagata.

original: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu 'byung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu 'byung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: On the second stage, it is the antidote to the occurrence of the error of the minor transgressions.

original: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi'o //
translated: On the third stage, it is the antidote to the passion of desire.

original: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang chos la sred pa'i'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang chos la sred pa'i'o //
translated: On the fourth stage, it is the antidote to the craving for meditative concentration and to the craving for the Doctrine.

original: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: On the fifth, it is the non-one-sidedness and one-sidedness with regard to cyclic life and nirvana.

original: drug pa la ni mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: drug pa la ni mtshan ma mang po kun tu 'byung ba'i'o //
translated: On the sixth, it is the arising of many signs.

original: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba'i'o //
translated: On the seventh, it is the arising of subtle signs.

original: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang / mtshan ma la dbang du ma gyur ba'i'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang / mtshan ma la dbang du ma gyur ba'i'o //
translated: On the eighth, it is the effort for signlessness and the non-mastery over signs.

original: dgu pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang du ma gyur ba'i'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang du ma gyur ba'i'o //
translated: On the ninth, it is the non-mastery over teaching the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: bcu pa la ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni mi 'thob pa'i'o //🔽byams pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra ba /
analyzed: bcu pa la ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni mi 'thob pa'i'o // byams pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra ba /
translated: On the tenth, it is the non-attainment of the analytical knowledges that perfect the Dharma Body.🔽Maitreya, that serenity and insight are the antidotes to the extremely subtle and extremely refined obstructions to the Tathāgata stage,

original: mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: the obstructions to omniscience and the afflictive obstructions.

original: de legs par bcom pas chos kyi sku shin tu rnam par dag pa la gnas pa na /
analyzed: de legs par bcom pas chos kyi sku shin tu rnam par dag pa la gnas pa na /
translated: When, by thoroughly destroying that, he abides in the extremely pure Dharma Body,

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa la /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa la /
translated: he attains the object of the accomplishment of his purpose,

original: thams cad du chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba thob po //
analyzed: thams cad du chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba thob po //
translated: the knowledge and vision that is everywhere unobstructed and unimpeded.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang @77b chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la ji ltar bsgrub na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang @77b chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la ji ltar bsgrub na /
translated: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva practice śamatha and vipaśyanā

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: so as to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: byams pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob nas /
analyzed: byams pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob nas /
translated: Maitreya, when a bodhisattva has attained śamatha and vipaśyanā,

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te ji ltar thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis legs par gzung ba dang / legs par bsams pa dang / legs par rnam par gzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid de nyid nang du yid la byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te ji ltar thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos rnams la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis legs par gzung ba dang / legs par bsams pa dang / legs par rnam par gzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid de nyid nang du yid la byed de /
