translated: The seven aspects of thatness are as follows: The bodhisattva focuses his mind on the thatness of the Dharma he has studied and contemplated, on the thatness of what he has well retained, well reflected on and well ascertained.

original: de ltar na de de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na de de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa na /
translated: In this way, when he is keeping thatness in mind,

original: mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba thams cad la yang re zhig sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog na /
analyzed: mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba thams cad la yang re zhig sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog na /
translated: he is able to rest in a special state of equanimity with regard to all the subtle signs that occur and

original: rags pa dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rags pa dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to mention his ability to do so with regard to the gross ones?

original: byams pa de la mtshan ma phra mo ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: byams pa de la mtshan ma phra mo ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: Maitreya, the subtle signs are as follows:

original: sems kyi len pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sems kyi len pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the mind’s grasping,

original: myong ba'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of experience,

original: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of consciousness,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma'am /🔽nang gi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma'am / nang gi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of defilement and purity,🔽the signs of the inner,

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the outer,

original: de gnyi ga'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of both of those,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the thought, “I will apply myself to the welfare of all sentient beings,”

original: shes pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of knowledge,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of suchness, suffering, origin, cessation, and the path,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma'am /🔽rtag pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma'am / rtag pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the unconditioned,🔽the signs of permanence,

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the nature of suffering and change,

original: de mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: de mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the nature of its non-change,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the different characteristics of the conditioned,

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of its own characteristics,

original: thams cad thams cad ces bya bar rig nas thams cad kyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad ces bya bar rig nas thams cad kyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of everything being everything,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: the signs of the selflessness of persons,

original: chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan ma gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The signs of the selflessness of phenomena are

original: de dag kun tu 'byung ba la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog go //
analyzed: de dag kun tu 'byung ba la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog go //
translated: the mental state of equanimity.

original: de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du @78a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du @78a * //
translated: Thus, one who has entered and frequently abides in this

original: gnas pa dus dus su gags dang / sgrib pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dag las sems rnam par spyod par byed pa de la /
analyzed: gnas pa dus dus su gags dang / sgrib pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dag las sems rnam par spyod par byed pa de la /
translated: from time to time, in order to purify the mind of obstacles and distractions,

original: nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la so so rang gis rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la so so rang gis rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: will generate the seven kinds of understanding that realize the seven aspects of thusness, which is the inner, individual self-cognizance.

original: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This is the path of seeing of the bodhisattva.

original: de thob pas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: de thob pas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin /
translated: By attaining it, the bodhisattva enters into the faultless state of reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
translated: He is born into the family of the tathagatas.

original: sa dang po thob pa dang / sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa dang / sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: He attains the first stage and experiences the benefits of that stage.

original: des sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa yin no //
translated: Since one has previously attained serenity and insight, one has attained the two kinds of objects of meditation: the analytical image and the nonanalytical image.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by attaining the path of seeing, one attains the object of meditation that is the limit of the possibilities.

original: des sa gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: des sa gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na /
translated: When one who has attained the path of seeing enters the path of meditation on the higher and higher stages and attends to those three kinds of objects of meditation,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: dper na la la zhig khye'u ches phra mos khye'u ches sbom po 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig khye'u ches phra mos khye'u ches sbom po 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as a very small child can remove a very large child from its mother’s lap,

original: de yang khye'u khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: de yang khye'u khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: in the same way, by eliminating the inner signs, one eliminates all the signs that are associated with the side of affliction.

original: mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba na gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba na gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: When the signs are eliminated, the negative tendencies are also eliminated.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs bar bcom pas rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong la /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs bar bcom pas rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong la /
translated: Having well destroyed all signs and negative tendencies, the mind is purified like gold in the higher and higher stages.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
translated: Up to the complete and perfect enlightenment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang 'thob ste /
translated: and the object of the accomplishment of the purpose is also attained.

original: byams pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la de ltar bsgrub na /
analyzed: byams pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la de ltar bsgrub na /
translated: Maitreya, in this way, when the bodhisattva practices śamatha and vipaśyanā in this way,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva practice

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po mngon par @78b bsgrub pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po mngon par @78b bsgrub pa lags /
translated: to accomplish the great power of the bodhisattva?

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gnas drug la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gnas drug la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, a bodhisattva who is skilled in six topics accomplishes the great powers of a bodhisattva.

original: sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas ba la mkhas pa dang / bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang ; 'grib ba la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas ba la mkhas pa dang / bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang ; 'grib ba la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are skill in the arising of mind, skill in the abiding of mind, skill in the removal of mind, skill in the increase of mind, skill in the decrease of mind, and skill in means.

original: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in the arising of mind?

original: sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug shes na /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug shes na /
translated: If one knows the sixteen aspects of the arising of mind,

original: sems kyi skye ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa yin te /
translated: one is skilled in the arising of mind just as it is.

original: de la sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug ni ;
analyzed: de la sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug ni ;
translated: The sixteen aspects of the arising of mind are as follows:

original: brtan pa dang / snod kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtan pa dang / snod kyi rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of the stable and the vessel is as follows:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'i'o //
translated: It is the appropriating consciousness.

original: dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of various objects is as follows:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa yul cig car 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa yul cig car 'dzin pa /
translated: The conceptual mental consciousness apprehends simultaneously such objects as form.

original: phyi rol dang / nang gi yul cig car 'dzin pa dang / skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam cig la /
analyzed: phyi rol dang / nang gi yul cig car 'dzin pa dang / skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam cig la /
translated: It apprehends simultaneously external and internal objects, and in one moment, one instant, one second,

original: cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms pa 'jug pa /
analyzed: cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms pa 'jug pa /
translated: it simultaneously enters many meditative absorptions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba /
translated: It sees many buddhafields.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba /
translated: It sees many tathagatas.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'i'o //🔽dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung ngu rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'i'o // dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung ngu rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the activity of the conceptual mental consciousness alone.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: The small objective mental signs are cognized by the mental consciousness of the desire realm.🔽The medium objective mental signs are cognized by the mental consciousness of the form realm.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma rgya chen por gyur pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /🔽gzugs dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma rgya chen por gyur pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste / gzugs dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: The great objective mental signs are cognized by the mental consciousness of the formless realm.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The immeasurable objective mental signs are cognized by the mental consciousness of the aryas.

original: nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan phra mo rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan phra mo rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of subtle signs as objects is as follows:

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: the sphere of nothingness.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of the ultimate of signs as objects is as follows:

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of signlessness is as follows:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i'o //
translated: the supramundane and the perception of cessation.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of suffering is as follows:

original: sems can dmyal @79a * //
analyzed: sems can dmyal @79a * //
translated: the hells.

original: pa'i'o // tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pa'i'o // tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of mixed feelings is as follows:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i'o //
translated: the desire realm.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of joy is as follows:

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i'o //
translated: the first and second absorptions.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception of pleasure is as follows:

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i'o //
translated: the third absorption.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it suffering.🔽

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth is associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi'o //
translated: The fifth is associated with the fourth meditation and the stage of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /🔽nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: The sixth is associated with the defiled.

original: dge ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /🔽dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //🔽lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste / dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o // lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seventh is associated with the wholesome.🔽The eighth is associated with the indeterminate.

original: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i'o //
translated: The ninth is associated with neither.

original: ji ltar na gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in abiding?

original: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: If one knows the suchness of consciousness exactly as it is.

original: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in emerging?

original: gal te 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gal te 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: If he knows well the two kinds of bondage, the bondage of signs and the bondage of bad states,

original: de rab tu shes nas de las sems 'di bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de rab tu shes nas de las sems 'di bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: and if he knows well how to raise his mind from them, then he is skilled in raising the mind.

original: ji ltar na 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he skilled in increase?

original: gal te mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de skye ba dang 'phel ba'i tshe skye'o //
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de skye ba dang 'phel ba'i tshe skye'o //
translated: If he knows that the mind which is the antidote to signs and bad states increases and grows when it arises,

original: 'phel lo zhes 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phel lo zhes 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: then he is skilled in increase.

original: ji ltar na 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he skilled in decrease?

original: gal te de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems de grib cing 'bri bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems de grib cing 'bri bar gyur pa na /
translated: If he knows that the defiled mind which is the opposite of that, the mind defiled by signs and bad states, decreases and diminishes when it arises,

original: 'grib cing 'bri'o zhes 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grib cing 'bri'o zhes 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: then he is skilled in decrease.

original: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they skilled in means?

original: gal te rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag sgom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag sgom par byed pa ste /
translated: They cultivate the liberations, the aspects of subjugation, and the aspects of totality.

original: byams pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / mngon par sgrub par 'gyur ba @79b dang ; mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / mngon par sgrub par 'gyur ba @79b dang ; mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Maitreya, in this way the bodhisattvas accomplish, will accomplish, and do accomplish the great powers of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag go zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag go zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: Blessed One, in the sutra you said, “In the realm of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates, all feelings without exception cease.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'gag pa'i tshor ba de dag gang lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'gag pa'i tshor ba de dag gang lags //
translated: Blessed One, what are those feelings that cease?

original: byams pa mdor bsdu na tshor ba rnam pa gnyis 'gags te /
analyzed: byams pa mdor bsdu na tshor ba rnam pa gnyis 'gags te /
translated: Maitreya, in brief, two kinds of feelings cease:

original: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu ni yul rig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu ni yul rig pa'o //
translated: the feelings that are the result of the negative habit of the basis and the feelings that are the result of the object.

original: de la gnas kyi gnas nang len rig pa ni rnam par bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas kyi gnas nang len rig pa ni rnam par bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The internal grasping of the abode should be known as fourfold:

original: gzugs kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang ; gzugs med pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang ; gzugs med pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa'o //
translated: the grasping of the impurity of form, the grasping of the impurity of the formless, the grasping of the impurity of the established result, and the grasping of the impurity of the non-established result.

original: de la 'bras bu grub pa ni da ltar gyi gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu grub pa ni da ltar gyi gang yin ba'o //
translated: Among these, the established result is that which is present.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: The non-established result is that which is the cause of the future.

original: / yul rig pa yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: / yul rig pa yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The object of knowledge should also be known as fourfold:

original: gnas rig pa dang / yo byad rig pa dang / longs spyod rig pa dang / ltos pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas rig pa dang / yo byad rig pa dang / longs spyod rig pa dang / ltos pa rig pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the abode, the knowledge of the requisites, the knowledge of enjoyment, and the knowledge of dependence.

original: de yang phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
analyzed: de yang phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
translated: Moreover, it is in the realm of nirvana with remainder.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong ba'i ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong ba'i ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gag pa ma yin te /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with a cognition that has not yet produced its result is not completely stopped,

original: 'dren mar myong ngo //
analyzed: 'dren mar myong ngo //
translated: but is experienced in a mixed way.

original: 'bras bu grub pa'i myong ba yin na ni tshor ba rnam pa de gnyi ga thams cad kyi thams cad 'gags te /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa'i myong ba yin na ni tshor ba rnam pa de gnyi ga thams cad kyi thams cad 'gags te /
translated: If it is the experience of a result, then both of those kinds of feeling are completely stopped,

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong ngo //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong ngo //
translated: and only the feeling that arises from contact with a cognition is experienced.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na de yang 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na de yang 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: When one passes into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left over, that also stops.

original: de'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad 'gag ces bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad 'gag ces bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: Therefore, it is said that all feeling stops in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left over.🔽The Blessed One having said that,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal ba //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal ba //
translated: he said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: byams pa khyod kyis rnal 'byor gyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa las brtsams nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byams pa khyod kyis rnal 'byor gyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa las brtsams nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Maitreya, you have begun with the complete and pure path of yoga,

original: rnal 'byor la shin tu rnam par nges shing mkhas pas de @80a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la shin tu rnam par nges shing mkhas pas de @80a * //
translated: and with your expertise and certainty in yoga,

original: bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dris pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dris pa legs so legs so //
translated: you have asked the Tathāgata about this. Good!

original: ngas kyang rnal 'byor gyi lam de yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag par bstan te /
analyzed: ngas kyang rnal 'byor gyi lam de yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag par bstan te /
translated: I have also taught the complete and pure path of yoga,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang de ltar bstan cing ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang de ltar bstan cing ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all the perfect buddhas of the past and future have also taught it and will teach it.

original: rigs kyi bu rnams dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag gis 'di la shin tu brtson par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnams dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag gis 'di la shin tu brtson par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Noble sons and daughters should practice it with diligence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: chos rnams gdags pa rnam gzhag gang yin pa //
analyzed: chos rnams gdags pa rnam gzhag gang yin pa //
translated: “The presentation of the designations of phenomena,

original: de ni rnal 'byor bag yod don chen yin //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor bag yod don chen yin //
translated: That is the great purpose of the conscientious yogi.

original: gang dag chos der brten nas rnal 'byor 'dir //
analyzed: gang dag chos der brten nas rnal 'byor 'dir //
translated: Those who, relying on this Dharma,

original: yang dag brtson pa de dag byang chub 'thob //
analyzed: yang dag brtson pa de dag byang chub 'thob //
translated: are truly diligent in this yoga will attain enlightenment.

original: gang dag glags lta de skad rgol ba las //
analyzed: gang dag glags lta de skad rgol ba las //
translated: Those who, looking for an opportunity, argue in this way,

original: thar par lta bas chos kun chub byed pa //
analyzed: thar par lta bas chos kun chub byed pa //
translated: will not attain the Dharma, which is seen as liberation.

original: byams pa de dag rnal 'byor 'di las ni //
analyzed: byams pa de dag rnal 'byor 'di las ni //
translated: Maitreya, those who are far from this yoga

original: thag ring gnam sa ring ba de bzhin no //🔽blo ldan sems can don ces de dag las //
analyzed: thag ring gnam sa ring ba de bzhin no // blo ldan sems can don ces de dag las //
translated: are as far from liberation as the sky is from the earth.🔽The wise do not strive for the benefit of sentient beings

original: lan byed rig nas sems can don brtson min //
analyzed: lan byed rig nas sems can don brtson min //
translated: in order to receive something in return.🔽If they were to expect something in return, they would not be the best of all,

original: lan der rtogs na kun gyi dam pa dang // zang zing med pa'i dga' ba 'thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lan der rtogs na kun gyi dam pa dang // zang zing med pa'i dga' ba 'thob mi 'gyur //
translated: and they would not attain the joy of being free from material things.

original: gang dag 'dod phyir chos kyi lung 'bogs pa //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod phyir chos kyi lung 'bogs pa //
translated: Those who give Dharma teachings in order to receive something

original: de dag 'dod pa spangs pa phyir len te //
analyzed: de dag 'dod pa spangs pa phyir len te //
translated: are giving up their desires only to take them up again.

original: rmongs pa de dag chos kyi rin po che //
analyzed: rmongs pa de dag chos kyi rin po che //
translated: Those fools, having found the priceless jewel of the Dharma,

original: rin thang med pa rnyed kyang spong zhing rgyu //
analyzed: rin thang med pa rnyed kyang spong zhing rgyu //
translated: give it up and go away.

original: de phyir brtsod dang 'du 'dzi spros ldan pa //
analyzed: de phyir brtsod dang 'du 'dzi spros ldan pa //
translated: Therefore, those who are in conflict, who are involved in worldly activities, who are full of conceptual thoughts,

original: rnam par spong la brtson 'grus mchog byos te /
analyzed: rnam par spong la brtson 'grus mchog byos te /
translated: Strive with supreme effort to abandon them.

original: lhar bcas 'jig rten bsgral par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: lhar bcas 'jig rten bsgral par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods,

original: / rnal 'byor 'di la rab tu brtson par gyis //
analyzed: / rnal 'byor 'di la rab tu brtson par gyis //
translated: strive in this yoga.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad cig gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad cig gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grang 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grang 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags //
translated: Lord, what is the name of this teaching of the definitive explanation of the intention that has been revealed?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should we remember it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to him:

original: byams pa 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, this is the teaching of the definitive meaning for yoga.🔽Remember it as 'The Teaching of the Definitive Meaning for Yoga.'

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig / rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa @80b yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar zung shig / rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa @80b yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When this teaching of the definitive meaning for yoga was explained, the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening arose in 600,000 beings.

original: nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go //
analyzed: nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go //
translated: Three hundred thousand śrāvakas became free of dust and uncontaminated with regard to phenomena.

original: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: One hundred fifty thousand śrāvakas became liberated from the contaminations without further appropriation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni rnal 'byor chen po yid la byed pa thob par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni rnal 'byor chen po yid la byed pa thob par gyur to zhes gsungs pa'o /
translated: Seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained the mental contemplation of great yoga.

original: // / bam po bzhi bcu pa /🔽theg pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi bcu pa / theg pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The Teaching of the Three Vehicles

original: theg pa'i rnam par dbye ba ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa'i rnam par dbye ba ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: The teaching of the three vehicles is to be understood in accordance with the teaching of the three vehicles in the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention.

original: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara asked the Bhagavat,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu gang lags pa de dag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu gang lags pa de dag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Bhagavat, the ten stages of the bodhisattvas are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' bzhes bgyi ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' bzhes bgyi ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba can dang / shin tu sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang /
translated: the Stainless, the Shining, the Brilliance, the Invincible, the Manifest, the Gone Afar,

original: mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin lags /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin lags /
translated: the Immovable, the Excellent Intelligence, and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni bcu gcig pa lags na ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni bcu gcig pa lags na ;
translated: The buddha level is the eleventh.

original: sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag dang / yan lag du dag gis bsdus pa lags //
analyzed: sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag dang / yan lag du dag gis bsdus pa lags //
translated: How many purities and how many branches do those levels comprise?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sa de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sa de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, you should know that those levels are comprised by four purities and eleven branches.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de las dang po ni bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus so //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de las dang po ni bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus so //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, the first is comprised by the purity of intention.

original: sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The second is comprised by the purity of superior morality.

original: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The third stage is that of the pure superior thought.

original: sa bzhi pa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ni lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa gong nas gong du gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom pas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ni lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa gong nas gong du gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom pas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: The fourth stage and the rest, up to the stage of the Buddha, are included in the ever more excellent purification of the superior wisdom.

original: sa de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi po de dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sa de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi po de dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These stages are included in these four purities.

original: yan lag bcu gcig gang zhe na /🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' chos @81a * //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig gang zhe na / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' chos @81a * //
translated: What are the eleven aspects?

original: spyad pa rnam pa bcu po dag la mos pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir bzod pas sa de las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: spyad pa rnam pa bcu po dag la mos pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir bzod pas sa de las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: Avalokitdvara, the bodhisattva who has practiced the Dharma on the stage of devoted interest, having transcended that stage by means of the acceptance that comes from the cultivation of devoted interest in the ten aspects of Dharma practice,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug go //
translated: enters into the bodhisattvas faultless reality.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: Although he has completed that aspect,

original: ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu 'byung ba dag la shes bzhin du spyod par mi nus pas /
analyzed: ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu 'byung ba dag la shes bzhin du spyod par mi nus pas /
translated: Since they are unable to practice with vigilance in regard to the occurrence of all subtle infractions,

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: they are incomplete in that factor.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: But by striving to complete that factor, they attain it.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: Even though they are complete in that factor,

original: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas /
translated: they are unable to attain the perfection of mundane meditative concentration and the perfection of the retention of what they have heard.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /🔽de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te / de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: So they are incomplete in that factor.

original: 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: But by striving to complete that factor, they attain it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: Even though they are complete in that factor,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa de dag gis de lan mang du gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sreg pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa de dag gis de lan mang du gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sreg pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog mi nus pas /
translated: and he is unable to set his mind in a state of equanimity that transcends craving for meditative absorption and craving for the entities that are the objects of meditative absorption.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te ;
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te ;
translated: He is incomplete in terms of that factor.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: He strives to complete that factor and he attains it.

original: de yang lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yang lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: He is complete in terms of that factor.

original: bden pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag pa dang / thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom par mi nus pas /
analyzed: bden pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag pa dang / thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom par mi nus pas /
translated: He is unable to analyze the truths, to set his mind in a state of equanimity that transcends the one-sided attitudes of both samsara and nirvana, to cultivate the factors that contribute to enlightenment in a manner that is conjoined with the means, and to attain the meditative absorption of the stream of dharma.🔽He is incomplete in terms of that factor.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: He is not complete in that member.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: He strives to complete that member and he obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: He is complete in that member.

original: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du byas nas de la spyo ba mang ba dang / mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas lan mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du byas nas de la spyo ba mang ba dang / mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas lan mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
translated: But he is not able to abide frequently in the signless mental attention, having actualized the engagement of the formative forces just as it is, and to be much occupied with the contempt of them.

original: de yang lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: He is not complete in that member.

original: @81b de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: @81b de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: He strives to complete that member and he obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: He is complete in that member.

original: bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan med pa'i yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan med pa'i yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
translated: But he is not able to abide frequently in the signless mental attention, without interruption and without a break.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: He is not complete in that member.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: He strives to perfect that member and he attains it.

original: de yan lag des yong su rdzogs pa yin yang mtshan ma med par gnas pa de la rtsol ba lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag pa dang / mtshan ma dbang thob par mi nus pas ;🔽de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yong su rdzogs pa yin yang mtshan ma med par gnas pa de la rtsol ba lhag par btang snyoms su gzhag pa dang / mtshan ma dbang thob par mi nus pas ; de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Even though he has perfected that member, he is not able to attain mastery in the signless dwelling, in the equanimity of exertion, and in the sign.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //🔽de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /🔽rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang thob par mu nus pas /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po // de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang / rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye ba rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa la dbang thob par mu nus pas /
translated: He strives to perfect that member and he attains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Even though he has perfected that member, he is not able to attain mastery in teaching the Dharma in all its modes, in the enumeration, the characteristics, the definitions, and the divisions.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: He strives to perfect that member and he attains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: Although he is complete in that member,

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa 'thob par mi nus pas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa 'thob par mi nus pas /
translated: he is not able to obtain the perfect knowledge of the Dharma Body.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is incomplete in that member.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob po //
translated: In order to complete that member, he strives and obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang /
translated: Although he is complete in that member,

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba 'thob par mi nus pas /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba 'thob par mi nus pas /
translated: he is not able to obtain the knowledge and vision of all objects of knowledge, which is free from attachment and obstruction.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is incomplete in that member.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de yang 'thob ste /
translated: In order to complete that member, he strives and obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: He is complete in that member.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin te //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin te //
translated: Because he is complete in that member, he is complete in all members.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs sa de dag na /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs sa de dag na /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, on those stages,

original: yan lag bcu gcig po de dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig po de dag gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the ten stages are included in these eleven.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du /🔽sa dang po la rab tu dga' ba @82a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du / sa dang po la rab tu dga' ba @82a * //
translated: Blessed One, why is it

original: zhes bgyi / ci'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: zhes bgyi / ci'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: that the first stage is called the Joyous? Why is it that the stage of the Buddha is called the Stage of the Buddha?

original: sa dang po ni don che ba 'dris pa ma yin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob pas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po ni don che ba 'dris pa ma yin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob pas dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba rgya che ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The first stage is called the Joyous because of the joy and delight of having attained the supramundane mind, which is of great value and not shared by those on the stages of the disciples and the hermit buddhas.

original: sa gnyis pa ni ltung ba phra mo dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni ltung ba phra mo dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The second stage is called the Stainless because it is free from the stain of the slightest moral fault and of all immorality.

original: sa gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin de dang thos pa'i gzungs de shes pa'i snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa gsum pa ni ting nge 'dzin de dang thos pa'i gzungs de shes pa'i snang ba tshad med pa'i gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The third stage is called the Radiant because it is the basis for the light of knowledge consisting of that concentration and that retention of what has been heard.

original: sa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa'i shing bsreg pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa'i shing bsreg pa'i phyir /
translated: The fourth level is called that of The Blazing because one's realization of the expanse of reality blazes forth, in the sense that one's realization of the expanse of reality is enhanced.🔽

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgoms pa de ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'phro bar gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgoms pa de ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'phro bar gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: The fourth level is called The Radiant because the fire of pristine awareness that burns away the trees of the afflictions spreads from the cultivation of the factors for awakening.

original: sa lnga pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos de dag nyid thabs kyis bsgom pa de la dbang bya bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu sbyang dka' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos de dag nyid thabs kyis bsgom pa de la dbang bya bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu sbyang dka' zhes bya'o //
translated: The fifth level is called Hard to Conquer because the cultivation of those very factors for awakening through skillful means is difficult to conquer.

original: sa drug pa ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la lan mang du yid la byed pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa drug pa ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la lan mang du yid la byed pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The sixth level is called The Manifest because the engagement of the formative factors becomes manifest and the frequent attention to the absence of attributes becomes manifest.

original: sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa la bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa ring du rjes su zhugs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sa dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa la bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa ring du rjes su zhugs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sa dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The seventh stage is called Gone Afar because the bodhisattva has entered far into the performance of the attention to the signless without interruption and without break, and because he is connected with the stage of pure superior morality.

original: sa brgyad pa ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The eighth stage is called Immovable because the bodhisattva is spontaneously without signs and is unshaken by the appearance of the addictions of signs.

original: sa dgu pa ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dgu pa ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: The ninth stage is called Good Intelligence because the bodhisattva has attained the unerring vast intelligence which rules over the teaching of the Dharma in all its modes.

original: sa bcu pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi sku sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi sku sprin chen po lta bus khyab cing khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: The tenth stage is called Dharma Cloud because the Dharma body, like a great cloud, covers and pervades the spacelike body of propensities.

original: sa bcu gcig pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas /
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas /
translated: The eleventh stage is called the stage of the Buddha because, by eliminating the extremely subtle afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience,

original: chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: one is unattached and unobstructed with regard to all aspects of objects of knowledge.

original: bcom ldan 'das @82b sa de dag kun tu rmongs pa ni du mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @82b sa de dag kun tu rmongs pa ni du mchis /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, how many confusions are there?

original: gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni du mchis lags /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni du mchis lags /
translated: How many are the adverse states of the negative reflex actions?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs kun tu rmongs pa nyid shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs kun tu rmongs pa nyid shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu gcig ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, there are twenty-two confusions and eleven adverse states of negative reflex actions.

original: sa dang po la ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sa dang po la ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the first stage, the confusion of attachment to the substantiality of the person and things, the confusion of the afflictions of the miserable realms, and their adverse states of negative reflex actions.

original: sa gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa /
translated: On the second, the obscurations to the subtle infractions, to the various aspects of karma,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and to the various aspects of the antidotes.🔽On the third, the obscurations to the afflictions of the desire realm, to the complete retention of what one has heard,

original: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun tu rmongs pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and to the antidotes to the afflictions of the desire realm.🔽On the fourth, the obscurations to craving meditative absorption, to craving the Dharma,

original: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and to the antidotes to the afflictions of the two higher realms.

original: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa de nyid yid la byed pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun tu rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa de nyid yid la byed pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa kun tu rmongs pa dang /
translated: And there is confusion about the attention that is directed exclusively away from samsara and is directed away from nirvana.🔽On the sixth, there is confusion about the actualization of the engagement of the formative forces, confusion about the occurrence of many signs,

original: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //🔽drug pa la ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du byas pa nyid la kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun tu byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // drug pa la ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du byas pa nyid la kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma mang po kun tu byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: and the unruliness that is the negative tendency of those two.🔽On the seventh, there is confusion about the occurrence of subtle signs, confusion about the method of single-pointed attention to the absence of signs,

original: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig tu yid la byed pa'i thabs kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so//
analyzed: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma phra mo kun tu 'byung ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa gcig tu yid la byed pa'i thabs kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so//
translated: and the unruliness that is the negative tendency of those two.

original: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsod pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma rnams la mi dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsod pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma rnams la mi dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the eighth, the confusion of dispute about the signless, the confusion of not mastering signs, and the resistance to their bad habit.

original: dgu pa la ni chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / @83a * //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / @83a * //
translated: On the ninth, the confusion of the power of retention of the boundless teaching of the Dharma, the confusion of the power of retention of the boundless words and letters of the Dharma,

original: gong nas gong du shes rab dang / spobs pa la gzungs kyi dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / spobs pa'i dbang la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gong nas gong du shes rab dang / spobs pa la gzungs kyi dbang ba kun tu rmongs pa dang / spobs pa'i dbang la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: the confusion of the power of retention of the wisdom and eloquence that are higher and higher, the confusion of the power of retention of eloquence, and the resistance to their bad habit.

original: sa bcu pa la ni mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba dang phra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba dang phra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: On the tenth, the confusion of the great superknowledges, the confusion of the engagement in the secret and subtle, and the resistance to their bad habit.

original: sangs rgyas kyis la ni shes bya thams cad la chags pa shin tu phra mo kun tu rmongs pa dang / thogs pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs de dag ni kun tu rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len bcu gcig po de ngag gi rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la ni shes bya thams cad la chags pa shin tu phra mo kun tu rmongs pa dang / thogs pa kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len mi mthun pa'i phyogs so // spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs de dag ni kun tu rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / gnas ngan len bcu gcig po de ngag gi rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mi ldan pa yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das gang la da ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar kun tu rmongs pa'i dra ba chen po rab tu dral cing de'i gnas ngan len thibs po chen po las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mi ldan pa yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das gang la da ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar kun tu rmongs pa'i dra ba chen po rab tu dral cing de'i gnas ngan len thibs po chen po las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration to the knowable.🔽The obscuration of the knowable is

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ci tsam du phan yon che zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ci tsam du phan yon che zhing /
translated: The unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is so beneficial and has such a great result.

original: 'bras bu che ba ni ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba ni ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: It is amazing.

original: bcom ldan 'das sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag gis rnam par gzhag lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag gis rnam par gzhag lags /
translated: Bhagavān, by how many purities are those bhūmis established?”

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs brgyad kyis te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyugs brgyad kyis te /
translated: “Avalokiteśvara, by eight:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / snying rje rnam par dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / snying rje rnam par dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byed pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: the purity of superior intention, the purity of mind, the purity of compassion, the purity of the perfections, the purity of seeing buddhas and serving them,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba rnam par dag pa dang / mthu rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba rnam par dag pa dang / mthu rnam par dag pas so //
translated: the purity of bringing beings to maturity, the purity of birth, and the purity of power.

original: spyan ras gzigs phyugs dang po la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa nas /🔽mthu rnam par dag pa'i gang yin pa dang / sa gong ma gong ma rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa nas /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs phyugs dang po la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa nas / mthu rnam par dag pa'i gang yin pa dang / sa gong ma gong ma rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa nas /
translated: The purity of superior intention and the purity of power of Avalokitesvara in the first stage

original: mthu rnam @83b par dag pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni ches rnam par dag pa dang / ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu rnam @83b par dag pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni ches rnam par dag pa dang / ches shin tu rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the purity of superior intention and the purity of power in the higher and higher stages up to the Buddha stage should be known as increasingly pure and increasingly purified.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi sa la skye ba rnam par dag pa ma rtogs pa dang / sa dang po'i yon tan gang dag yin pa de dag gis de'i gong ma'i sa rnams de'i yon tan dang yang mnyam la /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi sa la skye ba rnam par dag pa ma rtogs pa dang / sa dang po'i yon tan gang dag yin pa de dag gis de'i gong ma'i sa rnams de'i yon tan dang yang mnyam la /
translated: Therein, the purity of birth in the Buddha stage is not understood. The qualities of the first stage are equal to the qualities of the higher stages,

original: rang gi sa'i yon tan gyis kyang khyad par du 'phags par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa'i yon tan gyis kyang khyad par du 'phags par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: and they should be known as superior by the qualities of their own stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po thams cad ni yon tan bla na yod pa dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po thams cad ni yon tan bla na yod pa dag yin la /
translated: All ten Bodhisattva stages have surpassable qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni yon tan bla na med pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du srid par skye ba thams cad kyi nang na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni yon tan bla na med pa yin par rig par bya'o // bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du srid par skye ba thams cad kyi nang na /
translated: The stage of the Buddha is to be known as the unexcelled excellence of virtues.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skye bar mchog ces bgyi lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skye bar mchog ces bgyi lags /
translated: Blessed One, why is the birth of a bodhisattva considered the highest among all births in existence?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa bzhi pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa bzhi pa'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is because of four aspects:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / so sor brtags te len pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir rnying rje dang ldan pa nyid phyir dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par 'grub pa nyid kyi phyir dang / so sor brtags te len pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir rnying rje dang ldan pa nyid phyir dang /
translated: because of the accomplishment of extremely pure roots of virtue, because of taking up the vow, because of compassion for all beings,

original: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par zlog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and because of being oneself free from afflictions and causing the cessation of the afflictions of others.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du /
translated: Blessed One, why is the death of a bodhisattva considered the highest among all deaths?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba dang smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba dang smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can lags /
translated: Bodhisattvas go by means of vast aspirations, they have excellent aspirations, and they have the power of aspiration.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is for four reasons:

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas par mkhas pa dang / de myur du 'thob par nus pa dang / myur du 'thob pa de dang / bde bar gnas pa de yang spangs te /🔽sems can gyi don rgyu med pa /🔽dgos pa med pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la gnas par mkhas pa dang / de myur du 'thob par nus pa dang / myur du 'thob pa de dang / bde bar gnas pa de yang spangs te / sems can gyi don rgyu med pa / dgos pa med pa /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas are skilled in remaining in the happiness of nirvāṇa, they are able to attain it quickly, and they abandon that quick attainment and that happy abiding.🔽They mentally aspire to the occurrence of the many kinds of suffering of sentient beings🔽without cause

original: sdug bsngal mang po sna tshogs yun ring po 'byung ba la yid kyis smon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po sna tshogs yun ring po 'byung ba la yid kyis smon par byed pa ste /
translated: and without purpose.

original: de'i phyir smon lam rgya chen pos 'gro ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon lam rgya chen pos 'gro ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to go by means of vast aspirations, to have excellent aspirations, and to have the power of aspiration.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi du mchis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi du mchis lags /
translated: Blessed One, how many bases of training are there for bodhisattvas?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug drug ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug drug ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, there are six:

original: sbyin pa dang / @84a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / @84a * //
translated: generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab po //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab po //
translated: moral discipline, patience, perseverance, meditative stabilization, and wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las /
translated: Blessed One, among these six bases of training,

original: du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags /
translated: how many are training in higher moral discipline?

original: du ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa lags /
translated: How many are training in higher mental stability?

original: du ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa lags /
translated: How many are training in higher wisdom?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang po gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
