analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang po gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, you should know that the first three are training in higher moral discipline.

original: bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Meditative stabilization is training in higher mental stability.

original: shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Wisdom is training in higher wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o //
translated: I say that perseverance is universal.

original: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las /
translated: Blessed One, among these six bases of training,

original: du ni bsod nams kyi tshogs lags /
analyzed: du ni bsod nams kyi tshogs lags /
translated: how many are the accumulation of merit?

original: du ni ye shes kyi tshogs lags /
analyzed: du ni ye shes kyi tshogs lags /
translated: How many are the accumulation of wisdom?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phug lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phug lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, the training in superior morality is the accumulation of merit.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: The training in superior wisdom is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par snga smra'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par snga smra'o //
translated: I have already explained that effort and concentration are universal.

original: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag lags /
translated: Blessed One, among these six bases of training,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar bslab par bgyi lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar bslab par bgyi lags /
translated: how should bodhisattvas train?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, in five ways:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la thog ma kho na re shin tu mos pa dang / de'i 'og tu chos spyod pa bcu po dag gis thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la thog ma kho na re shin tu mos pa dang / de'i 'og tu chos spyod pa bcu po dag gis thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas bsgrub pa dang /
translated: One should practice with the ten activities of Dharma, with the knowledge that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: byang chub kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should protect the thought of awakening, rely on a spiritual friend, and apply oneself uninterruptedly to the side of virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bslab pa'i gzhi de dag rnam grangs drug tu gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bslab pa'i gzhi de dag rnam grangs drug tu gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
translated: Blessed One, why should one know that these bases of training are designated in six categories?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is for two reasons:

original: sems can la phan gdags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they benefit sentient beings and because they are antidotes to the afflictions.

original: de la gsum ni sems can la phan gdags pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gsum ni sems can la phan gdags pa yin la /
translated: Among them, three benefit sentient beings.

original: gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen @84b po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen @84b po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other three should be understood as antidotes to the afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas ni sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pas phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas ni sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pas phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva benefits sentient beings by means of giving, by providing them with the necessities of life.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par tho 'tshams pa nye bar ni sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par tho 'tshams pa nye bar ni sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so ;
translated: By means of morality, he benefits them by providing them with the necessities of life, with protection from harm and violence, and with the benefit of non-violence.

original: / bzod pas ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par tho 'tshams par ji mi snyam pas phan 'dogs te /
analyzed: / bzod pas ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par tho 'tshams par ji mi snyam pas phan 'dogs te /
translated: By means of patience, he benefits them by not retaliating when they harm him, by not retaliating when they violate him, and by not retaliating when they revile him.

original: de gsum gyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs so //🔽brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par ma bcil ba dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par ma bcom pas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs so // brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par ma bcil ba dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par ma bcom pas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: By means of these three, he benefits sentient beings.🔽By means of effort, he benefits them by applying himself to the wholesome side, without having suppressed or abandoned the afflictions.

original: de ni nyon mongs pas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba las bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba las bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: He cannot be moved from applying himself to the wholesome side by the afflictions.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon to //
translated: By means of meditative concentration, one suppresses the addictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal yang dag par 'joms par byed de /
translated: By means of wisdom, one destroys the instinct for the addictions.

original: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: These three are the antidotes to the addictions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhir gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhir gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
translated: Lord, why should the other perfections be known as the four kinds of aids?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa de dag nyid kyi grogs su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa de dag nyid kyi grogs su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokitesvara, because they are the very aids to those six perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan btags nas /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan btags nas /
translated: Therein, having benefited sentient beings by means of the three perfections,

original: byang chub sems dpas bsdu ba'i dngos pos zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bsdu ba'i dngos pos zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la 'jog par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva, by means of the means of the embracing things, establishes them in virtue.

original: de'i phyir ngas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum po 'di dag gi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum po 'di dag gi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: Therefore, I have taught that the perfection of means is the aid to these three.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa mang bas rtag tu bsgom mi nus pa dang / khams dang mos pa dman pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung bas sems nang du 'jog mi nus pa dang /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa mang bas rtag tu bsgom mi nus pa dang / khams dang mos pa dman pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung bas sems nang du 'jog mi nus pa dang /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, if bodhisattvas, because of many afflictions in this life, are unable to meditate all the time, and because of having inferior elements and inferior motivation, are unable to focus their minds inwardly,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa la bsam gtan yongs su ma bsgoms pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub mi nus pa yin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa la bsam gtan yongs su ma bsgoms pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub mi nus pa yin na /
translated: and because they have not cultivated meditative concentration on the objects of meditation that they have heard in the bodhisattva canon, are unable to accomplish supramundane wisdom,

original: de bsod nams kyi tshogs chung ngu yang yang dag par blangs te gnas shing phyi ma la nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon @85a * //
analyzed: de bsod nams kyi tshogs chung ngu yang yang dag par blangs te gnas shing phyi ma la nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon @85a * //
translated: then, having taken up a small accumulation of merit, they should mentally aspire to have few afflictions in the future.

original: par byed pa de ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: par byed pa de ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: That is their perfection of aspiration.

original: des nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur bas /
translated: Because of that, they will have few afflictions and be able to apply diligence.

original: de'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of vows is the support of the perfection of effort.

original: des skyes bu dam pa la yang yang dag par bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas /
analyzed: des skyes bu dam pa la yang yang dag par bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas /
translated: By relying on the holy person and listening to the holy Dharma,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa thob cing lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid rnam par bzlog nas /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa thob cing lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid rnam par bzlog nas /
translated: he attains proper mental attention and turns away from the weakness of his superior intention.

original: khams gya nom pa la bsam pa'i stobs 'thob par 'gyur ba de ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: khams gya nom pa la bsam pa'i stobs 'thob par 'gyur ba de ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: He attains the power of intention for the sublime element. That is his perfection of power.

original: des sems nang du 'jog nus pas de'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des sems nang du 'jog nus pas de'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because he is able to settle his mind internally, therefore, the perfection of power is the support of the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa la bsam gtan byed de /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa la bsam gtan byed de /
translated: He practices meditative stabilization on the object of meditation that is the scriptural collection of the bodhisattva that he has heard.

original: de ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: That is his perfection of wisdom.

original: des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par bsgrub nus par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par bsgrub nus par 'gyur bas /
translated: Because it is able to accomplish supramundane wisdom.

original: de'i phyir ngas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Therefore, I have taught that the perfection of knowledge

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: is the companion of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gi go rims de ltar bstan par rig par bgyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gi go rims de ltar bstan par rig par bgyi lags /
translated: Bhagavan, why should one know that the order of these six perfections is taught in this way?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag gong nas gong du 'grub pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag gong nas gong du 'grub pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is because they are the very supports for accomplishing the higher and higher.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: When bodhisattvas do not care about their bodies and possessions, they take up moral discipline.

original: tshul khrims rjes su bsrungs na bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽bzod pa dang ldan brtson 'grus brtsam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su bsrungs na bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro // bzod pa dang ldan brtson 'grus brtsam par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they guard moral discipline, they become patient.🔽When they are patient, they undertake perseverance.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na bsam gtan bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na bsam gtan bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they undertake perseverance, they accomplish meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan grub na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan grub na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'thob po //
translated: When concentration is achieved, one obtains supramundane wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rnam pa dur rab tu dbye lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rnam pa dur rab tu dbye lags /
translated: Bhagavat, how many kinds of perfections are there?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gsum du ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gsum du ste /
translated: Avalokitesvara, there are three kinds:

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni chos sbyin pa dang / zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni chos sbyin pa dang / zang zing sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of generosity are: generosity of the Dharma, generosity of material goods, and generosity of protection.

original: tshul khrims @85b rnam pa gsum ni mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims @85b rnam pa gsum ni mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The three kinds of morality are: morality of restraint from evil, morality of engagement in virtue, and morality of working for the benefit of others.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three kinds of patience are:

original: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: patience of tolerance of others' wrongs, patience of acceptance of suffering, and patience of confidence in the Dharma.🔽The three kinds of effort are: effort of aspiration, effort of perseverance, and effort of non-abandonment.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The three kinds of effort are: armor-effort, effort applied to virtue, and effort applied to the welfare of beings.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni rnam par mi rtog cing zhi la rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni rnam par mi rtog cing zhi la rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The three kinds of meditation are: meditation on the antidote to the afflictions and suffering, which is blissful abiding, free from discursive thought, calm, and very calm; meditation on the accomplishment of good qualities; and meditation on the accomplishment of the welfare of beings.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are: that which has as its object the conventional truth, that which has as its object the ultimate truth, and that which has as its object the welfare of beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa de dag pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes bgyi lags /
translated: “Blessed One, why are these perfections called perfections?”

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug lnga'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug lnga'i phyir te /
translated: “Avalokiteśvara, for five reasons.

original: chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of nonattachment, nonobservation, nontransgression, nonconceptuality, and transformation.

original: de la chags pa med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po la lhag par chags pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po la lhag par chags pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, nonattachment is the absence of excessive attachment to things that are contrary to the perfections.

original: de la mi lta ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / lan du phan thogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i sems med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi lta ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / lan du phan thogs pa dang / 'brel pa'i sems med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, nonobservation is the absence of a mind that expects a karmic reward or a karmic recompense for the result of the perfections.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang ma 'dres shing /
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang ma 'dres shing /
translated: Among them, nontransgression is the fact that those perfections are not mixed with afflicted phenomena.

original: thabs ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of inappropriate actions.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa'o //🔽de la yongs su bsngo ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid byas shing bstsags pa byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur @86a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med pa gang yin pa'o // de la yongs su bsngo ba nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag nyid byas shing bstsags pa byang chub chen po'i 'bras bur @86a * //
translated: Non-conceptuality is the absence of adherence to the literal meaning of those perfections.

original: smon pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Dedication is the aspiration for the fruit of great enlightenment of those perfections that have been practiced and accumulated.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po gang lags /
translated: Bhagavan, what are the things that are discordant with the perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag ni dngos po drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag ni dngos po drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, those should be known as six things:

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug dang / bdag nyid kyi bsod nams la yon tan gyi phan yon du lta ba dang / lus dang ngag dang yid ci 'dod dgur kun tu spyod pa dang / brnyas pa mi bzod pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / longs spyod dang / dbang phyug dang / bdag nyid kyi bsod nams la yon tan gyi phan yon du lta ba dang / lus dang ngag dang yid ci 'dod dgur kun tu spyod pa dang / brnyas pa mi bzod pa dang /
translated: the pleasure of desire, enjoyment, power, the view of the benefits of one's own merit, the conduct of body, speech, and mind in whatever way one wishes, and the inability to tolerate contempt.

original: mi brtson pa'i bsod nyams dang / 'du 'dzin dang / 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la 'jug pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phye ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad kyi spros pa dag la yon tan gyi phan yon du blta ba'o //
analyzed: mi brtson pa'i bsod nyams dang / 'du 'dzin dang / 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la 'jug pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phye ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad kyi spros pa dag la yon tan gyi phan yon du blta ba'o //
translated: the pursuit of distraction in the midst of society, the pursuit of distraction in the midst of worldly talk, the pursuit of distraction in the midst of various activities, the pursuit of distraction in the midst of various thoughts, the pursuit of distraction in the midst of various views, the pursuit of distraction in the midst of various hear- ings, the pursuit of distraction in the midst of various discriminations, and the pursuit of distraction in the midst of various consciousnesses.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang lags /
translated: Lord, what are the results of the fruitions of these perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de yang rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Avalokitesvara, you should know that they are of six kinds:

original: longs spyod chen po nyid dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / kho na med cing dbyen med la bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems can gyi bdag po dang / lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po nyid dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / kho na med cing dbyen med la bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems can gyi bdag po dang / lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa'o //
translated: great wealth, going to good destinies, being without enmity, being without disunity, having much happiness and joy, being a lord of sentient beings, having a body free from harm, and being famous for great power.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang 'dres pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang 'dres pa gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what are the defiled phenomena that are mixed in with those perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de ni sbyor ba bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de ni sbyor ba bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: Avaloki-teśvara, they should be understood through four applications:

original: snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba dang / rtag tu mi byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / gus par mi byed pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba dang / rtag tu mi byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / gus par mi byed pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: the application of lack of compassion, the application of incorrectness, the application of not always doing, and the application of lack of respect.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the application of incorrectness:

original: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag la de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs dang bral zhing bsgom pa nyams pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag la de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs dang bral zhing bsgom pa nyams pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the degeneration of the cultivation of the other perfections, which is the lack of the method of the other perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das thabs ma lags pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thabs ma lags pa gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is not a method?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa na /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa na /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, when bodhisattvas benefit sentient beings through those perfections,

original: gal te zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gal te zang zing gis phan 'dogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing /
translated: If one is satisfied with merely providing material assistance,

original: mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te dge ba'i @86b gnas su 'jog par mi byed na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te dge ba'i @86b gnas su 'jog par mi byed na /
translated: and does not lift them out of nonvirtue and establish them in virtue,

original: de ni thabs ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni thabs ma yin pa yin no //
translated: that is not the right means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de tsam gyis na sems can la phan btags pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de tsam gyis na sems can la phan btags pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is not because of that alone that one benefits sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is like this:

original: mi gtsang ba ni che yang rung chung yang rung ste rnam grangs gang gis kyang dri zhim por bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ni che yang rung chung yang rung ste rnam grangs gang gis kyang dri zhim por bya bar mi nus so //
translated: no matter how much or how little filth there is, it is impossible to make it fragrant by any means.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyang zang zing gis phan btags pa nye bar bsgrub pa tsam gyis rnam grangs gang gis kyang bde bar bya mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyang zang zing gis phan btags pa nye bar bsgrub pa tsam gyis rnam grangs gang gis kyang bde bar bya mi nus kyi /
translated: In the same way, sentient beings who are by nature suffering due to the suffering of conditioned existence cannot be made happy by any means through merely providing material assistance.

original: dge ba la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni de dag la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni de dag la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog kho na yin no //
translated: That is the best way to help them.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rnam par dag pa du mchis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rnam par dag pa du mchis lags /
translated: Blessed One, how many kinds of purity are there for the perfections?🔽Avalokiteśvara, I do not say that there are any other kinds of purity for the perfections apart from those five kinds.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nga ni rnam pa lnga po de dag ma gtogs par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gzhan yod par mi smra mod kyi 'on kyang de dag nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nga ni rnam pa lnga po de dag ma gtogs par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa gzhan yod par mi smra mod kyi 'on kyang de dag nyid la brten nas /
translated: However, based on those very perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa dang so sor phye ba khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa dang so sor phye ba khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain to you the concise and detailed purities of the perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa ni rnam pa bdun gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa bsdus pa ni rnam pa bdun gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: The purity of all the perfections should be understood in terms of seven points.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos de dag gis gzhan las shes kyi khe yongs su mi tshol ba dang / chos de dag la lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa dang / chos 'di dag kyang byang chub tu nges par 'byin pa yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis dang the tshom skyed par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos de dag gis gzhan las shes kyi khe yongs su mi tshol ba dang / chos de dag la lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa dang / chos 'di dag kyang byang chub tu nges par 'byin pa yin nam ma yin snyam du yid gnyis dang the tshom skyed par mi byed pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not seek profit from others through these teachings, do not become attached to these teachings by viewing them, and do not give rise to doubt or uncertainty as to whether or not these teachings will definitely lead to enlightenment.

original: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod cing brnyas par mi byed pa dang / dregs par mi byed cing bag med par mi byed pa dang / cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / chos de dag gis ser sna med cing gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod gzhan la mi smod cing brnyas par mi byed pa dang / dregs par mi byed cing bag med par mi byed pa dang / cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa dang / chos de dag gis ser sna med cing gzhan dag la phrag dog mi byed pa yin no //
translated: They do not praise themselves, disparage others, or look down on anyone, are not arrogant, are not heedless, are not satisfied with just a little or just a little bit, and are not stingy with these teachings or jealous of others.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa so so tha dad pa de yang rnam pa bdun kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa so so tha dad pa de yang rnam pa bdun kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: The purity of the perfections should be understood as being of seven types.

original: tha dad pa rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven types of purity?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sbyin pa rnam par dag pa bdun po sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par @87a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam par dag pa bdun po sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par @87a * //
translated: The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.🔽The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.🔽The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.🔽The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.

original: dag pa dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / ngag rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / dri ma rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed do zhes ngas bstan pa gang yin pa de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de ni sbyin pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dag pa dang / lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / ngag rnam par dag pa dang / shes pa rnam par dag pa dang / dri ma rnam par dag pas sbyin pa rnam par dag pa sbyin par byed do zhes ngas bstan pa gang yin pa de dag byang chub sems dpas yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de ni sbyin pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.🔽The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.🔽The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the accompaniment, the purity of the application, and the purity of the dedication.🔽The seven pure gifts are the pure gift given by the bodhisattva who is established in the pure gift through the purity of the thing given, the purity of the giver, the purity of the field, the purity of the motivation, the purity of the

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa bcas pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa dang / ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / de la nges pa'i tshul khrims can dang / brtan pa'i tshul khrims can dang / rtag tu byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa bcas pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa dang / ltung ba las bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / de la nges pa'i tshul khrims can dang / brtan pa'i tshul khrims can dang / rtag tu byed pa dang /
translated: Bodhisattvas are skilled in all the aspects of the precepts of the bodhisattva vow, skilled in the means of rising from downfalls, they are endowed with definite morality, steadfast morality, constant practice,

original: rtag tu 'jug pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: rtag tu 'jug pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te /
translated: constant engagement, and they train in the precepts that they have taken up.

original: slob par byed pa de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //
analyzed: slob par byed pa de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //
translated: This is the sevenfold purity of morality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.🔽When all kinds of harm are being done to them, they are unshaken, relying on the ripening of their own karma.

original: thams cad las gnod pa thams cad nye bar gnas pa na bdag nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas mi 'khrug pa dang / lan bya ba'i phyir slar spyo ba dang / gshe ba dang / rdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad las gnod pa thams cad nye bar gnas pa na bdag nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas mi 'khrug pa dang / lan bya ba'i phyir slar spyo ba dang / gshe ba dang / rdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa dang /
translated: They do not retaliate by scolding, insulting, beating, or threatening others.

original: ma tshang 'dru ba'i gnod pa dag gis sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / khon gyi bsam pa mi 'dzin pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa na yongs su nyon mongs par mi byed pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa la mi sdod pa dang /
analyzed: ma tshang 'dru ba'i gnod pa dag gis sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / khon gyi bsam pa mi 'dzin pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa na yongs su nyon mongs par mi byed pa dang / shad kyis 'chags pa la mi sdod pa dang /
translated: He does not make use of the harm that is done to him in return. He does not hold grudges. He does not become emotionally involved when he is being asked for something. He does not delay in giving.

original: 'jigs pa dang / zang zing gi sems kyis bzod par byed pa ma yin pa dang / phan gdags par bya ba la yal bar mi 'dor ba de ni bzod pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / zang zing gi sems kyis bzod par byed pa ma yin pa dang / phan gdags par bya ba la yal bar mi 'dor ba de ni bzod pa rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //
translated: He does not give out of fear, nor with a mind attached to material things, nor does he neglect those whom he should help. This is the sevenfold purity of patience.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The sevenfold purity of effort is as follows:

original: brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa mnyam pa nyid rab tu shes pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa des bdag la mi stod cing zhan mi snod pa dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa mnyam pa nyid rab tu shes pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa des bdag la mi stod cing zhan mi snod pa dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He knows the sameness of the aspects of effort. He does not praise himself for undertaking effort, nor does he disparage others. He is powerful, energetic, and enthusiastic.

original: rtul ba brtan pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson pa ma btang ba de ni brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtul ba brtan pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson pa ma btang ba de ni brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of pure meditation are:🔽meditation on the concentration that is the clear realization of the signs,🔽meditation on the concentration that is complete,🔽meditation on the concentration that is both aspects,

original: mtshan ma legs par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam @87b gtan pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / shugs kyis 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma legs par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam @87b gtan pa dang / gnyi ga'i cha'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / shugs kyis 'byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang /
translated: meditation on the concentration that arises by force,🔽meditation on the concentration that is non-abiding,🔽meditation on the concentration that is well-trained, and🔽meditation on the concentration that is the infinite cultivation of the object of meditation of the complete Bodhisattva Canon.

original: mi gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi dmigs pa yongs su bsgom pa dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa de ni bsam gtan rnam par dag pa rnam par bdun pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi dmigs pa yongs su bsgom pa dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bsam gtan pa de ni bsam gtan rnam par dag pa rnam par bdun pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of pure wisdom are:

original: de'i shes rab de sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs te ;
analyzed: de'i shes rab de sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs te ;
translated: Their wisdom is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba dang / shes rab des stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po dag la rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung ba dang / shes rab des stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po dag la rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: They are liberated by the middle way, and with that wisdom they know the meaning of the doors of liberation just as it is, namely, the three doors of liberation of emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness.

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum po dag la ngo bo nyid kyi don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / mtshan nyid dang skye ba dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gsum po dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum po dag la ngo bo nyid kyi don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / mtshan nyid dang skye ba dang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gsum po dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: They know the meaning of the three natures just as it is, namely, the imputed, the dependent, and the real. They know the meaning of the three types of identitylessness just as it is, namely, the identitylessness of phenomena, the identitylessness of the person, and the ultimate identitylessness.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la /
translated: They also know the meaning of conventional truth in the five sciences exactly as it is.🔽And they know the meaning of ultimate truth in the seven aspects of thatness exactly as it is.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog cing spros pa med la /🔽tshul gcig tu de la mang du gnas pa dang 'dres pa tshad med pa'i chos la dmigs pa med pa'i lhag mthong gis chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de ni shes rab rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i don kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / rnam par mi rtog cing spros pa med la / tshul gcig tu de la mang du gnas pa dang 'dres pa tshad med pa'i chos la dmigs pa med pa'i lhag mthong gis chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de ni shes rab rnam par dag pa rnam pa bdun
translated: They are free of discursive thought and conceptual elaboration.🔽They abide in thatness and in the single way, and they accomplish the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma through the nonconceptual and unelaborate insight that focuses on immeasurable and infinite phenomena.

original: yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the sevenfold purity of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa lnga po de dag gi so so'i las gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa lnga po de dag gi so so'i las gang lags /
translated: Lord, what are the individual functions of these five aspects?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag gi las kyang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag gi las kyang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: Avaloki­tisvara, their functions should be understood as fivefold.

original: chags pa med pa nyid kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas bag yod par byed do //🔽mi lta ba nyid kyis ni phyi @88a * //
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid kyis ni byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas bag yod par byed do // mi lta ba nyid kyis ni phyi @88a * //
translated: By being free from attachment, the bodhisattva is heedful in this life, by applying himself constantly and respectfully to the transcendences.

original: ma la de dag la bag yod pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: ma la de dag la bag yod pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: By being disinterested, he takes up the cause of heedfulness in the future.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba dag sgom par byed do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su sbyang ba dag sgom par byed do //
translated: By being irreproachable, he cultivates the transcendences to complete fulfillment, to purification, and to refinement.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis ni thabs la mkhas pa des myur du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis ni thabs la mkhas pa des myur du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By being nonconceptual, he quickly fulfills the transcendences by that skillful means.

original: yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du tshe rabs thams cad du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa nyid thob par byed do /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba nyid kyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du tshe rabs thams cad du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa nyid thob par byed do /
translated: By means of dedication, one obtains the inexhaustible perfections in all one's lives, up to the supreme enlightenment, together with the desired fruitional results.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rgya che ba nyid gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi rgya che ba nyid gang lags /
translated: Bhagavan, what is the vastness of these perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug chags pa med pa nyid dang / mi lta ba nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is nonattachment, nonobservation, and dedication.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa nyid gang lags /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa nyid gang lags /
translated: What is their nonaffliction?

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is nontransgression and nonconceptuality.

original: gsal ba nyid gang lags /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid gang lags /
translated: What is their clarity?

original: so sor rtog cing bya ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog cing bya ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is discernment and activity.

original: mi g-yo ba nyid gang lags /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba nyid gang lags /
translated: What is their stability?

original: sar chud pa rnams kyi yongs su mi mnyam pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sar chud pa rnams kyi yongs su mi mnyam pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the unequalled reality of those who have entered the stages.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid gang lags /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid gang lags /
translated: What is their extreme purity?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sa bcu par gtogs pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug sa bcu par gtogs pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is that which is included in the tenth stage and that which is included in the stage of the Buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa bas ma 'chal ba dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa ma 'tshal ba dang ldan pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa bas ma 'chal ba dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa'i sa ma 'tshal ba dang ldan pa lags /
translated: Bhagavat, why is it that the bodhisattvas are not confused about the results that are the evolutionary maturations of the perfections, and are endowed with the perfections that are not known to be stages?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gcig la gcig brten nas 'grub pa bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gcig la gcig brten nas 'grub pa bsgom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is because they are cultivated in dependence on each other.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ji lta ba de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa la dad pas gnas pa ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ji lta ba de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa la dad pas gnas pa ma lags /
translated: Bhagavat, why is it that the bodhisattvas do not abide in faith in the results that are the evolutionary maturations of the perfections as they do in the perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyu lnga'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyu lnga'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokitesvara, it is because of five causes.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni ches lhag par bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / @88b phyi ma la de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni ches lhag par bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / @88b phyi ma la de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The perfections are causes of superior pleasure and mental satisfaction, causes of benefit for oneself and others, causes of the desired results of evolutionary development in the future,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: bases of nonaddicted activity, and the nature of immutability.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi so so'i mthu gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi so so'i mthu gang lags /
translated: Bhagavan, what are the individual powers of the perfections?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag gi so so'i mthu ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de dag gi so so'i mthu ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Avalokitesvara, their individual powers should be understood as fourfold.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa na /
translated: When the perfections are cultivated,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems 'khrul pa dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa rab tu spong ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems 'khrul pa dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa rab tu spong ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They are the complete abandonment of stinginess, immorality, confusion of mind, laziness, distraction, and the various views, and they are the accumulation for unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: tshe 'di la bdag dang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa rgya chen po zad mi shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bdag dang sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa rgya chen po zad mi shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are beneficial in this life for oneself and all sentient beings, and in future lives they bring about the attainment of an inexhaustible great mass of desirable results.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rgyu gang las byung ba dang / 'bras bu gang dang ldan pa dang / don gang dang ldan pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa de dag rgyu gang las byung ba dang / 'bras bu gang dang ldan pa dang / don gang dang ldan pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, from what causes do these perfections arise? What are their results? What is their meaning?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni snying rje'i rgyu las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang ; sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa dang / byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i don chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni snying rje'i rgyu las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang ; sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa dang / byang chub chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i don chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Avalokiteśvara: The perfections arise from the cause of compassion, and they have the result of evolutionary development, the result of conscious creation, and the result of separation. They have the great result of accomplishing great enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod pas ma 'tshal ba dang ldan pa dang / snying rje can lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod pas ma 'tshal ba dang ldan pa dang / snying rje can lags na /
translated: Lord: If the bodhisattvas are endowed with the enjoyment of wealth and compassion,

original: ci'i slad du 'jig rten na dbul po gda' lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'jig rten na dbul po gda' lags /
translated: why are there poor people in the world?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de ni sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug de ni sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pa kho na yin no //
translated: Avalokiteśvara: That is due to the fault of sentient beings themselves.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te sems can rnams kyi rang gis nyes par byas pa de'i gags su gyur pa ma yin du zin na /
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams kyi rang gis nyes par byas pa de'i gags su gyur pa ma yin du zin na /
translated: if it were not due to the fault of sentient beings themselves,

original: de dag la rtag tu bya ba nyid la zhugs pa dang / longs spyod mi zad pa nyid yod bzhin du 'jig rten na sdug bsngal ba lta snang bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag la rtag tu bya ba nyid la zhugs pa dang / longs spyod mi zad pa nyid yod bzhin du 'jig rten na sdug bsngal ba lta snang bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that, while they are constantly engaged in their activities and have inexhaustible wealth, they appear in the world as if they were suffering?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is like this:

original: yi dags lus skom pas gdungs pa rnams kyis rgya mtsho'i chu skams par mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: yi dags lus skom pas gdungs pa rnams kyis rgya mtsho'i chu skams par mthong ba de ni /
translated: hungry ghosts tormented by thirst see the water of the ocean as dry.

original: @89a * // rgya mtsho dag gi nyes pa ma yin gyi yi dags de dag nyid kyi rang gi las kyi 'bras bu'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: @89a * // rgya mtsho dag gi nyes pa ma yin gyi yi dags de dag nyid kyi rang gi las kyi 'bras bu'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: This is not a fault of the ocean, but a fault of the hungry ghosts’ own karmic result.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: In the same way, the fact that there are those who do not receive the results of their generosity

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa dag gis rgya mtsho lta bur gyur pa rnams kyi nyes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa dag gis rgya mtsho lta bur gyur pa rnams kyi nyes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: is not a fault of the bodhisattvas, who are like an ocean of generosity.

original: sems can rang gis nyes pa byas pa yi dags lta bu rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rang gis nyes pa byas pa yi dags lta bu rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pa yin no //
translated: It is a fault of the sentient beings who are like hungry ghosts, due to their own bad karma.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid /
translated: Blessed One, the nonexistence of the entities of phenomena is the bodhisattvas’🔽

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis 'dzin pa lags /
translated: Blessed One, by which perfections do bodhisattvas apprehend the lack of intrinsic reality of phenomena?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dzin to //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dzin to //
translated: Avaloki-teśvara, they apprehend it by means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa nyid 'dzin na /
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom apprehends the lack of intrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid kyang ci'i slad du mi 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid kyang ci'i slad du mi 'dzin pa lags /
translated: why does it not also apprehend intrinsic reality?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug / nga ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid 'dzin par mi smra mod kyi 'on kyang yi ges bstan pa med par ngo bo nyid med pa yi ge med pa /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug / nga ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid 'dzin par mi smra mod kyi 'on kyang yi ges bstan pa med par ngo bo nyid med pa yi ge med pa /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, I do not say that intrinsic reality is apprehended by the lack of intrinsic reality, but rather, without being taught by means of words, the lack of intrinsic reality cannot be taught without words,

original: so so rang gis rig pa de bstan par mi nus pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin to zhes de skad brjod do //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa de bstan par mi nus pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid 'dzin to zhes de skad brjod do //
translated: and that which is to be known by oneself cannot be taught. Therefore, it is said that the lack of intrinsic reality is apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, it is also called a perfection.

original: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bgyi /
analyzed: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bgyi /
translated: It is also called a proximate perfection.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes kyang bgyi lags na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes kyang bgyi lags na /
translated: It is also called a great perfection.

original: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is a perfection?

original: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is a proximate perfection?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ni gang lags /🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dus dpag tu med pa nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ni gang lags / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dus dpag tu med pa nas /
translated: What is a great perfection?

original: yongs su bsgoms pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yongs su bsgoms pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, here a bodhisattva is endowed with the wholesome states of generosity and so on that have been cultivated for immeasurable time.

original: de la nyon mongs pa yang kun tu 'byung zhing de zil gyis gnon par ni mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa yang kun tu 'byung zhing de zil gyis gnon par ni mi nus kyi /
translated: And afflictions arise for him, and he is unable to overcome them.

original: des zil gyis non par 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des zil gyis non par 'gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Rather, they overwhelm him.🔽This is called a perfection.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring la zhugs pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring la zhugs pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in the small and middling stages of the stage of action out of faith is called one who has entered the stage of a pure attitude.

original: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas ches yongs su bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing de la nyon mongs pa yang kun tu 'byung la /
analyzed: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas ches yongs su bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing de la nyon mongs pa yang kun tu 'byung la /
translated: Moreover, from time without beginning, they are endowed with those very wholesome qualities that have been cultivated to a high degree, and the afflictions arise in them.

original: de zil gyis gnon cig des zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de zil gyis gnon cig des zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: But they are not overwhelmed by them,

original: sa dang po nas gzung @89b bde ni nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po nas gzung @89b bde ni nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and from the first stage onward, they are called “perfections.”

original: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas ches shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: yang dus dpag tu med pa nas ches shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag nyid dang ldan zhing /
translated: Moreover, from time without beginning, they are endowed with those very wholesome qualities that have been cultivated to a high degree,

original: de la thams cad kyi thams cad du nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'i chos can du gyur pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi thams cad du nyon mongs pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'i chos can du gyur pa 'di lta ste /
translated: and the afflictions never arise in them at all.

original: sa brgyad pa nas gzung ba de ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa nas gzung ba de ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: And from the eighth stage onward, they are called “great perfections.”

original: bcom ldan 'das sa de dag la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal rnam pa du mchis lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sa de dag la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal rnam pa du mchis lags /
translated: Bhagavat, how many kinds of latent afflictions are there on those stages?

original: spyan ras gzigs phyug / rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs phyug / rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, there are three kinds:

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug grogs yang dag par bcom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug grogs yang dag par bcom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The power of the friend is destroyed in the following way.

original: sa lnga po dag la nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa kun tu 'byung ba'i grogs nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa kun tu 'byung ba de'i tshe la de med pas de'i phyir grogs yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa lnga po dag la nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa kun tu 'byung ba'i grogs nyon mongs pa lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa kun tu 'byung ba de'i tshe la de med pas de'i phyir grogs yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: On the five stages, the friend of the innate afflictions that arise is the arising of the non-innate afflictions. At that time, since they do not exist, it is said that the friend is destroyed.

original: bag la nyal stobs chung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal stobs chung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The power of the latent afflictions is weak in the following way.

original: sa drug pa dang / bdun pa la cha phra mo kun tu 'byung ba nyid dang / bsgom pas mnan pas kun tu 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sa drug pa dang / bdun pa la cha phra mo kun tu 'byung ba nyid dang / bsgom pas mnan pas kun tu 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: On the sixth and seventh stages, they arise in a subtle way and they arise through being suppressed by meditation.

original: bag la nyal phra mo ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal phra mo ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The latent afflictions are subtle in the following way.

original: sa brgyad pa dang / de'i gong ma rnams la nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi thams cad du kun tu mi 'byung ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa tsam la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dang / de'i gong ma rnams la nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi thams cad du kun tu mi 'byung ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa tsam la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: On the eighth stage and above, they do not arise at all and they are present only as the obscurations to omniscience.

original: / bcom ldan 'das bag la nyal de dag gnas ngan len spangs pa rnam pa dus rab tu phye ba lags /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das bag la nyal de dag gnas ngan len spangs pa rnam pa dus rab tu phye ba lags /
translated: Bhagavan, how many types of elimination of the negative tendencies are there?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, there are two types.

original: gnas ngan len spags shun la yod pa lta bu spangs pas ni dang po dang gnyis pa rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len spags shun la yod pa lta bu spangs pas ni dang po dang gnyis pa rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The first and second are distinguished by the elimination of the negative tendencies that are like the husk.
